Summary: Great place to stay - highly recommend. Very clean, modern and spacious. Layout of Kids Suite with bunk beds was smart - lots of room and lots of counterspace in sleeping areas and bathroom. Washing machines & dryers did not function well. Parking was easy, hot breakfast was generous. Staff was very helpful. Rooftop pool with the view of California Adventure (and Disney fireworks) was wonderful! Coffee shop and drugstore downstairs, which was very convenient. Location was an easy 10-15min walk to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: A great stay close to Disneyland
Summary: My husband and I stayed here over a long weekend trip to Disneyland for my birthday. We enjoyed having a room with a little extra space, the breakfast was delicious (Mickey waffles!). The location can’t be beat (walk to Disneyland in ten-ish minutes, there’s a CVS & A Coffee Bean in the building, plus a 24 hour Walgreens, a Starbucks, and a 7-11 at the intersection). Hotel was very clean and quiet, parking was easy.   If I could make one suggestion, I wish they would add an EV charger in the parking garage.
Room tip: Parking seems likely to be limited during high capacity times

Summary: Internet was not working for 3+ days and NO temporary solution was deployed. Apart from that hotel was fairly clean. Housekeeping could be better as we found a bag of popcorn in the microwave upon check in. Breakfast is great.
Manager Response: Dear 787dillanl,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Springhill Suites with us.  It appears from your feedback that there were a few challenges during your stay with Internet performance. In today’s modern world, we certainly understand how important Internet performance is to ensuring an enjoyable stay, whether it’s to stay connected with colleagues during business travel or with family and friends during leisure adventures.  I truly apologize that the service was not fully functional during your stay. I, along with all other hotel associates, are passionate about offering the best possible experience to all of our guests and are subsequently looking into ways to improve the reliability of our Internet service.  Thank you again for taking the time to share your feedback with us!

Summary: Stayed at this hotel to be near the happiest place on earth. Everything was going well up until a few days into our stay. We asked the front desk to bring up a few rolls of toilet paper, as we weren't having room service. The front desk said they could just give us the rolls when we asked for them. Shame on me for not taking them then! We were on our way to Disneyland with 3 kids and wanted to go versus walking the TP up to our room. HUGE MISTAKE! The TP was delivered by housekeeping while we were gone. It was set on the dresser that was just inside the door of our room. It just so happens, my daughter's iPod was also nearby on the same dresser. When we came back after a long day, my daughter noticed her iPod was gone. We reported to the front desk the exact day/timeframe it
Manager Response: Dear cjack007, Thank you for choosing to stay at the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and providing your honest feedback with our team. We are glad to hear that our close proximity to the Disneyland resort was a perfect match for you.  We apologize that this happened to you and we did conduct a thorough investigation; however, nothing was found. On behalf of the entire team we apologize for any inconvenience you and your party experienced. Exceeding our guest needs are always a high priority, and our Management and staff work diligently to ensure all guidelines are being followed and provide welcoming accommodations with attention to craft and detail to all of our guests.

Summary: We visited this campus twice this year and we like. My son loves the Mickey Mouse pancake. Walking distance to the Disneyland and it’s very convenient.   Though it caught me off guard that there was small red stains on the bottom  of the right corner bed sheet and I didn’t know until check out. I was sleeping on a stain bedsheet the whole time. It’s a miss.

We booked 2 suites for our family during our Disneyland excursion!  The front desk staff were outstanding!  Friendly, funny, willing to help with any problem or question.  Polite and respectful always.  Check in an check our was easy-peasy.  The rooms were comfortable and big enough to stretch out in, have privacy and visit with family members.  Bathroom was larger than normal, they could have provided more towels to begin with, but getting more was not a problem.  Our toilet seemed to run constantly and we called and within minutes they were there to fix it. Our only complaint was that we asked for fresh towels one morning as we were leaving and when we returned they had not been delivered.  A quick call to the desk and within 5 minutes we had a set of towels with extas.
Room tip: Not really a bad room that we notice.  Top floor, 5, has aces to pool and patio easy viewpoints...

Summary: We've stayed at a lot of the Marriott properties around Disneyland. I am a Bonvoy Titanium Elite member. This property is fantastic.  We have stayed at the Residence Inn the most, which shares the parking lot with the Springhill Suites. The front desk at the Residence Inn is NOT friendly, so we decided to give Springhill Suites a try. The staff is over the top helpful and friendly. Any issue we had, they took care of quickly.  The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We will stay here again for sure. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Great location, helpful staff, comfy room - but very noisy!
Summary: Our family enjoyed 3 nights at this hotel for a long weekend at Disney. We were in a family suite and our two teens really appreciated each having their own bed.   There are lots of "Pros" for this hotel: The location is terrific. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very well done and really appreciated having some gluten free options to accommodate an allergy in our family.  Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable.  Two cons:  1. Walls and ceilings are paper thin - we had noisy neighbors next to and above us and it was like they were in our room with us. We could make out every word of conversations in the hall outside our room. Even the street noise was really loud. Not sure what the hotel could possibly do about any of that, but it is an issue when
Room tip: Try to avoid facing the street - Also, having a corner room would give you less chance of noisy...

Summary: We stayed here on a recent trip to disneyland and whilst the restaurants were not amazing the rooms and pool were fabulous. We felt really comfortable and very close to the parks and convention centres.

Summary Heading: The best stay for our family Visiting Disneyland!
Summary: Staff goes above and beyond to please everyone. From the reception to amenities to breakfast to easiness SPECIALLY, if you have kids!  The breakfast every morning has plenty to please everyone.  The reception and welcome team is very helpful, guides you to their best choices on what you are looking for.  We needed a couple of mobility scooters and having so many companies available, it was hard to decide or to call last minute every single one and find out best deal but, staff at hotel made so easy to choose.  Mr. Joseph at the front desk was so helpful and pleasant, friendly and approachable. Thank you for the best stay in a hotel to visit Disneyland ! Thank you for taking such good care of my family. We’ll see you soon.
Room tip: Get to breakfast early. It’s very yummy!

Summary: You would think while visiting the happiest place on earth (Disneyland) with your family, you can trust that your personal belongings in the hotel room would be safe while you’re gone. Think again. While we were just two days into our trip, we requested that our room be serviced. That same day, we had over $1400 worth of personal items stolen out of our room, in addition to stolen credit cards which the perpetrator charged over $1200 worth of goods at a local Target. Our car keys were also stolen. The hotel would not even call the police for me to file a police report. I was instructed that if I wanted to file a police report, that I would have to call myself. This hotel has insufficient security measures in place. The hallways on each floor do not have cameras and there are no
Manager Response: Dear Palms007- Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback. I apologize you left our hotel from your trip not completely satisfied and we take your feedback seriously. The safety of our guests of our hotel are top priorities. I immediately took the necessary steps to investigate your reported concerns. The guestroom was immediately inspected by the GM as soon as you reported charges from a department store located in another city during your stay. I advised that there was no forced entry and that no one entered the room without your prior approval. After I followed up with you, I was glad to hear that you and your family stayed at our hotel four more nights. On behalf of the entire team we apologize for any inconvenience you and your party experienced. Exceeding our guest needs are always a high priority, and our Management and staff work diligently to ensure all guidelines are being followed and provide welcoming accommodations with attention to craft and detail to all of our guests.   Warmest regards, Dan Kramer General Manager Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center

Summary: 2 queens were comfortable and nice to have a separate seating area, lots of space.  Our room overlooked the park, so saw the fireworks, that was fun.  The breakfast was good, try the Mickey Waffles!  All the staff was welcoming, 15 minute walk, and was very pleasant with lots of vegetation and lights.  A HUGE plus was the CVS that was right next door.  I was able to get a bottle of wine the first night, some ramen the second night as we were cold and wet from Splash Mountain.

Summary Heading: Nice Stay for a trip to the Parks
Summary: This hotel was nice and the rooms were as advertised. Parking at the hotel was easy and the staff was friendly. The breakfast area was busy but well stocked. Having a CVS on the first floor was very convenient. The only issue we had was we requested maid service one day and they never came.

My review below was from two years ago. We were happy with our stay, despite wear and tear in the room. We decided to stay there again this time, and funny enough we were in the exact room we had last time!  When we first entered the room, there was garbage on the bunk bed ladder. The carpet also hadnt been vacuumed, and the lightbulbs in the living room area were burned out. They came and vacuumed and replaced the bulb when we asked.  The room was pretty clean after that (other than realizing the top bunk bed hadn’t been changed). But what made me sad to see is how worn out it was. Torn/worn out carpet starting to shred. Peeling edge on the mirror, wood chipped and worn everywhere. Even all of that was manageable.  But where I really got concerned was when each morning, my five
Manager Response: Dear ilovepiano: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your Anaheim and Disney Resort area visit and for the candid review. We want every guest who stays with us to have an enriching experience and to see our commitment to exceptional hospitality.  I apologize you left our hotel from your trip not completely satisfied and we take your feedback seriously. The health and safety of our guests, along with cleanliness of our hotel are top priorities. Once we saw your survey a few days after you checked out, we took the necessary steps to investigate your reported concerns. The guestroom was inspected  and the room was negative for the presence of any bed bugs. We are always dedicated to shaping quality experiences and we will work diligently to ensure we are more consistent in our delivery of product and service.     Sincerely, DANIEL KRAMER General Manager Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center

Summary: The hotel was walking distance to Disneyland. It was nice to have breakfast available for families. We had a small issue w the room and it was addressed promptly. I must say the staff was diligently trying to appease my family and I. There is a connected coffee bean and pizza hut across the parking lot. The rooms were average as far as wear and tear. The rooftop pool was nice but probably only fit for one family due to the size and Covid-19 precautions. Parking fee applies but again walking distance to the park and restaurants. We left two days early a little sore from all of the walking and in need of a comfy bed available at home. I appreciate the staff including maintenance. I would recommend the hotel to the average family but not for the hotel snob. I hope this helps.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Hotel for large family for Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed here; October 27-November 1; for a holiday trip to Disneyland. We are a family of 6; and loved this hotel. We got a kids suite with bunk beds and 2 queens.   The room was clean, the hotel lobby smells amazing, was always clean and the staff was great.   The complimentary breakfast was FANTASTIC! Make your own Mickey waffles, toast, bagels, croissants, breakfast sandwiches, oatmeal and all the toppings, yogurt and fruit, eggs, breakfast meat, cereal, really a great breakfast before the parks.   The parking garage was under the hotel accessed only by room key; and we never experienced any issues, felt safe and clean.   The walk to Disneyland was probably 10 minutes, but felt quick and super easy.   The CVS under the store was stocked full of necessities; and wasn’t

As an AP (well, whatever they will be calling it in the future) and living out of state I have stayed in most of the chain hotels up and down Harbor and this one is my top 2 hotels.  Location is incredible and the staff is wonderful.  I even asked for a few amenities prior to arrival (lotion) and it was already in the room upon arrival.   They are still doing a breakfast (as of end of June) however the line is long as it is served to you by the staff.  I so appreciate that the coffee is outside the line so that I didn't have to wait.   This is our new go to property when visiting the Happiest Place on Earth.  Keep it up!

First of all it lists covid guidelines for face mask what they fail to mention is that you need to schedule cleaning as they won’t clean your due to covid! So you need to schedule it and that’s exactly what I did make sure you follow thru and don’t depend on one employee to follow thru to schedule the service for cleaning which is what we expect normally! Call in the am to confirm as no one came to clean the room and by the time we got back from the park after closing there is no one on staff to clean the room. So after I ordered everything so we can make are own beds and get new bath towels and blankets they deliver enough to make one bed so I guess make you specifically tell them exactly how many bed changes you as a hotel guests needs to make your own bed! Next time I guess
Manager Response: Dear G4410ZZpaulv- Thank you for taking the time to evaluate our hotel. We are truly sorry your stay was not the positive experience you deserve. We strive to provide each guest with a seamless experience, and we regret not meeting this goal. In regard to housekeeping service, we are asking our guests to notify our staff (usually the night before) when you would like our Housekeeping team to enter the room. We are still offering housekeeping service and this as a courtesy to all guests. this allows our guests the peace of mind that they are the only ones that have been in the room since they have checked in. Our staff will provide Tidy service when the guest is ready for us to enter the room. I apologize for any inconvenience we may have caused you and your party in regard to the scheduling error . We have three areas for parking. We have our Underground parking lot, surface parking spots near the lobby, and our 5-level parking garage located across from our lobby entrance. Your guest room keys allow access to either parking structure. Thank you for your patience, and we will take the appropriate action to ensure all of our guests have a worry free and relaxing stay. Once again, on behalf of the entire staff, I apologize for any inconvenience you experienced during your stay.  I hope you have a Magical and Safe 2021.  Sincerely, DANIEL KRAMER General Manager

Summary: We stay in a LOT of hotels! But this was by far the best experience we've had. The rooms were clean and beautiful. The service was absolutely amazing, and the general manager was so friendly and helpful! We recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely be back!

TL:DR - Surprisingly Spacious Rooms, Close to Disneyland  I've stayed at this property a couple times. The staff is always very friendly and accommodating. I had only booked one night through my Marriott points redemption and wanted to see if I could book a second night, but stay in the same room. The front desk staff immediately took care of my request and made sure that I would not be booted from the room. Parking is limited in the immediate basement parking lot, but they share another lot with the Residence Inn across the driveway.   The room was surprisingly large! It was broken up into three sections, living room that converted into an additional bed, bathroom/bar in the middle, and the main bedroom. I was lucky enough to have a view of the backside of Cars Land. The room

Beautiful hotel, friendly staff and the location is great. My advice is try another Marriott. I pulled back my bed to find blood one the sheets at 10PM on my first nights stay. When I called the front desk I was sent a very nice young man that handed me sheets at the door. Now I don’t know about you but when I check into a hotel I expect the sheets to be clean. And the staff to take it very seriously that filthy are left on the bed. And I also expect the bed made for me. I am extremely upset the staff was flip about the seriousness of this. Again try another hotel that cares about the hygiene of its rooms.
Manager Response: Dear livingpeacefully2015- Thank you for choosing to stay at the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and sharing your feedback with us .  As a teachable moment, we have shared your comments with the our hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to ensure our guests have a relaxing and peaceful nights rest and we will continue to work hard to ensure all of our guests have a very positive and memorable experience.  Thank you for allowing us to be your host hotel during your stay in the Anaheim/Disney Resort area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center

Summary: The room was large and could be split by closing the sliding door, which was really nice. Housekeeping was excellent, and there was a complimentary breakfast which was convenient. The gym was well-equipped. The road is quite noisy but there is not a lot one can do about that. We were a bit afraid that the children in the hotel would be noisy but they were not at all.

Summary Heading: Pretty Good, not many outlets for charging devices
Summary: Overall the room was clean, but the USB port did not work nor were there many outlets. The breakfast was ok, but wish it would have been more time friendly with the park beign so close to Disneyland to get there at opening meant we would have to forgo breakfast at the hotel

Summary Heading: Good Disney option for Marriott People
Summary: Pros: Family suite with bunk beds are nice sized with 2 TV's in the room and can sleep 6+ Family suites face the park and some have views of the fireworks Fairly close walk to Disney and attached to a CVS and a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf  Free breakfast is great--my kids all LOVE the Mickey Waffles and choosing toppings for them.  Cons: Parking is pretty pricey for the hotel type Only has a small pool, no hot tub but an overall decent roof deck No bar  Overall if you are a Marriott Loyalist this is a solid choice for price, location and room size for a family of 5. We have stayed here many times but prefer the Courtyard Marriott Maingate for better location, pool and hotel amenities. We also slightly prefer the Residence Inn next store as it has a bar and a hot tub.
Manager Response: Dear followthefive5,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback about your recent stay with us. I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed the close access to the nearby businesses. Residence Inn is our sister property and our guests also have access to their facilities while staying with us.   We do apologize if there was any confusion in regards to the nearby facilities.   Thank you again for taking the time to leave your feedback and we hope to see you again when your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, very convenient location
Summary: We booked for a two night stay to go to Disneyland for all the Christmas activities.  The hotel is about 1 mile door to gate.  It is an easy walk on sidewalk only crossing one big street(Katella).  They serve breakfast each day and parking was underground for $24 per day(the same as Disneyland charges in their garage).  Staff were pleasant and helpful upon check in.  Our room faced Harbor and we thought this might be a problem with the noise but the windows do a good job of blocking it out.  Ask for a room facing Katella is you want to be able to see the fireworks at Disneyland.  The room didn't have a bathtub so if you need/want one you might need to inquire whether you can get a room that has one.  Bed was comfortable.  there was a large sofa, mini fridge, coffee maker.  the

We started the New Year with a visit to Disneyland and a 3-night stay at the Springhill Suites in room #446.  We had mixed results with this hotel and overall felt a little bit disappointed.  Our room faced South Harbor and was close to the intersection of Katella.  We had asked for a room on the top floor (5) but were ultimately give one on the 4th floor.  It was noisy.   We arrived a few hours early and our room originally set for the 3rd floor wasn’t ready.  We did some shopping, gassed up the car and came back an hour later and the room still wasn’t ready.  Not a problem, we are well travelled and understand that they were full.  However, at 4:00 pm when our room was still not ready by the guaranteed time, we were given someone else’s room that had not arrived yet on the 4th
Manager Response: Dear Chris F: Thank you for choosing to stay at the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and providing your honest feedback. We apologize for any inconvenience we caused you and your party in regards to not getting an upper floor room until after our 4pm check in time. Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. The Marriott "Going Green" program does provide all Bonvoy members 250 additional points for each day you do not require your room to be service when you place the door hanger outside your door each day. We are glad to hear you enjoyed the easy 10 minute walk from the hotel to the Disneyland Main Entrance. Thank you for allowing us to be your host hotel during your stay in the Anaheim/Disney Resort area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center

Summary: After reading mixed reviews I was concerned about staying here. However after our experience I was pleasantly surprised. Perfect hotel to visit Disneyland. It’s an easy walk and great conveniences along the way...7-11, CVS Downstairs, Starbucks etc. Our room was clean and spacious. Mini fridge and microwave came in handy. We were also able to bring our 2 yorkies which is a huge bonus. My only complaint was with housekeeping. Our room was never cleaned. We never ate breakfast downstairs so I can’t say anything about that. Overall at this price point we will most definitely be back! Hopefully housekeeping will be better.
Manager Response: Dear Babycakesk- We are thrilled to hear from another guest who had a pleasant stay at the Anaheim Resort Springhill Suites. We are glad to hear that our close proximity to Starbucks, the Convention Center, and the Main gate Disneyland entrance matched your needs. I have shared your feedback with our HSKP team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to ensure our guests have a relaxing and peaceful nights rest and we will continue to work hard to ensure all of our guests have a very positive and memorable experience.  We love hearing that you enjoyed your spacious suite with the mini-fridge and microwave.   We look forward to seeing you the next time you visit the Anaheim area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary: First time guest at this hotel and overall, I was more than pleased with price and location.  Ample room size, however the front room furniture unattractive and not comfortable.  The lobby breakfast bar lacks sufficient staffing; I was unable to locate a staff representative for assistance and serving area needed attending.  The location lack a bar, however the hotel right next door does.  The convenience is the accessibility of a CVS pharmacy for drinks, snack, souvenirs and you name it.  A manageable walking  distance to Disneyland.  You'll save money eating breakfast here, not paying for shuttle transportation to park and purchasing souvenirs (maybe 40%) staying here,  Still charge for parking at almost $25 a day, which is ridiculous fee for hotel guests.

Billy, the front desk supervisor, took care of us as soon as we walked in the door. He is extremely nice, friendly, and went out of his way to make sure we were recognized as valued Bonvoy members. He represents the reason why we always choose to stay at Bonvoy Hotels.   Springhill Suites are within 11 minute walking distance from the entrances to both California Adventure and Disneyland. The location is awesome. Breakfasts are varied and sufficient. The CVS within the same building is also extremely convenient. The basement parking garage is quite secured and we never spent more than a minute to find a decent parking space.  We stayed at a typical suite - room 308 - with two queen size beds and a pullout sofa bed. The sofa bed is also a sectional where the short leg can

Summary Heading: Close to Disney/Honda Center but Low Quality for Marriott
Summary: From the start, not enough parking for check-in and you HAVE TO check-in to get your key to go into the tiny parking garage. Both times I went there was only 1 person at the desk. I accepted the offer of foam pillows, they must have been foam fragments and they did not have a pillowcase (EWE). The first time I stayed the pleather pull-out couch had a skimpy spring mattress, it was the worst sleep. It also nearly blocked the door. The next time I went we got the room with the bunkbeds, DOES NOT LOOK LIKE THE PICTURE. The same size as the first room with the beds, I have stayed at the Hyatt before and they had a TRUE kids section with a closing door. The shower was also very irritating I'm surprised the city hasn't gotten on the case because in both rooms it would not shut off on
Manager Response: Dear flying805- Thank you for choosing to stay at the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and sharing your feedback. We apologize for any delay you may have experienced during your stay. We do have three parking areas. We have Guest Registration, an underground parking lot, as well as a five story parking structure located directly across from our lobby entrance to meet your parking needs. We do offer multiple  check out options. You can check out using the Marriott App, you can just call the FD and let them know you are checking out, or can you stop by the Front Desk and check out in person. We will continue to work hard to ensure all of our guests have a very positive and memorable experience. Thank you for allowing us to be your host hotel during your stay in the Anaheim area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center

Summary: Our family stayed here for 3 nights during our trip to Disney. We’re not much of a Disney family, but basically we checked this off the list I guess. (Star Wars experience was pretty cool though). Anyway, we decided to stay at the SH Suites and we are certainly glad we did. Very convenient location if your willing and able to walk 10-12 minutes to the park entrance. Poop was nice but small, and the CVS downstairs provided us with anything we might have needed in a pinch. Rooms were spacious as well. Only downside, and this is by no means the hotels fault, is the breakfast experience. I’ve seen less people herded together on the NYC subway for rush hour so keep that in mind when planning your day. All in all I would certainly stay there again.

This hotel is located within walking distance to Disneyland. This is what everyone is looking for right?! However, be careful with a captive audience, comes sacrifices. You don’t have to cater to your customers because someone is right behind you to fill their rooms.   The good: conveniently located, bunk beds for the kids, rooftop pool with view of fireworks, lots of seating for breakfast, maids were very polite and accommodating. Great security, need a room key to go up AND down floors. Fitness room is nice. Rooms are clean. Laundry facilities on site. Microwaves and small fridges in room.   Downside: front desk personnel, hit or miss. Some are nice, friendly and informative, some not so much. They don’t  cater to your higher Marriott status. At breakfast, they have two juice
Manager Response: Dear EL646- Thank you for choosing to stay at the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with our Breakfast team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to ensure our buffet is stocked throughout the duration of our breakfast hours. We apologize that one of the juice machines was not working correctly. Our Vender has ordered a new one to be delivered and will be installed shortly. Our Rooftop pool is heated. Our Engineering team will continue to monitor the temperature to ensure it maintains a comfortable temperature for our guests. We will continue to work hard to ensure all of our guests have a very positive and memorable experience. Thank you for allowing us to be your host hotel during your stay in the Anaheim area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center

Summary: My family and I had an excellent stay at this super convenient hotel to Disneyland.  10-minute walk to Disneyland entrance, CVS downstairs and food options like Blaze Pizza across the street.  The hotel looked recently remodeled, furniture was new and modern looking (partnership with West Elm) and the bathrooms were gorgeous. We were upgraded to a spacious suite on the 5th floor with a bunk bed which was perfect for our child.  Despite all the children in the hotel and on our floor it was a pleasantly quiet stay.  The hotel employees were all helpful and friendly, especially Kathy who went out of her way to tell us about the local area and answer any questions we had.  She made all the difference in our stay.  I highly recommend this hotel for any families planning a trip to

Stayed here for a short two day trip to Disney and was very pleased with the hotel and the location. Clean rooms, nice breakfast and close to Disneyland. You can walk over to the Disneyland parking lot and catch a shuttle if you want to, however we just Uber’d it to and from, for $6-8 each way it was well worth it, especially after a long day on your feet.

The staff and Customer Service were excellent.  The breakfast was excellent.  Any special request we needed was handled quickly and efficiently.  Compassionate, as one of our grandchildren got sick and had to go to the ER.  They brought in a doctor and helped us find a way to get to the hospital.

We were traveling from Oregon to Arizona with our cat after an extended work assignment in Oregon, we really needed a Disneyland fix! I had one day we could spend in the parks, and needed a safe place for the cat to stay.  I called SpringHill Suites they have a GREAT location, literally 10 minute walk from Door to Main Gate, and they were So nice and helpful. The pet deposit was $75! All the rooms are considered pet friendly.   First impression of the hotel was it was Nice and Clean and bright and inviting. Check in was easy, they gave me a special door hanger to warn that the cat was in there. As long as you have that on the door, they will not go in!  WE were able to easily walk down to dinner at the Garden Walk mall area, and Disneyland the next day.   The room was HUGE! We

Summary Heading: I hate hotels - but I loved this one!
Summary: Before I start I want to make it clear that I absolutely HATE staying in hotels. Before staying in one I am usually a nervous wreck. I was so pleasantly surprised that I liked this hotel. Here are a few of the main points:   -The layout of the family suite was perfect for my husband and I, our 5 children, and grandma. We all loved the big walk in shower! Much better than the usual tiny bath/shower combos hotel rooms have.  -It took us about 10 minutes to walk to the gates of Disneyland, and that was only needing to cross one main road. Easy to walk home even after 12+ hours at Disneyland.  -The CVS connected to the hotel was SO convenient! Our second night there, my 4 year old came down with a tummy bug (probably picked it up at the park). We were able to run down to CVS to get

This was a nice suite to stay in for our party of 6. It is in a beautiful location close to Disney! I would totally stay here again when I am ever in the area. My kids also enjoyed the pool area on the 5th floor and the breakfast was great!

I would definitely stay in this hotel again if I was going to Disneyland or had business in the area. The front desk staff was exceptionally gracious and helpful.  We had two king suites, both nicely appointed, comfortable beds, everything clean and in working order,  good reliable internet service, and one had a great view of the nightly fireworks.  You can't beat the location for easy access by car to the interstate or by foot to nearby attractions and the CVS next door was a plus. The only disappointment was the overly crowded breakfast buffet.  Hard to control all the kids with their germs and dirty hands on everything!  We opted to go elsewhere for breakfast.

Stayed here while on business, so my great location is based on ease of getting to the highways, food options, CVS next door and not to mention being close to Disney. Very busy with people on vacation but not really an issue, I was on the 5th floor where pool was but was on the other side of hotel and my room was at the end of the hall the other way nice and quiet. Being I looked out on to Katella and Harbor pretty low street noise on the 5th floor,  when emergency vehicles went by it was loud but only happened a few times during the week. Pretty busy in the morning for breakfast getting down there early the better but the front desk gives you a sheet with information  stating that which I thought was nice. Breakfast includes eggs, sausage, tater tots, waffles, cereal and

The room was great the beds were comfortable the air conditioner work great. I would give their breakfast buffet a 6 out of 10, no one likes their sausage boiled. Other than that a great stay and a short walk to Disneyland

I was very impressed with this hotel and would highly recommend it. We were in town for our daughter’s leadership conference at the convention center. She stayed with us for a few days and then the rest of the week in a nearby hotel with her group. There’s a good sized front room that was large enough for her to comfortably work on her project. There was a large sized desk, couch and chair with plenty of floor space. It also has it’s own TV. There’s a microwave and fridge and there’s a large bathroom. The areas with 2 beds has a TV as well. The beds were truly queen size, not double size being advertised as queen like some hotels. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. I liked that the beds were far from the doorway so we didn’t hear any noise from the hall. The elevators

Summary Heading: Perfect location, spacious rooms and great staff!
Summary: Stayed on the top 5th floor in a 2-queen suite. Highly recommend the 5th floor with its access to laundry facilities, gym, pool and rooftop deck. Opened our curtains daily and each time the owl perched on the roof of the neighboring hotel creeped me out (see photo)!  Notes about the rooftop deck: security comes through at 10pm to ensure guests clear the area. Disney’s nightly fireworks show can be viewed from the deck as well.  It’s a short walk to the Disney parks, Anaheim Convention Center and numerous restaurants. Having CVS downstairs was quite convenient. The room fridge perfectly stored our drinks (again, see photos)!  Complimentary breakfast was decent but the coffee was weak. Go out and around the corner next door to The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf for a better selection.

Summary Heading: Great hotel value for the money
Summary: This is a great middle price range hotel for larger families. We stayed in a room with two queen beds, two bunk beds and a pull out couch. If hotel rules would support it, you could sleep eight in this room, no problem. The free breakfast is totally worth considering in your budget. They have ham, cheese, scrambled and hard boiled eggs, 4 types of cereals (the fruit loops goes fast) fruit, waffles, coffee and many other options. Considering that you might spend $30-$50 for a family of 4 for breakfast off site, you should defiantly factor this into the price of the room. Quite the value for the money. Beware of the $25 per day parking fee. Didn’t know about that and there is not a lot of parking available. Other than that issue, we loved staying here. You can walk to the front

Summary Heading: Great location...terrible pool with good views
Summary: The one area I was very disappointed in was the roof top pool.  The view is awesome to watch the fireworks.  However, the pool was freezing and there was no hot tub.  Who in the world wants to sit cold water on a cool night watching fireworks!?! Its sad to think that the Best Western down the street that was built in the 70s has a better/warmer pool and hot tub, is quite comparable in comfort and breakfast, and was much more affordable.  As far as the rooms and comfort of the hotel...its a Marriott so its great!  The location of the hotel is also a positive as it is just across the street from Disneyland and we would walk to the Toy Story Shuttle for a quick lift to the park.
Manager Response: Dear joelovell21,  Thank you for choosing to stay at the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and providing your honest feedback.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the pool heating levels meet the expectations of our guests.  Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Thank you, Kimberly R

Summary: Part of this is my fault; I cancelled our reservation at the Residence Inn next door when I found out they were renovating their pool. I fully expected an actual kitchen like at the Residence Inn and instead was met with a microwave and mini fridge. This is mostly problematic because of severe food allergies.  Not being able to prepare our own food meant a lot of extra expense for us.  We booked a “family suite” for our family of 5 during our annual vacation to Disneyland.  The room is spacious, and you can see the fireworks from the roof, and that’s about the only good thing about our stay here.  One bathroom in a family with 3 women is a terrible idea. The bathroom is small and there’s no tub.  Our bed was UNBEARABLY UNCOMFORTABLE. Our kids complained about the bunk beds and
Manager Response: Dear viaminorviator,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with us.   Receiving a warm welcome during check-in often times sets the tone for a great stay. Unfortunately, we fell short of meeting your expectations when you arrived at the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  In order to better uphold our commitment to deliver exceptional service to every guest, from arrival to departure, I have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team in order to improve our arrival experience process.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to welcome you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   "Suite" Regards, Kimberly R

Summary: I stayed at this hotel in May of 2019 for a solo trip to Disneyland. I also stayed here back in the winter of 2016 and decided to come back as this hotel is very safe and comfortable for a young woman traveling solo.  Overall, I am still very impressed with this hotel. It’s an easy 15 minute walk to Disneyland. My room was large, updated, spotless, and just overall cozy. I also loved the pool on the rooftop! Lastly, a big shout out to this hotel’s flexibility. I got to check in 5 hours before normal and got to do a 2 hour late check out. This was amazing for someone who travelled there from the East Coast!  I have some hang ups that stopped me from giving a perfect 5 star rating.  1) The free breakfast wasn’t worth it (powdered eggs, oh boy) 2) I was put in the dreaded room 410

The rooms were a bit smaller than other hotels in the area but everything was clean which is what we seek when we stay at hotels. Staff was very accommodating, we needed help with our luggage and they offered to help . They recommended some good places to eat . Thank you for a great stay!

We just returned from our stay at the Springhill Suites Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. I can honestly say that it was an awesome experience. We chaperoned 23 students for the State FFA Convention. It is a short almost 7 minute walk to the Convention Center. Check in was seamless, breakfast was delicous, rooms spotless. The only negetive was that you need to use your room key to use the elevator and when hands are full it makes things difficult. A positive note though, I did appreciate the extra security measure as sometimes Anaheim is not the safety place.

We stayed at this great hotel for a 4 day conference.   The rooms were spacious and clean.  The staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was just perfect.  When in Anaheim this is the place to stay! Very convenient location for the convention center and Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great hotel ! Clean and very nice rooms.
Summary: We were in Anaheim for a student conference, CA FFA State Convention. This hotel was one block from the convention center. It was very convenient to be staying so close to the event. The hotel accommodated a lot of HS students and did a great job with breakfast. The rooms were very nice, comfy beds and loved the barroom.

We (family of four, kids 11 & 8) chose this hotel after good reviews and it proved a really good base for families visiting Disneyland. Firstly it is only a short 10 mins walk up South Harbor Blvd to the main entrance path. Secondly it is surrounded by amenities - 24hr CVS Pharmacy below, 7/11 over the road and fast food like Subway, Blaze Pizza, IHOP & Panda Chinese within yards plus the excellent Pizza Press, McDonalds, Dennys, Cheesecake Factory & Bubba Gumps within a 5 minute walk. For a bit of shopping the large Outlets at Orange are just a 5 min Uber away. The hotel staff are friendly & helpful and free Chupa Chups went down well with the kids! The breakfast was plentiful although after 7:30am it gets busy and there will be a line for the Mickey Waffles! We used the

Summary Heading: Nice family hotel near Disney California Adventure Park
Summary: This is a nice family hotel within walking distance of Disney California Adventure Park.   The rooms are spacious and well-appointed. Parking wasn’t a problem. Front desk staff was very pleasant and efficient. They have a gym and pool. Pharmacy and 7-11 nearby for emergency purposes.

We had the best time here, we felt the warm welcome the moment we walked through the door  ,  the entire staff was amazing and the comfort of the room was beyond what we expected. Thank you so much for making our stay a magical one ❤️

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for a trip to Disneyland. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the theme parks. The breakfast buffet was quite nice and had a good range of options for some picky kids. Their favorite were they Mickey Mouse waffles. We also enjoyed the cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, muffins, breads, eggs, sausage, potatoes and more! The rooms were well kept and cleaned daily. The rooftop pool is ok, not very big but gets the job done if you need a quick cool down. The staff was very friendly and informative. Overall we enjoyed our visit.

Summary Heading: Great location. Near convention center and Disneyland
Summary: Clean rooms. Easy check in. Great Breakfast. Lots of hot and cold choices. Well stocked and personnel kept a close eye in anything was getting low.  Felt very safe in surroundings, we did quit a bit of early morning trips and late at night trips to and from the hotel. Front desk was very cordial and helpful. Plenty of parking.

The room was spacious. There were separate bedroom and living room areas. The shower was huge. The only drawback was there was no bathtub. The hot breakfast buffet was great - bacon, eggs, potatoes, sausage, breads and toast, waffles, oatmeal, cereal, juice, coffee and tea. Checking in and checking out was fast and easy. I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is in a great location.  Close to restaurants and to Disney.  The pool overlooked the fireworks and had a CVS on the first level for convenience.  The hotel was clean and well kept and I would definitely make a return visit.

Summary Heading: Disney Option for Families of 5-6 people
Summary: As a family of 5 I am always looking to try hotels that can comfortably accommodate 3 kids in one room. The Spring Hill Suites has several configurations that work for us including the family suite that we stayed in with a set of bunk beds, a large couch and two queen beds. As many as 6 of us could have comfortably slept in that room.  Pros: -Pretty clean Hotel within walking distance to Disneyland -Decent breakfast buffet that is included in the stay and has mickey waffles -adequate roof top pool -attached to a CVS and a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf which is very convenient   Cons: --Hotel is on a very busy intersection and our room which was a premium priced family suite faced the very noisy street and could hear lots of traffic-not the best for getting good sleep for long days at
Manager Response: Dear followthefive,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. It has come to my attention that the service you received during your recent stay did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  The experience you described is not characteristic of the level of service our associates strive to provide. As a Platinum Elite, and as any valued guest, we appreciate and value your loyalty.   I look forward to restoring your confidence in the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: My mother planned a trip for my family, and we loved this place! Our first time at disneyland, and despite the rainy weather we really enjoyed! We checked in on friday march 1, we had a lovely young lady I believe her name was Nicole or Nataly she checked us in that morning. She was very helpful, very sweet and kind with how she directed where everything was and what she recommended to eat or do in the area. We got a room right away we had bunk beds which the kids loved, decent amount of space. Breakfast was good it could be better. Cleanliness was okay but nothing too bad. Overall our family enjoyed and hospitality was amazing! Definitely would come back!

Checkin was good although we had to wait a while for our room.  You are paying for location to Disneyland convenience.  I had expected better quality for its age and price paid.  The family room was ok with one bathroom in the middle of the bunkbeds and 2 queen beds.  The shower head was in need of a good cleaning.  This is a busy hotel with lots of large older children’s groups.  Parking is underneath the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear plastx2: Thank you for choosing to stay at the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and sharing your feedback. We apologize for any delay you may have experienced during check in. We are glad to hear that our close proximity to Disneyland and our Kid Suite was a good fit for you and your party. We do have two parking areas. We have an underground parking as well as a five story parking structure to meet our guest needs. Thank you for allowing us to be your host hotel during your stay in the Anaheim area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center

Summary: Stayed 8 nights for  work at convention center. Room was clean, updated and cleaned well daily.  Everything refreshed.  Front desk clerks Always very courteous.  Dropped laundry off twice and it was done  that evening, though expensive. Only had breakfast once as I had to start work at 6a.  It was okay for free breakfast.  My room faced parking lot and was quiet.  Pool area was nice.  Gym looked nice.  Hotel was over run by groups of teens.

The property is new and very clean. I stayed for two nights for work and it was completely overrun with kids - the first night was a high school band trip and the second night was just a ton of families visiting Disney. This would have been fine but the noise at night was annoying and the breakfast area was completely packed both mornings. My only complaints about service were that my room wasn’t really cleaned while I was there (e.g. my garbage was never emptied the whole time) but housekeeping started coming to the room to clean before 9 am and came back three times before I left at 11.
Manager Response: Dear Kathleen42- Thank you for choosing to stay at the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and providing your honest feedback regarding the noise and housekeeping concerns.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to ensure our guests have a relaxing and peaceful nights rest and we will continue to work hard to ensure all of our guests have a very positive and memorable experience. Thank you for allowing us to be your host hotel during your stay in the Anaheim area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center

Summary Heading: Don't stay here - not worth the cost and not up to old Marriott standards
Summary: Marriott has gone downhill with this place.  Noisy and run down (could hear traffic and pedestrian noise as if it was right next to us, bed well worn, room worn and ugly, toilette ran all night). We had requested a room higher up and extra towels, but our requests were not met. Worst part of our visit was that their room card system was down the entire time we were there and in order to get into our room, access, the pool, go to do laundry etc, we had to call security to escort us and let us in. Might as well have been in prison. Glad we were only staying one night. The one star is because the breakfast was good.
Manager Response: Dear Dean O,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with us on TripAdvisor.  Receiving a warm welcome during check-in often times sets the tone for a great stay. Unfortunately, it was brought to my attention that we fell short of meeting your expectations when you arrived.   In order to better uphold our commitment to deliver exceptional service to every guest, from arrival to departure, I have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team in order to improve our arrival experience.   Thank you for being a valued customer and we hope to welcome you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly R

Summary: Took the grandkids to Disneyland and booked this good neighbor hotel through Costco. It was a quick walk to Disney that included a roof top pool that you could watch the fireworks from Disneyland, a big breakfast buffet with waffles, eggs, sausage, bacon, fruit, etc. The room included 2 queen beds with a pull out sofa which was ample room for 5 of us. CVS was across the street. I would definitely stay there again.

We stayed here for 5 nights. Clean and comfy, but we were only here for sleep and showers.  We were at the parks from open to close.  Kids could have free brekky before we got the parks which was a plus.  Would stay here again.

Stayed here one night and that was enough. The rooms are great size . we actually had a room that had  a little bunk bed in it that was cute. .the 2 queen beds were comfortable. The breakfast was good. The customer service is really bad when I checked in I was trying to ask a lady questions and she just brushed me off made me feel like I was bothering her. I was trying to ask about tickets for Disneyland. And then she springs on the $23 parking fee per car so I paid $46 what's your cars and one of our cars we could not Park in the underground parking below the hotel because it was full my son had to park in the parking lot across the way we had to unload this our belongings and carry them across the grounds from the parking garage over to the hotel very unnecessary I would never
Manager Response: Dear krysheila99,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. It has come to my attention that the service you received during your recent stay did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  The experience you described is not characteristic of the level of service our associates strive to provide. From what you can see shared from other guests on TripAdvisor, our team goes above and beyond to ensure all of our guests enjoy their stay.   In regards to parking, you are correct that we charge a fee of $24.00 + tax (formerly $20.00 + tax) per night, per vehicle. Ours and many of the surrounding Disney hotels charge parking fees due to our proximity to the parks. As far as parking spots itself, we do provide additional parking at the Residence Inn when our lot is full. Since it is only a couple of feet away, this allows for easy access when our lot is full. In addition, we provide many 15 minute spots to allow our guests to unpack and check-in as smooth as possible.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to restore your confidence in the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly R

Summary Heading: I would not choose this hotel again.
Summary: Wish I could give 2.5.  Background: I have stayed at numerous hotels around Disney including Paradise Pier, Grand Californian, Candy Cane Inn, Fairfield, Howard Johnson, the Hilton, and Hyatt House over the past 7 years.  Pros: The hotel is well located, with a 15-minute walk door to security. The rooms are spacious and modern. The elevator is conveniently fast, and has the added security of needing room keys, which is nice. There is a CVS downstairs and a Walgreens across the street. The staff was welcoming. Prices fluctuated for months and then dropped a good bit right before I was ready to book, so keep an eye on the prices.  Cons: Housekeeping didn't show up at all the first day. We left for rope drop and came back at 2-4 for a break from the park. This left us with no hair
Manager Response: Dear Eric,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and providing your honest feedback on TripAdvisor.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent further breakfast issues from occurring in the future.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly R

Summary: We stayed here during our visit to Disneyland. Pros: - Walking distance from Disneyland - Top floor provides partial view of Disneyland fireworks - Great amenities including a gym, pool, laundry - Nice spacious rooms - Clean and well maintained - Microwave and refrigerator in the room - Location: CVS right next to the hotel  Cons: - Breakfast closes too early, 9:30am - The higher occupancy rooms have bathroom and toilet combined, making it difficult for 6 guests to get ready. This is a bad design.  Overall, I would recommend staying here.

This hotel was in great condition and a great price.   Wonderful free breakfast that wasn't too crowded.  The walk to Disneyland was just under a mile straight down the street so easy to go back and forth.   Several eating options close by too.  Will definitely stay there on future trips!

Summary Heading: perfect for a visit to Disneyland
Summary: Straight up this is a great hotel if you want to take your children to Disneyland.    We got in late on a Sunday and stayed through a Wednesday.   There is a fantastic free hot breakfast each morning including Mickey Mouse waffles.  The hotel is a 15 minute walk to the park entrance which is fantastic.   There is a parking fee each day but you would have to pay anyway to park in a Disney lot so it all balances out.   Our room was great with lots of space.  There is a pullout couch with a second TV so the kids can do their thing and take a break from mom and dad.   There is a CVS Pharmacy just steps away if you need anything that you forget on your travels.

We were visiting Disneyland and this was listed as a Good Neighbor hotel option. It was absolutely perfect! I would not change a thing! 5 travelers in our party. 3 adults, a 10yo and a 1yo. Pull out couch was comfortable for 4 nights. Bathroom very nice and centrally located in room. 2 TVs were great. Suckers at the front desk for this kiddos. Breakfast was probably the nicest hotel/room-included I have had. Mickey waffles, sausage, biscuits and gravy, fruit. Fantastic!  Also, the pharmacy downstairs was great as traveling with an infant. 5-7 minute walk to parks. 20 minute Uber ride from SNA.

The bad news is that Springhill Suites overbooked and cancelled my reservation the day before my arrival, even though I had made the reservation through Expedia five months in advance. The good news is that Springhill Suites arranged for another hotel for me and paid for my three-night stay there—a total of $795.03. I stayed at the Clementine Hotel & Suites. It was wonderful! Thanks to both hotels for a great stay!

We were placed in room 410 which is below the laundry room.  You could hear the dryers running and things flopping around in the dryers throughout the night. We called to complain and were initially told that they would "ask the room above us to keep the noise down".  I called BS on that and said it's not people in a room above us. It's a dryer.   I called back a second time and was told that there is a gym and a laundry upstairs by not direclty above us so we should not be hearing the dyer.  we asked for a new room, which we got and we did not hear the noise.   When we switched rooms we were not able to get a room key because the room key coding machine was broken. we had to be escorted and let into our room whenever we neeeed to get in.    The new room bathroom light  was out
Manager Response: Dear Meredith_Parrish: Thank you for sharing your feedback on your recent stay with us. We apologize for any inconvenience we caused you and your party for any noise disturbance you experienced during your stay. Our fitness center was having new flooring installed and we apologize it had an impact on your stay. We are truly sorry that the noise level was not controlled and that you did not have a relaxing and peaceful nights rest. I have shared your observations with our team and we will continue to work hard to ensure all of our guests have a very positive and memorable experience. Thank you for allowing us to be your host hotel during your stay in the Anaheim area.  Sincerely,  Dan Kramer  General Manager  SpringHill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center

Summary Heading: A hotel that epitomizes excellent service
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for several days while exhibiting at a show at the  Anaheim Convention Center. We were initially concerned that this was one of the two convention hotels, because it was not as close to the convention center as two other hotels where we had stayed for events in the past. We were pleasantly surprised to see that it was a very short walk. The room was enormous by most hotel standards, with plenty of space for two beds and a separate sitting area with a large sofa and desk. There was a lot of drawer space, which would be nice for a family visiting Disneyland. Everything was very clean and comfortable. We had plenty of nice towels. The refrigerator and  microwave were also a nice touch. We were always in a rush a breakfast, but there were good options and

Close to walk to Disneyland. Also close to the Anaheim Resort Transportation busses which worked well with children who needed to conserve energy. Can buy cheap weekly passes that stop across the street and return on the corner. Several restaurants near by. CVS located on the lower level which was helpful for last minute travel supplies and souvenirs, also have a walk in clinic. Breakfast was busy, but they were good at stocking. Mickey waffles were a big hit, lots of topping choices. Could also make breakfast sandwiches, bagels, cereal, eggs, oatmeal with toppings, whole fruit and fresh fruit. Room was fairly quiet, could hear people in the hallways, but pretty quiet at night. Pool on the roof, no hot tub. Nice viewing of fireworks.  Seating on rooftop good location to eat

This is my second review for this hotel I wish Asad was the guy checking us in he was friendly and made things happen. If you have children under the age don’t recommend checking in early won’t happen if it a sold out night before . I  understand if there 300 room in a hotel I know a lot of people would check out early but you have to make sure room are don’t by 4 pm so I’m assuming they will have a couple room done before 2 but not the case here. I allways like to stay here but newer Marriott around the area so this would be my last. Cindy and Katherine did there part but I didn’t realize feel since of urgency they just will call you when it ready.
Manager Response: Dear Ferbie247,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback on your most current stay with us.  As you mentioned, with our close proximity to both the Disneyland parks and the Anaheim Convention Center, we see many sold out nights throughout the year. With our check out time being at 11:00 am, we do get many requests for late check outs that we do our best to honor. To add, many guests also attempt to check in early as well which we also do our best to accommodate. For these reasons, this can often contribute to rooms being ready closer to check in time which is at 4:00 pm.   Thank you again.

Summary Heading: Great for both family and business trips
Summary: Great location, only minutes to the convention center and Disney. High floor facing to the Disney is reasonably good for the night fireworks. There are rooms with bunk bed, enough for 6 if it is 2 queen.

We recently took our two kids to Anaheim for a Disneyland trip and stayed here in a King room, with a pull-out couch for the kids. The room certainly wasn’t huge, but it was perfectly fine for our family of four, especially since we hardly spent any time in the room. Two TVs (one in the bedroom and one in the living room) was definitely a good thing! The room was very clean, and parking was super easy in the garage. My kids loved the lollipops at the front desk and grabbed way too many of them whenever we were in the lobby. Breakfast was just fine - very busy from about 8:30 AM on, but our early breakfasts especially were lovely. The kids especially liked the Mickey waffles. And the rooftop pool and lounge area was a bit, especially for viewing the Disney fireworks on days when

Summary Heading: Nice size rooms but lots of street noise
Summary: The size and layout of the suites was nice and the breakfast options were plentiful. However, the noise from the street was very loud and we had to sleep with earplugs each night. Would recommend asking for a room facing away from the street.
Manager Response: Dear JenF249: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We are glad to hear you enjoyed our suites and complimentary breakfast. We apologize for any noise disturbance that occurred during your stay. We are truly grateful you allowed us to be the host hotel for your trip to the Anaheim/Disneyland Resort area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer  General Manager

Summary: Booked this hotel over Labor Day Weekend for a short trip to Disneyland with my family. Location wise it is a about a 10-minute walk to Disneyland. Very convenient since the hotel has a CVS next to it on the bottom floor which made it easy to get anything additional we needed. Front desk service was excellent and quick. We got to the hotel early in the morning and even though our room was not ready we were able to hold all our luggage so we could start our day at the parks. Breakfast Buffet every morning was a plus however most days the hot food ran out quite early and was not refilled even though there was quite a bit of time left. I suggest going as early as possible to the Buffet so you have more choices of food and places to sit. Rooms looked brand new and were very

What a wonderful stay! Close to the park, rooms are so clean and comfortable. We stayed in a family suite and love the bunk beds for the kids! The employees are helpful and friendly and our daughter came into the room with a sweet surprise for her birthday! What a special touch for her to see when we walked into our room! We will be back and highly recommend!

I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It would have been 5 starts but there is no hot tub and the pool towels are too small for even a 4 year old. They said we can go to the next hotel and ask for the pool key and let them know where we are staying. So at least that’s an option. The rooms are spacious and clean and the breakfast is phenomenal. They had everything I wanted. Eggs, potatoes, oatmeal, fruit, meats, bagels, cereal, and yogurt... And the cutest waffles so the kids were so happy. The apple juice was my favorite. We didn’t have any issues and loved the lollipops offered at the front desk.

Stayed here for one night on a business trip. My room was very spacious. They offered a decent breakfast, with the standard fare. The hotel has  the smallest parking garage I’ve ever seen, but overflow parking was available at the Residence Inn next door.  A CVS was located next to the hotel, which was very convenient to get drinks, snacks, and other items. The hotel is also close to shopping and several restaurants.  I’d stay here if I were coming back to Anaheim to visit Disneyland.

We are staying here from 17 Oct to 20 Oct for our Anaheim trip. We choose this hotel after reading the review from trip advisor and the place is near to Disneyland, where we are planning to go. Well the room is clean and comfortable. The size of the room is big and is ideal for family of four. There is a living room and two television set located at the living room and at the bed area. The staff are very friendly and are very accommodating in replying to our various enquiries. There’s plenty of shop, eateries n etc around our hotel, so it’s convenient to get practically anything. Overall we are pleased with everything the hotel has to offer and hopefully, we had tons of wonderful memories during our stay here.

We had a wonderful experience staying here. Check in was quick and easy and our room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great with a lot of different choices, my kids especially loved the Mickey waffles. We had a standard king room and it was so nice having the living area separate from the sleeping area. The rooms are very clean and the hotel is conveniently located, just a short walk to the parks. I do have 2 complaints, the first parking is $20/day (plus tax) and our room didn't have a bathtub. We normally don't have a vehicle with us so parking fees aren't usually an issue but this trip we went to several places and needed transportation. The other hotels we stayed in didn't charge for parking and that was nice. Overall, the SpringHill is in a great location, clean,

I cannot comment enough on the great location of this hotel. Half a mile from Disneyland (easy walk), and with the Anaheim Gardenwalk, Downtown Disney, and the Convention center, your options for food and entertainment are endless. Breakfast in the morning was also quite delicious. I ended up having Mickey Mouse shaped waffles each morning, along with a fresh cup of coffee. The staff were all very friendly and informative if we needed directions, and we were always greeted with a smile. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

This hotel has amazing staff and it’s in a really convenient location close to restaurants and Disneyland!  Checking in was quick and easy and the staff were always ready to assist. You can purchase parking which is calculated at a daily rate of around $20.  The room was clean and tidy and very comfortable. They have daily housekeeping to help maintain the level of cleanliness.  There is a rooftop pool that looks across to Disneyland Adventure park where you can see some fireworks go off. There is also a small fitness area and coin operated washer and dryer which is around $5 for each and requires quarters.  Again, all the staff are so friendly and very accommodating.

We either stay here at this hotel or the Residence Inn next door whenever my family and I take a trip to Disneyland. This past visit , we stayed here at this SpringHill Suites. I love that it’s only a half mile away from the park. The breakfast is decent. Although it could get crazy especially on Saturday mornings - rude people all over. Not the hotel nor the staff’s fault. The staff is super friendly and the customer service is excellent. I particularly want to mention Asad who checked us in on our past stay. We got to the hotel pretty late. The parking structure was already full so we had to park next door at the Residence Inn. But Asad was so awesome that he comp’d our parking fee and even gave us bottles of water from the market fridge because he was worried that the waters

I highly recommend this hotel for both couples and families visiting the Disneyland resorts. The rooms (full suites) are modern, spacious, and well-decorated. The free breakfast included a multitude of hot items (scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, hash browns), fresh fruit, a waffle bar with toppings, a variety of bread items, oatmeal, and yogurt. The rooftop pool and patio (which included several sets of large patio couches and other nice furniture) was perfect for viewing the weekend fireworks from Disneyland. Another plus, the hotel is a quick and safe 10-minute walk to Disneyland and California Adventure Park. I would definitely stay here again.

We got to the hotel late in the evening so we didn't get to experience it too long before we headed to Disneyland the next morning. That said, the room was large and comfortable. Best of all, very quiet despite having a lot of other families with young children. The free breakfast was solid with fun Mickey Mouse waffles. Walking distance to Disneyland was a brisk and easy 15 minute walk.

We travelled with a group from our granddaughters dance school. The group organizer arranged the hotel. It is very family friendly and an easy 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland. The many restaurants at Anaheim Garden Walk are also within easy walking distance Breakfast was included. All in all recommended for families visiting the Park.

Summary Heading: Perfect for a Trip to Disneyland
Summary: We just returned from spending five days at this hotel with my husband and 12-yo son.  This is our second time here and we'll never stay anywhere else while visiting Disneyland as long as this hotel can keep up its level of service.   Pros: +Quiet rooms even though ours faced the street. +Great front desk staff +10 minute walk to Disneyland parks +Staff keep everything very clean even though there are a million kids everywhere. In the five days we were there, we must have seen the elevators being cleaned at least ten times. Also, I constantly saw staff picking up wrappers, lint, etc., so it really did not look like the hotel catered to families with small kids. +Breakfast is included +Mini fridge and microwave in the room  Cons + There are A LOT of kids at this hotel.  Some kids

Summary Heading: Clean hotel, decent breakfast walking distance to disney
Summary: We stayed two nights as a family in the two queen and pull out sofa room. It was spacious and it was nice to have two tv’s so the kids can watch Disney junior. The breakfast was decent to start your long day at Disney. The buffet had cereal, coffee, waffle bar, pastries that included blueberry muffins and croissants, yogurt, juices, eggs, breakfast meats. The hotel is about a block to Disney on the same side of the street. 7-11 is across the street, CVS below the hotel. The next hotel over has a Pizza Hut pickup stop also. The pool is small on the roof but suits its purpose. Also a nice sitting area to view fireworks. Would stay here again.

I like the beds I got to sleep in the bunkbeds. For the first time on the top bunk in my life! I like how can’t give all the beds in the removable letter I like everything about it! I like the hotel so much I would stay there for a whole year! I like this soon before I I I like that it’s close to California adventure and Disneyland I like all the rides to!

I accompanied my husband on a business trip to California to enjoy Disneyland. Hotel was very pleasant. Nice big rooms, good breakfast, and nice staff. About a 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland. We plan on staying here again next time we’re in California.

Stayed 8/7-8/11, great place across from California Adventure, in 5th floor pool can see fireworks easily.  Had a bunk bed room with 2 queens plenty room for 4 people.  Walking distance to plenty of restaurants and down town Disney.  Short ride to beach’s too.  Definetly would recommend.

I stayed on the S Harbor Blvd location with my family, the hotel was clean, breakfast was amazing, staff is excellent, its 15 min walk to Disneyland, there are many options around the hotel for dinner and lunch, Overall very good experience.

Summary Heading: Exceptional location and a staff to match!
Summary: Great location within easy walking distance to Disneyland. Staff were kind and accommodating. They went out of their way to be helpful! Breakfast was also excellent and offered diverse options. Many dining options nearby within walking distance.

First off I used to work for Marriott for 10 years so I know customer service when I see it. Also, I’m sorry lol for posting this review hella late.  We first got to the hotel and we were greeted genuinely from Nicole and asad. From the whole check in from start to end was so great with these 2. We told Nicole we had a pet so we wanted to add that pet deposit to the room and she was like,”oh you guys are so honest”. We all laughed and I was like,” I’m just trying to not sneak a pet around plus she doesn’t bark ever.” Nicole and asad also have us dog treats for her. Nicole said would you guys like to upgrade because we’re out of double queen rooms. We were so excited because I was fine with just sleeping on the floor because there was 5 of us and the doggo. We happily took the

Springhill Suites is within walking distance of Disneyland about a 10 minute walk.  Received an upgrade to a suite which had 2 queens, bunk bed, and a sofa bed.  It’s a great room for families to sleep 6 maybe even 7.  The only downside is just having a shower and not having a tub for the kids.   Hotel is very new modern, lots of outlets throughout the room, usb charger by the bed.  Each room has a refrigerator and a microwave.  Our room was on the 5th floor which is the same floor as the fitness center and the pool.   We could even see the fireworks from out room.  Didn’t have a balcony but did have a large floor to ceiling window.     They also have rooftop viewing of the fireworks from the pool.     Pool is very small and not kid friendly as the most shallow area was 3 ft 6

Pros: 10 minutes walking distnace to Disneyland and just upstairs of CVS, which is a big plus for family. Generally clean. Free breakfast has a lot of selections; love the waffle maker.  Cons: 1. difficult to find a parking spot to unload luggage and no help at all; 2. sofa bed is not usable as the springs were worn out; 3. shower faucet might be the cheapest the can find on market; 4. walk in shower is convenient but closing the door can make big noise.
Manager Response: Dear Nick W: Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us.  We are glad to see that our clean and spacious suite worked perfectly for your stay. It is great hearing that our close proximity to Disneyland and our CVS met your travel needs. Thank you for sharing your observation regarding the shower and sofa bed. We hope that you will give us the opportunity to serve you again in the future. Sincerely, Daniel Kramer  General Manager

Summary Heading: Disneyland Stay - Good Location, Value, and Included Breakfast
Summary: My family 'summers' in Coronado, CA from Texas many summers and always include a 2 night Disneyland ‘trip’ to enjoy the 2 parks.  This was our first stay at this property.  We selected it because of its close location to Disneyland (walking distance), the rate, the family suite which can sleep up to 7 people, and the free breakfast.  It’s a Marriott property which adds to our Marriott rewards points as well.  Here is my review:  Location:  excellent location for Disney.  It’s an 8 to 10 minute walk - depending on your pace.  However, if you have someone who can’t walk much - there is a shuttle service you can pay for to take from the property.  It’s close enough that we took a break from the madness and had lunch at the hotel on our Disneyland day.  The food in Disneyland is
