I was overall really happy with our stay. The bed and pillows were comfortable and the rooms was really clean. The breakfast in the morning was a huge plus with four kids. There was plenary of room. Housekeeping did a great job. I enjoyed the location. I’ll be back next time

This hotel is a ten minute walk to Disneyland and worth every penny. The complimentary breakfast is awesome. The rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable. On check out day, you can request to leave your vehicle in the garage and they will only charge you half a day, which is cheaper than parking at the park.

Pros:  updated room, excellent breakfast buffet, delicious coffee in room and at breakfast, clean, fast check-in and out, excellent location for Disneyland and the Anaheim convention center,  quiet even though the hotel was full and with lots of traffic outside, suites come with a living room area with separate TV and desk, good HVAC, upgraded cable TV with HBO, CVS attached to hotel, lots of towels   Shout out to Jacqui who let us check in early!  She was very friendly and efficient!   Cons:  limited check-in parking (five spaces taken up by pots, a storage container, and the hotel's van), parking in the underground garage is not free (including taxes it was $23.40 per night), limited garage spaces, slow elevators

Clean room, friendly staff and plenty of room for a family of 5. Very poor sound insulation in sleeper area. Easily heard kids running and screaming in the halls after midnight along with doors slamming all day and night.  More of an issue of rude families than the hotel. Sofa sleeper extremely poor quality and hard for even a young kid - needs replacing!  Stick with yogurt and fruit for breakfast - eggs, meat and coffee options are not edible. I’d research other options if we’re in the area again but the friendly staff and housekeeping might convince me to return if I found a great rate, brought earplugs and planned to grab breakfast elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear FiveTravelers2Go: Thank you for sharing your feedback on your recent stay with us. We apologize for any inconvenience we caused you and your party including any noise disturbance you experienced during your stay. We understand some guests may bring some of the excitement of Disneyland and the Convention Center back with them so we will continue to monitor the hallways and ensure the noise level is controlled to ensure all of our guests can have a relaxing and peaceful nights rest. I have shared your observations with our team and we will continue to work hard to ensure all of our guests have a very positive and memorable experience. Thank you for allowing us to be your host hotel during your stay in the Anaheim area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center

Summary: My family and I come to Disneyland usually once a month and have stayed at several hotels. We usually stay at a Disney Hotel but if we do not we stay at the Hyatt House,Residence Inn or Spring Hill Suites. We have found these Hotels to be the best value and our close.This was our third time here at Spring Hill suites. This is a fairly new hotel so I am a little disappointed to see some of the things wrong with this hotel. First thing the parking for this hotel can be a pain if it is real busy. When we checked in most of the spots for check in vehicles were occupied by other vehicles or work trucks doing work in the area. There is a curb that is painted red right in front of the hotel and CVS pharmacy and there were work trucks and delivery trucks parked there everyday we were
Manager Response: Dear fresnonittanylion,  Thank you for your time in writing your feedback from your most recent stay with us. I am thrilled to read that my team was very helpful in the times that you engaged with them.   I have shared your review with not only my team, but our leadership team as well. We always rely on our guests to provide us the utmost honest form of feedback possible.   P.S. Pizza Press is one of  my favorite pizza spots in the area!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: This was our 7th stay in Anaheim but first in this hotel. The hotel was beautifully clean. We had a corner suite,so the view from our window was floor to ceiling and showed beautiful palm trees part of Disney and the mountains. It was well equipped with a microwave and fridge and lots of storage space. The staff were friendly and always welcoming. Breakfast was provided, plenty of choice including waffle makers. The only slight downside was no safe in the room but we adapted. I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Jackie D- Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us.  We are glad to see that our clean and spacious suite worked perfectly for your stay. We thank you for all of your kind comments regarding the courteous service our team provided you during your stay. We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Resort/Convention Center Springhill Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort area. Sincerely, Daniel Kramer General Manager

Summary: We are VERY VERY happy with the Springhill Suites in Anaheim! The rooms and property in general were very modern and clean.  The room was very big with plenty of room for my 19 and 17 year old sons to spread out.  The bathroom had a lot of counter space and the mirror didn't fog up.  The beds were very comfy too!  The breakfast area was clean and provided many choices, both healthy and sweet.  The pool was closed for rehab but we most likely wouldn't have used it anyway.  We loved watching the Disney fireworks from the rooftop - perfect view!!  As Marriott gold members, we also really appreciated the water and Hershey Kisses at check in!!  Also, can't go wrong with the big bowl of suckers at the front too!  We love those!  We would definitely return to this hotel if we are in

We stayed at this hotel to be walking distance of Disneyland and were baffled at the state this hotel is in. It is dirty and run down. I am aware that being this close to Disneyland means this hotel probably sees a lot of visitors but it is not kept up with. I am a Marriott member and expected more out of this property. The staff was friendly and helped us cancel our last night stay after we shared with them our frustration.   Breakfast was okay but it does get busy and we went early.
Manager Response: Dear Jacquelineaisos L,  We appreciate your time in writing a review on your most recent stay with us. I am sorry to hear that you were dissatisfied with your stay.   As you mentioned, with our quick 5-10 minute walk to Disney, we are within short distance to both the Disneyland parks as well as the Anaheim Convention Center. As you can imagine, we house thousands of guests regularly and especially during the summer months.  We rely on our guest feedback in order to provide the utmost service. I am saddened that these issues were not brought to my attention in order to help rectify immediately rather than have them linger.   As a Marriott Rewards member, we value your feedback and thank you for staying with us.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: The stated check in time on my email was 3:00 p.m.  The hotel staff said that check in time is 4:00 p.m.  We arrived at 2:30 p.m. hoping to check in at 3:00 p.m but they didn't have the room available till 4:00 p.m.  The pool was not available and closed during our stay.  The pool at the next door Hotel was available but a major inconvenience with kids. Parking was limited but the parking structure was available for use at the hotel next door.  The pull out bed was thin and very uncomfortable .  You could feel the metal frame underneath and we could hear the person turning in their sleep.  The rest of the bedding and beds were comfortable.  The continental breakfast was not as good as we have had. We enjoyed the convenience of the CVS store next door.  The roof top was a great
Manager Response: Dear Don L,  We appreciate your feedback. I am sorry that your stay did not meet up to your expectations.   As you mentioned, we have had some minor renovations to our pool which caused this closure, as notated on our website. Fortunately, our sister property has welcomed our guests to utilize their pool, hot tub and splash pad during this time. With the walk no more than 10 steps away, we have been able to notify our guests at check in of quick alternative during closure. With that, our pool is set to open on July 1st and has actually been set to open 2 weeks earlier than anticipated!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: This is our second stay and we always enjoy the place, location and people in this hotel... the pool is under renovation but they gave us access to next door Residence Inn pool which was really nice as well...
Manager Response: Dear Rina G:  We are thrilled to hear from another loyal repeat guest who had loved their stay at the Anaheim Resort Springhill Suites Hotel. We thank you for all of your kind comments about our Hotel staff and the great service they provided you during your stay. We apologize that our pool was under a renovation during your stay. The pool is now open and we look forward to you returning to our when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort/Anaheim area. Sincerely, Daniel Kramer  General Manager

Summary: I read many reviews before booking here and agree, this is a great location and maybe a 5-10 minute walk to the parks. You cross one street and the walk is clean and easy to navigate. Our room was comfortable, the beds and pillows were actually comfy.  Continental breakfast was one of the better and greatest selection we have had in our travels. But, the waffle line (there is only one station) is long!  We had a family suite with bunk beds and I read about people finding food and trash b/t the wall of the bunk bed and bed itself; this was true. We found Smarties, crackers etc but I don't know how you clean it as there is a platform that blocks the bottom bunk to the floor so you can't get under the bed.  While I would say this hotel is really well soundproofed, as we only head a

The hotel is clean, close to Disneyland(literally a 7min walk) offers a great buffet breakfast.  The pool was out of order while we were there but we had access to the neighbour pool which was a 3 min walk. Also a great view of the fireworks from our 5th floor room.
Manager Response: Dear Cadillacdiamond We are thrilled to hear from another guest who enjoyed their stay at the Anaheim Resort Springhill Suites Hotel. We love hearing that you enjoyed your clean and spacious suite and the fireworks. We apologize that our pool was under a renovation during your stay. The pool is now open and we look forward to you returning to our when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort/Anaheim area for Mother/daugfhter day. Sincerely, Daniel Kramer  General Manager

Summary: Good location walking distance to Disneyland. Restaurants closeby. Decent size rooms. Has a pharma and convinience store onsite. Breakfast nothing unusual alaways crowdwed in restaurant. Does not have a restaurant or bar functioning on premises        just the breakfast place. Good for families to stay,
Manager Response: Dear Rajendra Govind D,  Thank you for your review with us. You are correct in mentioning that we do not have a restaurant on property however, we do have many eateries within a short 5 minute walking distance that include: Subway, California Pizza Kitchen, P.F. Changs and many more!  We hope you are able to return and try them on your own!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We visit Disneyland from Texas 1-2 times a year.  This was our first time staying at this hotel and it was comfortable and close to the park.  Our room was clean and the staff were friendly.  Having a CVS in the building was very convenient!  The only downside was that our room was directly beneath the fitness room and there were unsupervised kids making a ton of noise every night.  I'm not talking you normal upstairs hotel noise -- our room shook so hard that my 7 year old totally panicked that there was an earthquake.  The hotel was very accommodating and made sure to have security ask the kids to leave the fitness room.  Unfortunately they returned the following night and at that time management went ahead and had us move rooms and gave us a snack credit to make up for the

Stayed 3 times in the last 2 years at this SpringHill, most recently in April.  Love the location - You can't go wrong on the 4 corners of Harbor and Katella having a CVS Pharmacy, a Walgreen's, 7'11 and then a strip mall with sushi and subway on the 4th corner.  Pizza Hut is behind the Springhill (connected to the Residence Inn).  Rooms are very large and beds are really comfy.  Breakfast is really good here, lots of choice and the staff is on it, always refilling and making sure things are available.  Front desk staff is awesome, very friendly and helpful.  The gym is very good, lots of free weights and space with balls and mats, also a great great view of Disney from the gym, so you don't have to feel too bad getting that workout in while you are up there!  Great choice for
Manager Response: Dear 404kristyl,  Thank you for your review with us. Thank you for an information packed review! I like the fact that you pointed out the gym as that is one of my favorite locations on the property because of the awesome Disney view!  We look forward to seeing you back very soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: The Springhill Suites Anaheim was very convenient for my intended travel! Within walking distance of shops, restaurants, and convenience stores.  Nice views of the Disneyland fireworks show was an added bonus.
Manager Response: Dear steelmvp,  We appreciate your review. Just within a short 5 minute walk there are eateries that range from Subway to California Pizza Kitchen, Cheesecake Factory and many more! Thank you for pointing that out!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: I recently stayed at this hotel and I would definitely stay again! The location was great! It was a 5 to 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  The free breakfast was tasty and we filled up before we went to the parks. The rooms were clean and spacious and the bathroom was also. Families beware, our room only had a shower so if you have little ones you might want to ask if they have a room with a tub. It wasn't a problem for us though. You can see the fireworks from the rooftop deck which was great. I would have given this hotel a 5 star rating but when we checked in they said the hotel pool was closed. My kids were very disappointed. I think the hotel should have notified us about that before we got there. They offered us to use the pool at the hotel behind us but just the thought of
Manager Response: Dear olive455,  Thank you for your review with us. I apologize that you were unable to use the pool during your stay do to our minor renovation. As you mentioned, our neighboring hotel is welcoming all of our guests to use their pool, hot tub and splash zone in the meantime so you don't miss any opportunities to cool off.  We hope to see you again real soon.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: My boyfriend and I came up from San Diego for a day trip to go to Disneyland. We chose Springhill Suites because of its convenient location and we were not disappointed! The hotel is only a 5 min walk tops to the front gate!! We arrived around 8 am because we wanted to get into the park when it opened at 9. Billy at the front desk was so kind and helpful. He explained our room wasn't ready (which was completely fine and expected as check in isn't until 4) but that we could pre check-in, park our car and leave our luggage with them and he gave me his card so I could check in throughout our day to see if the room was ready. Honestly we weren't going to be back until after 4 so I wasn't concerned. When we did get into the room I was blown away by how clean and nice and well kept
Manager Response: Dear Sara G,  Thank you for your great review. Though we do honor early check-in upon availability, if your room is not quite yet ready to settle in, we are more than happy to store luggage while you enjoy your day at the park. Thank you for mentioning my team and I am happy to read we accommodated you very well.  See you back soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We stayed with our 2 kids and it was a great hotel. Breakfast was good with many options. Easy to get to Disneyland. Restaurants nearby and very easy to get to. Our room was clean and beds were comfortable. Liked that here was guest laundry available so we could wash/dry our clothes.
Manager Response: Dear katiebug80,  Thank you for your review. You are correct in mentioning we do have on site guest laundry that is coin operated so you can wash clothes at any time!  We hope to see you  back again!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: At our  most recent stay, we were in a 2 queen, bunk bed, resort facing room. The room had a view of the nightly fireworks at Disneyland. It is a 10 minute walk from the park entrance. We were able to come back to the room 2-3 times a day to walk our puppies and feed them. To save a few steps getting to the park, exit through the breakfast area into the outdoor seating area, then onto the sidewalk.

We had a great stay with the property.  There were only a few annoying things like only 4 towels and wash cloths to a room.  When we requested additional they were never delivered so our family of 5 had to reuse which was not that bad.  A few small issues with room, but to be expected in a family hotel close to Disneyland.  The breakfast was great and they even had gluten free options which is a plus for us.  Overall a great stay!
Manager Response: Dear jjanicky2,  Thank you for your feedback on your most recent stay. I would like to begin by apologizing for the additional towels not being sent in a decent amount of time.Please know that I have shared your feedback with our Housekeeping department.  We hope to be able to accommodate you again soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Great for family trip to Disneyland!
Summary: We just stayed four nights at the Springhill Suites Anaheim Resort Convention Center for our family trip to Disneyland.  If you are looking for a whimsically-designed hotel so the kids won’t miss the fun at a super expensive Disney hotel, you’ve come to the right place.  Bright colored paintings and fun furniture fill the lobby area and super clean guest rooms.  The suite set up is perfect for parents who need a little break from overtired, cranky kids.  The breakfast was fantastic and you are about a 10-12 minute walk to the parks - if your feet are too sore for the walk, we were able to get Ubers very quickly for about $5.50 each way.  Having the CVS located on the first floor is a huge help to grab snacks for the parks or forgotten sunscreen.  My ONLY complaint: no bath tubs
Manager Response: Dear glindy,  Thank you for your review. I appreciate you mentioning our location and what a quick 10 minute walk we are to the Disney parks.   We hope you will come visit real soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Every staff member greets you from the moment you walk in and down the hallway to your room.  It's a pleasant energy to experience after a long day at work.   I absolutely love the elevator music!  You feel like you are at a sunny beach party for 30 seconds.  What a great subtle touch to liven up your spirit before you get to your room.
Manager Response: Dear LDolo,  Thank you for your feedback. I am happy to read that you enjoyed your stay and even had a mini "beach party" on the way up!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We stayed 3 nights and it was AMAZING.  It's so close to Disney Parks (walking distance: 15 minutes)  Rooms are SO spacious. The room we had had 2 beds and a sofa that can be turned into a bed, perfect for families.  Breakfast is included and you have a CVS like 1 minute away from the lobby.  Definitely will come back again.
Manager Response: Dear Gretchen B,  Thank you for an "AMAZING" review.  Our breakfast is complimentary for our guests and served from 6:30am-9:30am during the week and 7am-10am on the weekends... just enough in case you want to sleep in a bit!  Thank you again for your feedback and we will see you when you return!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: The price was very reasonable, the room was perfect, and I really enjoyed my short one day stay. I went to a birthday celebration at a water park and was too tired to drive back home. My daughter and I decided to grab a room for the night. The beds were very comfortable and the room was clean and quiet.
Manager Response: Dear Veronica B,  I am happy to read that you enjoyed your short visit with us.There is nothing like a comfortable plush bed after an exhausting day at a water park!  Thank you and we hope to see you back again!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: My sister and I visited the SpringHill Suites this past weekend and we were both so impressed with Matt's (at the front desk) customer service and hospitality! He was able to accommodate an early check-in which was very helpful since we were heading to Disneyland for the day. We are both annual pass-holders and we tend to spend quite a bit of time overnight in Anaheim; we will definitely be back.  Thanks Matt!
Manager Response: Dear hihiimhailey,  It is such a pleasure to know that my team accommodated you so much that you were compelled to write a review! I have shared your review with both Matt and my team. We hope to see you back on so you can enjoy another fun day at the park!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Not that close to Disneyland, I was thinking it was walkable. We had the intention of going back in the evening but it wasn’t that close to walk and we were tired. The hotel is great. Nice clean rooms, yummy breakfast, great service. We can’t wait to stay again.

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel.  The location was great.  Less than 3/4 mile to Disneyland.  About a 15 minute leasurely walk.  The staff was wonderful.  Every one of them was helpful and attentive to my needs.  Breakfast was a complimentary buffet.  Lots of choices and plenty of food that was constantly refilled.  A gentleman and lady were walking to each table to see if you needed anything and checking how our party was doing.  I was very pleased.  The only negative thing I have to say is that I had an accessible room and it was very far down a long hallway instead of closer to the elevators.  It also did not have a safety lock on the door.  They told me it was because of the accessible designation, but in all my travels, this is the only hotel that I've encountered

Summary Heading: Springhill Suites turned a disaster into a "Happily Ever After"
Summary: We flew into town for a Mother's day weekend at Disney. We had booked another hotel, when we arrived they had a "profile" for us but no reservation and they had no rooms left of the type we booked. As I was quickly starting to panic thinking that our family of 6 had no where to stay, my husband walked outside and into the Springhill Suites. He was met by Jacqui, the night auditor. He explained the situation, and she was so kind and helpful and took care of us immediately. The rooms were clean, large, well furnished and the customer service was outstanding. Thank you to Jacqui and staff for turning a potential disaster into an amazing weekend!
Manager Response: Dear Julshernandez,  I am happy to see that we were able to accommodate you and your family during an inconvenient time. Thank you for your generous comments and we hope to be able to back in the Anaheim area very soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Great location, Beautiful layout, Service has room for improvement.
Summary: We had one night stay for our son Basketball tournament. Excellent location with lots of dinning to choose from, CVS store attached to hotel. Checked in went smoothly thanks to front desk, room is in good size, with sofa bed. Bed is very comfortable.Breakfast is a step up from typical Springhill suites with bacon options:).   One inconvenience we got is the respond time of requested could be more efficient. In couple incidents, we has to make a second call to follow up then still take another 20- 30 minutes for items to delivered. Give a benefit of doubt staffs may be very busy, and over all we still happy with our stay. Thank you.
Manager Response: Dear ASW22,  Thank you for your feedback!  I am happy to read that you found our location helpful in regards to proximity to convenient stores and dining options. We are also adjacent to Coffee Bean and a short 2 minute walk from Starbucks if you need your daily dose of coffee like I do!  I have shared your comments with my team in regards to efficiency and response time. We take our feedback very seriously and use it as a driving force for improvement.  Thank you again and we hope to see you back very soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: My experience at this hotel was great. The room was very spacious and there was plenty of room for six of us. There was two queen beds and a sofa bed. The free breakfast was delicious. There was bagels, waffles, eggs, fruit and other things. The staff was great. Billy was nice and professional when he checked us in. Also we were able to walk to Disneyland from this hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel - Good Service and Amenities
Summary: Pros: Front desk was always available.  Room clean and temperature control in room very good and even.  Bed was very comfortable as were linens.  Breakfast buffet was impressive and well stocked.  CVS, starbucks, coffee bean, and walgreens all within a block.  Uber was 25-30 to and from SNA Orange County Airport (very nice airport).  Disneyland is within walking distance.  Fireworks visible every night from hotel roof.  Lots of jogging options if you run around the perimeter of Disneyland.  Conference center is about a 5-10 minute very enjoyable walk.  Cons: Pool was not heated and cold, Fitness room was very basic and automated lights kept going out on me when I was using it, Fireworks viewing from roof was obstructed by dirty glass.  Wish it was more like a cruise ship

We arrived on a Thursday in the afternoon, checking in was prompt but not corteous, don’t reception workers smile anymore!?? Our room was ready, average suite, average size. We loved that our room was facing the Main Street, we could see everything from our room, #339 by the way.  We had a sofa bed that’s down to the wires, very uncomfortable and had a huge satin on it, pretty gross, we used all the comforters available to cover it. No safe in any of the rooms, that was a bummer. Breakfast was horrible, the bare minimum and nothing of quality, basically junk. We had a small fridge, and bathroom was brand new and very nice. We ended up cutting our stay by two days because Anaheim is boring, after you visit Disney and the other parks there’s really not much else to do.
Manager Response: Dear gsald661- We are glad to hear you enjoyed your spacious suite with the fantastic view.

Summary: The hotel itself is OK, but our room was dusty everywhere. It seems like it has not been dusted for few weeks. Cleaning service itself was doing decent job to exchange the towels and remove the garbage. Nothing more.     The breakfast was not that I would expect from Marriott at all. It seems like Marriott gets the breakfast from outside and comes in plastic bags. Those plastic bags full of food placed in containers for us to it. Not healthy at all in my opinion.      Even though hotel is kind of new, the shower area already needs remodeling. On top of that it has only one sink.       I probably would not come back to this hotel, taking in consideration $300 price tag I paid and the quality I received.
Manager Response: Dear Alex B: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Springhill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and sharing your feedback with us. Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to ensure our guests experience relaxing and worry free stay with us. We are truly grateful that you allowed us to be the host hotel during your stay in Anaheim. We hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.   Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center

Summary: This hotel is right across the street from Disneyland.  Run by Marriott so you would expect it is well managed.  Clean.  Has some underground parking which is also wonderful in that neighborhood. The complementary breakfast is also what you would expect.  Not bad but the bacon was clearly microwaved and there’s really no excuse for that.  Everything else was fresh. The staff was also really nice.

Summary Heading: very nice hotel, breakfast far surpasses other hotels
Summary: We had a great stay.  Breakfast far surpassed other hotels, even disney resorts, as they served protein items instead of just pastries and waffles with syrup.  The twin beds for the kids made the kids sooo happy.  The fireworks were viewable at night from the rooftop access but they did not stream the coordinating music which was a let down.  Would I stay again YES!
Manager Response: Dear ptcaccyoung: We are thrilled to hear from another guest that had a great stay at the lovely Anaheim Springhill Suites Resort/Convention Center Hotel. We thank you for all of your kind comments regarding our hotel staff and the great service they provided you during your stay.  We love hearing that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast.  We look forward to you returning to the Springhill Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing property if you are going to Disneyland
Summary: Amazing service from the front desk to housekeeping!  You get daily breakfast that is actually a breakfast and staff there was helpful also!  Walking distance to the park!  Also places to eat near hotel.  Will stay here again for sure
Manager Response: Dear Greysonmom1: Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us.  We are glad to see that our clean and spacious suite worked perfectly for your stay. We thank you for all of your kind comments about our complimentary breakfast and staff.  We are truly grateful that you allowed us to be the host hotel during your stay in Anaheim. We look forward to providing you with an amazing stay the next time you return to the Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center hotel. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary: We stayed 2 nights for a trip to Disneyland.  It was convenient with about a 15 minute walk to the park.  Close enough to come back in the middle of the day for a respite from the heat and to recharge for the evening return.  The rooms were huge and clean.  The breakfast was good.  Only gave 4 stars, because there was a bad experience at check out.  When we went to check out, we had to wait at least 10 minutes while the person manning the front desk was on the phone with another customer.  The normal protocol is to put the customer on the phone on hold, service the customer at the desk, then go back to the phone customer.  That's happened to me at other hotels when I was the phone or desk customer.  We also asked if they could get somebody else to help, but didn't really get a
Manager Response: Dear gowarriors2018: Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us.  We are glad to see that our clean and spacious suite worked perfectly for your stay. We thank you for all of your kind comments about our complimentary breakfast. We apologize for any delay we caused you during the departure process. We are truly grateful that you allowed us to be the host hotel during your stay in Anaheim. We look forward to providing you with an amazing stay the next time you return to the Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center hotel. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for families.
Summary: Great place to stay for families.  Very accommodating staff.  Breakfast was very good.  Rooms were clean and well laid out.  Everything that you need for a trip to local theme park.  Parking garage was a little tight but got the job done and felt secure.  Lobby and public spaces were clean despite high traffic.  Very quick access to CVS and coffee shop.  Shan at the front desk was very helpful and courteous.
Manager Response: Dear T4122JYbrianp- Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us.  We are glad to see that our clean and spacious suite worked perfectly for your stay. We thank you for all of your kind comments regarding the courteous service Shan provided you during your stay. We are truly grateful that you allowed us to be the host hotel during your stay in Anaheim. We look forward to providing you with an amazing stay the next time you return to the Springhill Suites-Anaheim Resort/Convention Center hotel. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Option for Family Trip to Disneyland
Summary: It's often tough to find a reasonably priced room for a family with 3 kids who don't want to share a bed, so the family suite at SpringHill Suites Anaheim was perfect. With one kid on a pull out sleeper sofa (single bed) and two kids in the bunk beds, even mom & dad each got a bed to ourselves after long days at Disney! The complimentary breakfast buffet had more options than I expected, and the food was average quality. My only complaint is that our room was not serviced by housekeeping one day and on a separate day, even though it was serviced, we were left with no toilet paper. The walk to the park was less than 10 minutes, short enough that we even chose to come back for a midday break one day. Overall, I would recommend to others and would stay again if we chose to do

I stay at a lot of Marriotts, especially SpringHill Suites. This is hands down the best one I’ve patronized. As an elite member, they gave me a great room upgrade and an early check in. The only downside is that you have to pay $20/night for parking. Regardless, a quality hotel that I would come back to.

Summary Heading: Took grown kids & grandkids to Disney!
Summary: For a Christmas present we gifted a trip to Disneyland to our son, daughter-in-law, daughter, and two grandkids.  Trying to find one room adequate and comfortable for that many people was extremely difficult.  I searched Tripadvisor for days - rooms were too small or too expensive...SpringHill was just perfect!!  We had two twin beds, one fold-out couch, and bunk beds for the kids which they totally loved!!! Our maid was so sweet, she arranged and decorated with their PJs & stuffed animals every day. Breakfast was amazing...so wonderful to start our day off with a great selection of food which worked for everyone.  Our little guy especially liked watching Disney cartoons while he ate.  Pool deck was also wonderful...our first night we didn't go into the park but watched the

We have attended Wonder Con, D23 Expo and Celebration over the last several years and stayed at various hotels.  This hotel has it all and will be our choice from now on.  *Location!  Right on the corner of Katella & Harbor.  There's a CVS and a Coffee Bean on the property.  Easy walk to the Convention Center & Disneyland.  7Eleven across the street & a variety of quick bite & sit down restaurants.  *Parking.  On site.  $20/day.  Underground.  Safe.  Worth it!  *Rooms.  Clean.  Spacious.  Fridge. And we got a free upgrade!  *Staff.  Friendly & helpful.  *Breakfast.  Included.  Great selection.  Delicious! Our family lived our stay here.  We can't wait to come back!

This is a very clean and upscale hotel.  The rooms were large and very clean.  Breakfast included. They had a large variety, but come very early or very late.  Right next door to cvs and Pizza Hut.  This is very handy when you have small children who want to eat at all times of the day. 10 minute walk to Disneyland..save some parking money.

Summary Heading: All the people were extremely friendly
Summary: It was my first time staying here for the Natural Products Expo West and I was very pleased. The room was great - not too fancy for my tastes but in excellent condition, tastefully decorated and  super clean. The employees were all extremely friendly.

Stayed here May 2017 with school group. Nice location - decent breakfast - even though I don't like buffets. Room was good size and quiet on Katella side. The front desk staff was excellent and always pleasant.

Summary Heading: Outstanding location for Disneyland and roof top views of the Disney parade at night
Summary: I have stayed here 3 times in the past year and you can't beat the value in staying here for a family vacation to Disneyland. Something I found out on this trip was you can see the Disneyland fireworks from the 5th floor deck! I actually got to reading the handy flyer they gave out telling everything about the hotel, activities and things to know. I ended up reading that the fireworks were visible from the roof top deck! We got in late evening and did not have time to go to Disneyland and ended up at the deck and it was very nice! Lots of room and seats set up for viewing. You can also see them from the roof top swimming pool! Although they are a short distance away, it was a great site to see and not have to fight the people to get out of the park! The deck is very nice too.

Summary Heading: Superb Location for Convention Center or Disneyland
Summary: A modern and clean hotel very close to both the convention center and Disneyland.  It was less than 2 blocks to the Convention center and less than 20 minutes walk to Downtown Disney. Friendly front desk staff and nice rooms are some of the highlights. You can watch the Disney fireworks from the roof (although they were not scheduled during my stay in February). Decent breakfast buffet, similar to other Springhill Suites. I was solo but got a family suite which had two queen beds and also bunkbeds for kids.

Clean, quiet and spacious room. Easy walk to Disneyland. Nice breakfast buffet. Great staff. Convenient and secure parking. Several restaurants within walking distance. Good for familes with kids or an adult trip.

Great location to stay for Disneyland.  Rooms were spacious and very comfortable and a good breakfast in the lobby.  Would stay again for sure.  You can catch the ART bus to the park across the street so it makes it very easy to get back and forth.

This was our 4th trip to Anaheim and this hotel was by far the best we have stayed at. A short walk to the “Happiest Place on Earth”. The size of the rooms were great lots of space! The breakfast was fantastic lots of choice. A big thank you to our cleaners they were all so pleasant and did an amazing job each day 😀laundry room was also great.  We will definitely stay here again!! 10 out of 10 Springhill !!!!

Asad from front desk was really professional and helpful. I would like to thank him for letting me fell like it was home away from home . I would like to thank him on recommendation on places to eat and direction . He was able to get us on early morning check and was able to get my 2 room reservation.  The front desk Joanna wasn’t really friendly when she was assistanting me kind of had a little attitude or not felt welcomed. I’m glad I went outside to grab my wife information to check and Superman Asad help me check in and I felt my attitude of this hotel change . Asad thanks again and I will be back .

I found the room we were in to be very run down. I expected our Bedding to be changed when we had asked for a cleaning but both times the same top sheet was left on the bed. My boys had dropped some food on the top sheet and the stain was there our entire trip. It seemed as if they stuck all families together on the same floor in close proximity. This made for loud mornings and evenings. I specifically asked for a nice room upon check in and I feel like they failed us in this aspect. Under our pull out sofa bed were piles of left over food from other guests and the couch itself hadn't been thoroughly wiped down. The carpet is pretty disgusting. They should consider getting tile throughout the rooms as all hotels should. The eating area was not kept up during the morning rush so
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review of your most recent stay with us.  I sincerely apologize for the issues you experienced with cleanliness.  I have shared your comments with our team to ensure that this was an isolated issue and is addressed moving forward.  Thank you for being our guest and we hope to regain your trust on your next visit to the area.

Summary: We stayed here within walking distance to Disneyland. The family room was very roomy. Worked great with still plenty of room.   Rooms were clean and the staff very friendly. Breakfast was pretty predictable but had plenty of options to choose from.   Perfect with cvs in the bottom level with easy access from the hotel. Perfect as it's open 24 hrs.   Pool on th top floor with great views to the fireworks and no crowds!    Definitely would stay here again.

This hotel was a great choice for our family of 3 to stay for our Disney trip. Upon entering the room my family even made the comment that I should plan all of our future vacations lol!   Pros: Very modern clean large rooms, spacious bathrooms, lots of surfaces to put luggage or toiletries, close to the shuttles to Disneyland, CVS underneath the hotel, free breakfast, quick friendly front desk service, and you can see the fireworks show from the rooftop!  Cons: Thin walls, could hear stomping upstairs and yelling in the hallways, luckily this was not at night time, only during the day when everyone was waking up to get to the parks, (if you plan on sleeping all day bring some earplugs). It was very clean, and I did not feel uncomfortable at all, but i did notice some attention

Actually I would give this place a 4.5, but that was not an option so I did 5 PROS The staff was WONDERFUL; from the front desk, the breakfast crew to the cleaning department. They are why I gave it a 5 I stayed here October 14-18, 2017. This is a dog friendly hotel and it was great that I could bring my dog with me; all 7 pounds of him.  The cleaning staff on the 4th floor where I stayed were wonderful. The older lady seemed to be training the other two ladies and they were so nice. I cant remember the older ladies name, but SHE WAS GREAT  How often do you write about housekeeping? The breakfast crew was on top of it. I cant remember the guy's name but he could only use one hand. HE WAS GREAT. He was constantly replenishing all of the items that were low and always cleaning. he

We switched to this hotel because the one at the Hilton was loud.  We were OK for one night but the next night a family checked in who stomped around non-stop - I had gotten up at 3am to run the 10k at Disneyland and was trying to take a nap so we called down to the front desk to complain - they immediately started stomping worse - non-stop for like half an hour.   Eventually we ended up moving rooms - the front desk refused to do anything about the noise - so we had to move rooms AGAIN.    I like this hotel location - I like the coffee shop connected - I like that there is a store attached at the bottom and you can see the fireworks from the room.  There is plenty of storage for bags and luggage and they have well-kept and updated rooms in a primo location within 10 minutes
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review of your most recent stay with us.  I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you encountered in regards to the noise.  I will be sure to share your comments with our team to ensure that this was an isolated issue and is addressed moving forward.  Thank you for being our guest and we hope to welcome you on your next visit to the area.

Summary: My wife and I took our children to Disneyland for thanksgiving to begin another tradition. We decided upon staying here and let me say what a great decision it was! First we have annual passes with parking but if we wanted to walk it would not have taken long seeing as we were only a block away! And with complimentary breakfast every morning and a bar to end your evening at; this was the perfect place! The pool on the roof was a tad bit small but what a view of the fireworks we had! We will be back for sure!

This hotel is over shadowed by the large Marriott right next door. You notice the pharmacy, before you notice the hotel. The entrance to the hotel is what I would call through the back ally. The Prime Time shuttle driver actually drove past the entrance as he was taking us to the much larger Marriott property. The lobby is a medium size very modern looking. The lobby connects to the area where they serve breakfast in the morning. Although we arrived early and were expecting to have to put our bags into storage as we wanted to get to Disneyland. We were plesantly surprised that our room was available. They do offer the disney park passes if you are staying for several days. But our trip was a one night. They sell the bus tickets to get you to the park. Transit buses run several

Summary Heading: A solid option with lots of amenities
Summary: My husband and I spent four nights at this hotel while visiting Disneyland and had a nice stay. I have a handful of nitpicky critiques to share, but overall the hotel was still a great option for us and we would consider staying there again next time. (The only deterrent being the sheer number of hotel options in the area.)  We lucked out and the staff member I spoke to, having mentioned that it was our honeymoon, assigned us his favourite room -- Room 543. This is a king bed room on the top floor, right on the corner of Harbor and Katella. Neat view of the parks and all the hustle and bustle below. Lots of natural light since two walls were entirely window. Downside was substantial road noise. Only woke me once, and my light sleeping husband wasn't bothered at all, but could

The rooms were large with a separate lounge and sleeping areas.  Two TVs and views of Disneyland and the fireworks.  the pool area is on the 5th floor and you can see the fireworks at nigh. They provide a good spread for breakfast with adequate seating and locations with food choices.  They are very pet friendly and the staff were very gracious. It is an easy walk to the Disney parks and there are a wide variety of restaurants Choose from.
Manager Response: Dear Mercurio,  We would like to thank you for posting such wonderful review of our hotel. Your positive feedback continues to drive us to do our best and provide our guests with exceptional stays. We look forward to serving you soon.

Summary: We were really pleased with the location, hotel condition, breakfast and staff.  We arrived early and we were going straight to the park.  The front desk rep held our luggage and allowed us to go ahead and park in their garage.  The room was spacious and updated.  We did a lot of searching and comparing based on hotels within walking distance of Disney.  We thought this was the best overall value.  Really glad we stayed at SpringHill and would go back again when in the area.
Manager Response: Dear CharlieMickKeith,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We hope to see you back soon and wish you a prosperous 2018.

Summary: We recently stayed here for 9 nights at this hotel, and found it a great spot for being close to the parks, as well visiting other attractions in both Anaheim and greater Los Angeles.  The pros - close to parks (10-15 minute walk), quiet, clean room and breakfast provided in the eating area on the ground floor. Cons - pricey, and additional cost of $20 per night for car parking.  Also if you are interested in a great pool area, this is not the place for you (very small rooftop pool). We happened to be in town at the same time as the Blizzcon convention, so prices were high and hotel was busy.  We were unable to have our preferred room (king bed) on the first night of our arrival, but they were very good about moving our luggage etc to a king room for our second night onwards.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review of your most recent stay with us.  I sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay.  I will be sure to share your comments with our team to ensure that this was an isolated issue and is addressed moving forward.  Thank you again for being our guest and we hope to welcome you on your next visit to the area.

Summary: Traveled with a family of 4 for a 3 night stay at Disney. This was our first stay at this hotel, but definitely won't be our last. It's hard to find a reasonably priced hotel with everything you're looking for in a Disney trip, but this comes as close as we've seen.  Walking to the entrance of the parks takes approximately 10 minutes, with two roads to cross. We've stayed closer to the gates, but sacrificed hotel quality, breakfast, etc. along the way. The hotel being situated above a CVS was particularly useful for restocking on drinks, sunscreen, and snacks. The amazing rooms, beds, and hot breakfast make this a pretty easy decision for us. The rooftop pool and seating area is perfect for fireworks viewing, although the pool is a tad small.   Our room was spacious,
Manager Response: Dear Danlk1421QI,  Thank you for taking the time to post such a wonderful review of our property. We hope that you had a great holiday season and look forward to serving you in the future.   Wishing you a great 2018.

Summary Heading: Great Disney location and incredible staff
Summary: This location was very convenient for walking to Disneyland.  The thing that I found most impressive about this property was the friendly helpful staff.  Every time I interacted with someone at this location, they were so friendly and upbeat!  We found the breakfast to be good and well stocked and thought the rooftop deck a pretty cool location to view the fireworks.  Also very convenient having a CVS right there.
Manager Response: Dear Bill,  Thank your your kind words and great review. We hope that you had a great holiday season and look forward to serving you in the future.

Summary Heading: OCD Mom loves this hotel for Disney family vacation!
Summary: This was a great hotel for a Disney family vacation.  Here's what I loved about it:  - Very close to Disneyland...a 10 minute walk or you can get on ART for a quicker trip that drops you right by the security lines. - Free Expansive breakfast.  It's not the usual buffet items most hotels offer.  They had a great fruit selection, lots of toppings for oatmeal, spinach, salsa, cheese, eggs, sausage gravy and biscuits, sausage, cereals, make-your-own-waffles with various toppings.  This breakfast would have cost us $60 for our family of 5 each day. - Huge rooms!  Ours had a bunkbed, a sofa bed, and two queens.  We had a huge wardrobe, plenty of drawers and two TVs. - The hotel is newer and our room was very clean.  The housekeepers did a great job keeping it clean and stocked.  I'm
Manager Response: Dear Sheila R,  Thank you so much for the FANTASTIC review. Your feedback will continue to help our hotel get better and will be a great source of information for our TripAdvisor community. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you and your family during your next Disneyland trip.

Summary: Stayed 3 nights with a family of 5. Convenient to walking to Down Town Disney but purchased shuttle tickets as it's a bit far to walk after a day at the park. Room was clean, beds comfortable and enjoyed the microwave with refrigerator for making quick meals. Breakfast buffet was good hot and cold food provided. Workout room was great lots of options including free weights and there is a laundry room. It is a very nice hotel. My only complaints are there is no separation of toilet and sink area and the room is on the small side with the tv at an odd angle. That being said those were minor personal preferences that would not keep us from staying at Springhill on our future Disney trips.
Manager Response: Dear 6jellybeans,  Thank you for taking the time to post such a wonderful review of our property. We are honored that you chose our hotel as your home away from home and hope to see you back with us very soon!

Summary: Excellent walking location to Disneyland, very clean, breakfast inc, friendly staff, beautiful suite, would recommend this hotel, near CVS and Walgreens for every day items, easy parking, would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Lealea2424,  Thank you for posting such a great review of our hotel. Your feedback is very important to our success. We hope to see you back with us very soon.

Summary: We recently stayed here for six nights. The rooms are large, clean and comfy. No safe in the room which i thought strange but other than that i couldn't fault the rooms. The hotel is a good 15 minute walk to Disney - I've stayed closer before and in the heat it wasn't fun walking but we did it. My daughter is 12 but not sure how little kids would go. Breakfast is basic, toast, waffles, bagel etc but that is all we required so i wouldn't complain. The pool is small but rooftop area is large and quite sufficient. The hotel staff were super friendly too. Loved that CVS was under the hotel and Walgreens across the road. Easy to duck in and get snacks and drinks for Disney.
Manager Response: Dear kjt313,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and look forward to your next stay. Please let us know if there is anything that we can help with in the meantime.

Summary: We stayed here for a couple nights when the plan was to go to Disneyland, and it was just about perfect. The hotel is very nice and very clean, and the breakfast was pretty good. The parking was great, seemed like plenty of room - we never had trouble finding a space. The elevators were quick, although slightly less so at the peak of the Saturday morning stampede for the breakfast buffet.
Manager Response: Dear Alex W,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with our team and our TripAdvisor community. Your feedback is crucial to our hotels' success and can't thank you enough for your kindness. We look forward to hosting you during your next trip.

Summary: We stayed for 2 nights to go to Disneyland. The hotel was very quiet even being that close to the park.  The bed was comfy and pillows were great!  The bathroom was big and well lit.  We will definitely be staying here again!!
Manager Response: Dear Melissa G,  Thank you for taking the time to post such a wonderful review of our property. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay and bedding package. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: Overall the hotel was as expected from reading other reviews. If you only want this hotel for the free breakfast, you better think again. I've had better free breakfast at other Marriotts. This was nothing to wake up early for. For the rest of the property it was as expected; clean, staff was helpful and polite and the rooms were bigger than expected. The only real complaint we had is the A/C would blow down directly off the ceiling and on to your face while sleeping.   The room was really clean and big, hotel is about 15 minutes walking to the tram or walk the 20 minutes to the Disney. Save the wait and walk the entire way to Downtown Disney.  We will stay here again. Just don't expect big things from the free breakfast, we didn't choose this hotel for the breakfast and neither
Manager Response: Dear Anthony S,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. I will make our food and beverage manager aware of your comments to see what might have been missed during your stay for breakfast to get such low remarks. We appreciate feedback and thank you for your positive comments, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you during your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: Recently stayed here for 6 nights.  Great location to Disneyland around 10 minute walk to main gate.  Easy check in, stayed in family suite and was very happy with size.  Beds very comfy, sofa bed in lounge not so comfy o we did not use.  Mini bar fridge and microwave in room very handy.  After we checked in and dropped bags off we wandered back downstairs and there was a bus load of guests being dropped off that were there for some kind of dance convention at least 50 kids under say 14, I really hoped thyethey would not be on our floor but sadly was wrong  so here are my pros and cons:- Pros:-  Front desk staff were awesome.  Nothing was a problem for them, they organised trips for us and transfers, all with a smile.  Could not fault them at all and made our visit very
Manager Response: Dear Swoozie70,  Thank you for taking the time to post your positive review. I will make sure that our front desk gets recognized for all of their hard work. Please accept our sincere apologies for noise coming from our dance teams. We make every effort to ensure that all of our guests have a pleasant stay. Your recommendations are very much valued and will make sure that they get communicated to our group coordinators and front office teams. We hope to see you back with us soon!

Summary: The room we had was great.  It had two queen sized beds, two bunks and a foldout couch.  Perfect for our family - 2 adults and 16, 13 and 12 year old. The breakfast provided was good, but you needed to get down before 8am to beat the crowds each day.  It was nice and close to Disneyland and the kids loved swimming in the pool most days.  The hotel was clean and modern, and the beds were very comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear Critta41,   Thank you for posting such a great review of our property. We hope that your time at Disneyland was filled with great memories and lots of laughter. We look forward to hosting you and  your family during your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary: Easy 10min walk to Disneyland and California Adventureland. Room spacious and clean with Fridge, Microwave and Coffee maker. Lots of towells and nice toiletries. King bed was comfy! CVS and Wallgreens handy for snacks for park. Breakfast was included which was good (basic but enough for oatmeal/fruit/coffee/toast) and was one less meal to plan. Quiet location which was not expected but a few beggars on the walk to/from park. Would come again due to handy location and quiet rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Holly,  Thank you for sharing your positive experience with our hotel and our TripAdvisor community. We want to thank you for choosing our hotel as your home away from home and look forward to serving you in the future.

Summary: Hotel was a good place to stay close to Disneyland and close to lots of places to eat. The room was good for our family with 2 teenage kids enough space and bedding. Kids didn't have to sleep together which was great. Pool area a little small, gym was good and laundry service convenient. Breakfast included but very average. Definitely recommend it.
Manager Response: Dear astyli,  Thank you for taking the time to post such a wonderful review. It was a pleasure to host you and your family on your most recent trip to our Disneyland area. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you once again.   Thank you for recommending us to our TripAdvisor community

Summary: Hotel was walking distance to Disneyland, located above a CVS and it was walking distance to restaurants, which was great. It was family friendly and upon arrival we were treated friendly by all staff members. Our room was spacious and it was very clean. The only thing that was wrong with the room was that the bathroom lock didn't work and the sofa bed wasn't great quality.  Free breakfast was great, but I would recommend that you go during slow time because the waffle line gets long and its a waiting process. I would recommend the hotel have the waffles pre-made to avoid long lines during rush time. Pool was a bit small, but the overall the hotel was very nice and I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Marisol,  Thank you for sharing your experience with our hotel and our TripAdvisor community. We are happy to hear that you had a great stay with us and hope to see you and your family back with us very soon. Please contact us if there is anything that we can assist you with the meantime.

Summary: Had an excellent experience.  This hotel is conveniently located by Maingate Disneyland and CVS pharmacy for a quick walk.  We normally take Uber or Lyft, but even found it faster to walk and made it to the maingate in less than 10 minute walk.  We love Marriott- favorite hotel chain of all- we travel 150 days a year for business and pleasure and whenever we can, we try to book Marriott because of consistent experience.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for taking the time to post your review and for your loyalty to our brand. Our loyal customers are at the core of our success and we can't begin to thank you for everything that you do. We look forward to your next visit with us.

Summary: Stayed here for a night and the hotel is about a year old I think so everything is nice and clean. The staff was very friendly upon check in.   The rooms are very spacious, only bad thing I have to say about the room is the pull out couch is awful. Not that I expect much at all from a pull out bed but if you moved a single muscle the thing was the loudest bed I've ever heard and the springs were poking you all night long you are better off just leaving it as a couch and sleeping on that. Bathrooms were a good size and clean and they have Paul Mitchell.   Breakfast was very good tons of options and actually good. To me it is not a bad walk if you're going to the parks. It's also below a cvs which can come in handy.  Will stay here again overall a great new hotel To stay at.
Manager Response: Dear Disneytink,  We want to thank you for taking the time to post your review. Your feedback is very important to us and crucial to our success. If possible, please contact our property to let us know what room your were in so that we may fix/replace the noisy couch. We want to ensure that all of our guests get a comfortable nights rest and would like to follow up with this specific room.   Thank you again for great review and we look forward to hosting you and your family on your next trip.

Summary Heading: Bunk-Beds would be the only reason I'd come back
Summary: The hotel is a 20 minute walk -with little kids- to Disneyland -especially when you walk home at night. There were about 5 homeless people begging for $ on our route both days we were there.  The hotel room has bunk beds -which the kids and my wife and I all loved -it afforded the kids their own space to sleep -so no more "he's on my side" -with those. Beyond that the room was not as clean when we got in as we are used to, and when I came back to the room for our 3yo's nap it apparently negated the ability to have the room cleaned that day... Breakfast was like being in the park -meaning it's very busy. the hotel keeps up with the flow fairly well. There is no real Half & Half for the coffee in the morning -which for me is a big deal. (There is a Starbucks about 1/2 a block
Manager Response: Dear Windsor999,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. Please accept our most sincere apologies for inconvenience experienced during this stay. Our city has various outreach programs for our homeless population to provide them with the much needed help. We will also follow up with housekeeping department about the cleanliness of your suite. Cleanliness is a top priority for us and can assure you that this is not a common occurrence. We thank you for your feedback and hope to see you back with us on your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary: Great hotel, great value, check in was perfect.  The bear and bartender were excellent. I loved that I could smoke my cigars outside.  Hotels close to Disneyland, room was clean and very nice.  I have stayed here three or four times, each time was  excellent
Manager Response: Dear Club33david,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post your review and thank you for choosing our hotel during over the years as your home away from. It is a pleasure serving you and look forward to your next visit.

Summary: An easy walk right into Disneyland, a happy & helpful staff, comfortable & spacious rooms -- certainly all you need to make a great stay.  Even though most of the guests are Disney-bound, the rooms were quiet and the rooftop pool wasn't crowded.  The breakfast area is right in the lobby so you can't miss it, & although the traffic flow is a little odd, there's a good selection of food (included in the hotel rate).  There are also plenty of places within a short walk -- ice cream, liquor stores, restaurants, & a very convenient CVS right downstairs.  It's also fun to view the Disneyland fireworks from the pool deck (through plexiglass), & underground parking is a plus.
Manager Response: Dear dacemore,  Thank you for posting your wonderful review. We hope that your trip the the Anaheim area was pleasant and memorable. We thank you for choosing us as your home away from and hope to see you back with us in the near future.

Summary: Room was well configured for families with children.  It was clean and the pool area was perfect for children.  But do not forget anything at checkout.  4 hours after checkout I called the hotel and was told housekeeping did not find anything in the room and nothing had been documented on their list.  I was transferred to the hotel manager but the voice mail was full.  I called back and was transferred to the general manager who was also out of the hotel.  His voice mail was not full.  I left a message Saturday and I have not been called by Wednesday evening.  Not impressed with the hotel lost and found policy.
Manager Response: Dear Dawn B,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review.  Our housekeeping staff works very hard to ensure that items left behind are quickly returned to their rightful owner. We know that souvenirs mean a lot more than their monetary value. Unfortunately, there are many items that are not allowed to be shipped. I would be more than happy to discuss this further and invite you to contact me at your earliest convenience. We want to thank you for your business and hope to see you back with us soon.

Summary Heading: Just steps away from the Disneyland Area
Summary: Very good location. CVS under the hotel is a nice touch. Really no complaints about this hotel. It served its purpose. Breakfast variety was the best I've experienced in years. However, the bacon and eggs were suspect. Everything else was great! Plenty of food even with a pack breakfast area. Our best breakfast time for picking a table was a Monday morning at 7a. Beds were comfortable, but if you have a specialty pillow bring it. I missed mine. Couldn't adjust to firm foam pillow, after requesting a firmer pillow. Bathroom was clean with no tub. So if you plan to bath a baby or soak, you may consider otherwise.   It took my family approximately 12 minutes to walk to the entry to Disneyland parks. In my opinion, this is the best thing going for this hotel. Plus being a Marriott
Manager Response: Dear DWHNO33,  It was a pleasure serving you and your family during your most recent trip to the Anaheim area. Your kinds words and positive feedback are very important to us and thank you for taking the time to post your review. We hope to see you back very soon.

Summary Heading: Half way through a 2 week stay
Summary: We wanted to stay here primarily to visit Disneyland but also visit other parts of LA, the location is perfect!! A very short walk to Disney which considering the amount of walking you do at the park you don't really notice it. Excellent room, certainly big enough for 4-6 people, could do with 2 toilets though! Major plus point is the free breakfast, basic but saves probably $50.00 a day if you were to eat out. Simple food and self service but enough to set you up for the day. We've had 2 problems so far, both dealt with immediately and efficiently, DO NOT book Room 411 this is directly below the roof top gym!! Being woken up by someone using the treadmill at 6.00 am is not much fun, moved rooms overnight without any fuss, all our stuff was moved for us too! Faulty microwave was
Manager Response: Dear Chrissseal4500,  Thank you for taking the time to post such a wonderful review of our property. We are grateful that you selected our hotel for your 2 week vacation and hope that you enjoyed every day with us. Please let us know if there is anything that we can assist with during the remaining portion of your stay.

Summary: Great hotel close to disneyland  and very clean. The hotel also provided excellent service  and they had a great breakfast in the morning. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and I would come here again with my family the next time we come to disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Gurjot,  Thank you for posting such a great review of our property. We hope to see you and your family back with us very soon.

Summary: Will think about coming back again.  Pricey as expected due to location.  Walking distance to/from Disneyland.  Rooms are spacious and great if multi-generations staying in the same room.  The customer service at the front desk was disappointing.  Room was not ready for early check in which was fine but asked the front desk clerk to text us when the room was ready......never received a text so around 5pm we decided to head back to check in and our room was ready.  I also got some push AJ because my Marriott members account is in my maiden name so goes the reservation as I made it with my Marriott account.  Major pushback from the front desk clerk....demanding that I give her ID with my maiden name on it.  I have checked into many, many Marriott hotels with my maiden name on the
Manager Response: Dear mariard,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. I want to apologize for the inconvenience that you experienced during your check-in process. With identity fraud so widespread these days, our commitment to preventing it is a top priority for our front office staff. I hope that the rest of your stay with us was above your expectations and hope to have you and your family back with us very soon.

Summary: Nice hotel with clean rooms.  They offer a free continental breakfast in the morning that has many different options to choose from. Park passes can be bought at the counter and they are within easy walking distance of the parks.  I will likely be back.
Manager Response: Dear Nick S,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We wish you happy travels and look forward to your return visit.

Summary: This hotel is comfortable and clean, just nothing to write home about. The breakfast was nice to have, but it would be good if they could switch things up. The rooftop pool was very basic - the only thing good about it was that it was on the roof an you can watch the fireworks. The beds were comfortable, the furniture is all plasticky so not very comfy. There is $20 per day parking - convenient if going to the parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete a survey in regards to your most recent stay with us.  As we pride ourselves in providing excellent service to all of our guests, I sincerely apologize that we fell short of your, and our, expectations.  I will share your comments with our team to ensure that this was an isolated issue and is addressed moving forward.  Thank you again for being our guest and we hope to welcome you on your next visit to the area.

Summary: I am here with a group of 46 teens. We are here for a fine arts competition. The hotel is nice overall. It's close to a lot of restaurants, the Anaheim convention center and Disney. Everything thing is wihin walking distance. The first day they did not clean our room so I had to ask them to clean it. The pool is small is small and on the rooftop but, can see the fireworks from Disney at night. We ate in the dining area at around 5pm every night with the teens and they didn't really like that much. We cleaned up and even took the garbage out of the big cans, changed the bags, wiped down the tables and swept but, still a bit of a attitude. So over all a ok experience.
Manager Response: Dear Patty D.  We want to thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. Please accept our sincere apology for the items that fell short of your expectations. Our number one goal is your satisfaction and ask that you stop by our front desk should there be anything that we can assist you with in order to make your stay more memorable. We wish you the best of luck in the competition.

Summary Heading: Family Hotel, Walking Distance to Disneyland
Summary: Comfortable family hotel, with large rooms and comfortable beds. Within walking distance to Disneyland (about 10 minutes), rooftop pool is small, however nice viewing area for fireworks. Breakfast buffet was good, always enough food. Would be nice if there was more variety. Really enjoyed having the pharmacy right next to hotel, as well as Subway for a quick dinner/lunch. Staff was friendly and helpful. Check in was smooth and efficient. We were allowed an early check-in without any hassle. We stayed in a family room with bunk beds, sofa sleeper and 2 queens. Beds were comfortable, bunk beds fit older kids just fine (teenagers). The only downside to the hotel was size of pool...very small and lack of hot tub. These weren't deal breakers for us, because we spent little time at
Manager Response: Dear Christina P,  Thank you for taking the time to post such a wonderful review of our hotel. We are glad that you had a great overall experience and hope to have the opportunity to serve you in the future. Our pool is a little smaller than most but also find that most guests spend their time at Disneyland and rarely do we see overcrowding. We hope to see you back very soon.

Summary: Just got home from taking the family on out Summer 2017 vacation to Disneyland and we stayed at this hotel for the second time this year (February 2017 as well). One of the reasons this is my new go-to hotel is due to the breakfast buffet that is included in the stay. My 7 year old loves the breakfast there, as do we. It enables us to kick start our day!  Staff is friendly and housekeeping is on top of things!  We arrived from the park late one night to find two cribs in our room and the front desk was fast enough to send someone up to retrieve them.   The only small little thing that wasn't a huge deal breaker for me (but could be for others) is the parking. Parking is $20 per night and most of the time it is full because it is a small underground parking. However, the sister
Manager Response: Dear Maze W,  Thank you for your loyalty to our hotel and for posting such a great review. We understand how important these family vacations are work very hard to make things great for each of our visiting families.   We hope to see you back very soon!

Summary: We are staying at Springhill for 5 nights for our Disney trip. Excellent rooms and breakfast. Only a 10 min. walk to Disney. I would stay here again if I come back again. 5 floors, a pool on the roof, and a parking garage underneath.
Manager Response: Dear stphn1825,  Thank you for the 5 star review. We love the positive feedback and hope to see you and your family back with us very soon.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our trip to Universal Studios. The staff was friendly and helpful and always greeted you. Great location for those who may be going to Disneyland, literally in walking distance. The hotel rooms were large and came with a Keurig coffee machine. This hotel does provide breakfast, which was helpful as we started our days early. Parking was $20 a day here and also a CVS at the corner of the hotel for those last minute needs. There are a lot of eateries in this area, from fast food restaurants to Cheesecake Factory and Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles. You will not be disappointed staying here, especially if traveling with your family to attend Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear 56michelem,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We hope that you had a great time at Universal Studios and hope to have the opportunity to serve you during your next Disneyland trip.   See you soon!

Summary: I'll start off by saying the hotel itself is in a wonderful location (10-15 minutes walking distance from Disneyland) and the rooms were comfortable! The housekeeping staff was very kind and do their jobs so well. There's a CVS right underneath the hotel in case you forget anything which was very convenient and a Starbucks across the street as well as an IHop!  I'm sad to say that the whole reason why I'm giving this place one star (because I have to or it would have gotten a zero) is because of the management and some of the staff. This hotel is considered pet friendly so we decided to bring along our 2 bichon frises for my sister who has special needs (she feels more comfortable traveling with them). Upon check in, they told us about the $75 cleaning fee for the dogs and
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your most recent stay. I thank you for the positive comments about the hotel and promise to investigate the events that were mentioned in your review. We love hosting our four legged friends and always aim to provide a problem free stay. I apologize that the pet policy was not clearly discussed upon your check in and will ensure that this gets addressed immediately to avoid any future misunderstandings. Please accept our sincere apology for the inconvenience and rest assured that we will look into the matter to make sure it does not happen again.

Summary Heading: Comfortable hotel that is close to Disney
Summary: Stayed at this hotel as part of our holiday with extended family. We had a travelling party of 9 and selected to stay in a family suite with bunk beds and a studio suite.   The positives of this hotel are: - new hotel with modern facilities - large rooms and suitable for families - location to Disneyland - washer / dryer facilities with change and detergent available at the front desk. - view Disney fireworks from the hotel pool/roof top  The areas for improvement: - quality of the free breakfast - more seating in dining area  Overall a comfortable hotel if travelling with a large family. The hotel is clean and staff are very personable.   We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Priy1975,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. Your feedback is crucial to our success and will take your recommendations for improvements to our next executive meeting to see what changes we are able to make. Your positive comments are a joy to read and will also pass these along to the staff to let them know what things we are doing well. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: This property is very well run: the rooms, common areas, and amenities are all spotless. You can't beat the location.
