Staff at all levels are friendly and genuinely interested in helping make the stay great. The front desk staff were especially helpful, and I'd liKe to thank Jacque for her extra assistance and friendly smile. Her associates on the night team even gave me great tips on navigating the Downtown Disney venue and parking which made going there fun and relaxing after a busy day.  While at Springhill, I had friends meet up with me who were staying in other convention center venues. They compared their experience to mine with envy. It was thanks to their suggesting I use Hotwire and risking one of their mystery deals that I even found Springhill in the first place.
Manager Response: Dear Walnut-Creeker,  Thank you for posting such positive notes about our hotel. I will make sure that we recognize Jacqui for going above and beyond to help you make the best out of your stay. We hope to see you back with us very soon.

Summary: This was by far the best place we've stayed near Disneyland. Last week was our 6th visit to Disneyland this year. We've stayed all over the place The Marriott, Holiday inn and Courtyard. The Springhill is new and perfectly designed. They got a little crowded at Breakfast but thats to be expected in a place that offers complimentary breakfast near a theme park. The pool is on the 5th floor, its not big but it was well maintained. The rooms were spotless and staff was extremely pleasant. We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear MGRTVL,  Thank you for posting such kind words about our hotel; we are pleased to hear that we were able to make such a positive impact on your most recent trip to Disneyland. We look forward to hosting you and your family during your next trip.

Summary: This SpringHill location was absolutely great! Literally within walking distance to many restaurants- my family and I took a 10-minute walk to a Denny's for brunch (as we were still operating on Eastern Time, and an 8-minute walk to Bubba Gump's, located within the Anaheim Garden Walk. There is an IHOP across the street and a Pizza Hut Express right behind SpringHill that offers room delivery from its sister hotel- Residence Inn.   Many persons can be seen walking to Disneyland/ Disney's California Adventure Park as the hotel is just that close to these attractions. We opted to drive to both parks and park our car for our younger family members who would most likely fall asleep on the way back. We also walked a short 10-minute walk to the Anaheim Convention Center for the D23
Manager Response: Dear balletd,  Thank you for posting such a great review of our property. It was a pleasure serving you and your family on this most recent trip to Anaheim.  We hope to see you back soon and invite you to contact us should there be anything that we can assist with until then.

Summary: This hotel was a 15 minute walk to the Disney parks. Beds were comfortable and our room had two TVs ehichvthe kids loved.  Breakfast bufffet was fine. Eggs were not as good as other spring hill suites we have Been to. Buffet are can 've crowded but we always found seats. We needed a few odds and ends and there is a CVS right next door and a walgreens accross the street. Rooms were clean and well maintained. Pool was a bit in the small side, but the kids enjoyed it. If I go back to Disneyland I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Sharon,  I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed your most recent stay with us. Thank you for the positive comments about our location and I promise to look into the eggs. All Springhill Suites use the same eggs so there should be little to no differences. I will follow up with my kitchen staff. Thank you for the feedback and hope to see you back with us very soon.

Summary: stayed here for the summer sorrie volleyball tournament at the convention center. Hotel is new . rooms are big. beds are comfy . Breakfast was great, full hot breakfast buffet ,cvs drug store , pizza hut right outside lobby. parking is 20.00 a day and a bit tight to get in and out. Walk to the convention center took about 7 minutes door to door. Was a little pricey after resort fees and parking ,so changed hotels after 3 days. would stay here again if the price fits my budget.
Manager Response: Dear Perrymahoe,  Thank your taking the time to post such a wonderful review. It is a pleasure to host competitors from these tournaments each year and hope that you and your family had a great time (and success). We are sad to hear that you had to move hotels during the middle of your stay and would recommend that you stop by our front desk on your next trip to see if there are any specials going on so that we can keep you with us for your entire stay.

Summary: Super clean, mini suite wasn't really mini. Actually quite large, bathroom could use better lighting, but still rates a 7. Breakfast Buffett included, which was a 7... a 10 is full service, espresso, etc...  It's walking distance to D-land. The fireworks view on the pool deck is  unobstructed. I hjghy reconnected  SpringHill suited in Anaheim,
Manager Response: Good morning minombreesISABELLA,  We want to thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are thrilled to hear that you had a great experience during your most recent stay and hope to have the opportunity to serve you when your travels bring you back to our Anaheim area.

Summary: Three stars because of the ruckus we could hear through the ceiling. I normally don't write reviews but thought this is something that should be taken into consideration if you choose this hotel. Don't get me wrong, this is a very nice hotel, friendly staff (accommodated my request for a room that faces Disney to best see the fireworks) convenient to restaurants and stores (coffee bean & CVS in the same bldg), big spacious rooms with a pull out sofa, armoire, desk, mini refrigerator & nice parking lot with elevator straight to your room floor (not many spaces). 3 washers & 3 dryers on the top floor (5th). Small pool (20 people max) with a sitting area to watch the fireworks at Disneyland. Very good assortment at the breakfast buffet. Only downfall was the noise from the room
Manager Response: Dear M H,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are disappointed to hear that we were not able to deliver a more pleasant stay for you and your family. I would like to follow up with you to further discuss some of the details and invite you to contact me at time that is convenient for you. I would like to see if there is something that we can do to remedy part of your experience. Thank you again for the feedback and the opportunity to make things right.

Summary: We had the family suite with two Queens and bunk beds. Room large and immaculate. Free breakfast included fresh fruit, eggs, breakfast meat,cereals-hot and cold, yogurts, breads, waffles with all sorts of toppings.  They had sliding windows behind the hot breakfast  items that allowed staff to check and replenish timely.  We were able to watch Disney fireworks from room. Lobby is scented with vanilla.   One day our towels were folded into the shape of swans. It was a,caring and wonderful hotel choice for our family.
Manager Response: Dear Donna,  Thank you for all of your positive feedback, we are thrilled to hear that you had a great experience during your most recent trip. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you and your family in the near future.

Summary: We stayed here on our last trip to Disneyland in January. We loved the location of the hotel, you can see the back of California Adventure from the hotel. It is a bit further away than some other hotels but it's still only about a 10 min walk (15 for slower walkers) to the gates. There is a CVS attached to the hotel which was very convenient for us because you just never know what you may forget or need last minute. Breakfast was similar to other Marriot included breakfasts, good for the morning. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. We did not utilize the pool because it was cooler and VERY rainy when we went.   On a Disney side note, it rained really bad one of our days at Disney. We prepared for the rain and were still able to enjoy a half day at Disney. We were able to
Manager Response: Dear amuslman,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. I am sorry to hear that you joined us during our very unusual rainy period in January. This is not very typical for our area and hope to have you back soon to enjoy our warm weather and constant sunshine. Looking forward to your return.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for Disneyland Park
Summary: We stayed 3 nights in a Kids (Bunk Beds) suite which also had two queen beds. The staff were friendly and helpful front desk service and housekeeping was great. The room is reasonably spacious for a one room suite with the bathroom in the middle to break-up the space. Easy walk to Disneyland and surrounding restaurants from here. Watching the Disneyland fireworks from the rooftop pool area is a bonus if you are like me, and not keen to go back to the park in the evening after a full day there. The  breakfast included in the rate was handy, although American breakfasts take a bit of getting used to, the plastic cutlery from a dispenser and the paper plates were unusual, although we came across this in some New York cafes as well, not sure why these would be necessary, esp in a
Manager Response: Dear JamisonViews,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you were able to fully enjoy our hotel's amenities. The pool deck is definitely one of the most popular areas for the fireworks and happy to hear that you were able enjoy the experience. Thank you for all of the positive comments, we look forward to serving you and your family during your next trip out to Disneyland.

Summary: This was my first stay at a SpringHill and I was spoiled. No other SH property has come close. Fantastic room with up to date arrangements. My room faced Disneyland which provided memorable views. While I was here for work I'd certainly return with my family.
Manager Response: Dear AmericanSisu,  Thank you for the posting such a great review. We are honored to be given such high remarks and hope to have the opportunity to serve you on you and your family during your next trip out to Anaheim.

Summary: This is a beautiful property that looks and feels new.  Friendly staff provide excellent customer service.  Room was spacious, clean and thoughtfully designed.  On-site gym is well-equipped and, again, spotless!  Lovely rooftop lounge and pool.  Reliable Wifi with easy connection.  Lobby business center came in handy when I needed to print some documents.  Had a bit of trouble initially with printing, but desk staff was eager to help and handled quickly.  Win!  Breakfasts are standard Marriott fare, bonus points for array of oatmeal toppings.  Overall, excellent and we will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Dear SJRWC,  Thank you for the great review. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and hope to have to opportunity to serve you on your next trip.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Place to stay near Disney
Summary: This place was exactly what we needed and wanted. The word 'resort' in the title might be a bit misleading for some people because if you are looking for a huge pool with food service and cocktails, valet parking, and other typical resort amenities, you will likely be a little disappointed. If you want a new, clean, modern, and reasonably priced (by Anaheim standards) hotel, this place should do just fine. The $20 parking fee is less than many other hotels in the area. The free breakfast is an added perk. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable and the hotel is an easy walk to the Disney parks. We will certainly stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear ScottsW378UV,  I would like to thank you for the posting such a positive review. It was an absolute pleasure to host you and your family during your most recent trip to Disneyland. We can't wait see you back with us on your next trip.

Summary: We were looking for a close and convenient hotel to rest our heads after a long day at Disneyland.  I'm not sure there are any better options.  It is in short walking distance and the rooms are clean new and nice.  Although it is not a Disney property it is themed with colorful art and paintings to make it seem overall cheery and fun.  I don't know that is is a destination or resort hotel, but it is a convenient choice for a day at Disney.
Manager Response: Dear TuckerBrodyYork,  Thank you for taking the time to post such a wonderful review of our property. I hope that your Disney vacation was nothing short of magical and hope to have the opportunity to host you and your family during your next trip.

Summary: Just spent a week at SpringHill Suites, loved it.  The beds are soooo comfortable.  Large room, plenty of room to get comfortable.  Loved the pool on the roof.  Second time we stayed there, won't be the last.  Thank you Cheryl from Sacramento
Manager Response: Dear pollscw,  Thank you for the kind review. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our beds and and pool area. We thank you for your loyalty to our hotel and look forward to seeing you and your family back with us soon.

Summary: This was a great location to Disney, took about 10 minutes to walk. It was very clean and well maintained. The pool on the roof provided some good sun and relaxation - everybody else must have been at Disney. We had it all to ourselves. The breakfast was also fantastic! Lots of choice, even for our gluten-free eater!  It was also nice having a drug store right on location! It had convenience foods, water, and anything you may have forgot at home! Would stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Kristin,  Thank you for taking the time to post such a wonderful review. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us and were able to take full advantage of our rooftop pool. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you and your family on your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Highly Recommended: Clean, Friendly and Spacious
Summary: We chose Spring Hill Suites for our last visit to Disney land, spending there 4 nights, and we chose it for two reasons: positive reviews and short distance to Disney Land.  The hotel is clean and modern.  The staff are welcomig, friendly, helpful and professional.  The suites are clean, comfortable and spacious with a sitting area and a microwave.  The breakfast was plentiful and delicious, and the food was  very good quality.  The hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland (10 minutes) , and CVS (24/ 7 drug store) is just next door.  Many restaurants and cafes are nearby.  I highly recommend this hotel to families visiting Disney Land.
Manager Response: Dear Koko_waki,  Thank you for the wonderful review. I am thrilled to hear that you had such a positive experience during your stay with us and hope that the visit to Disneyland was nothing less than magical. We hope to have the opportunity to host you and your family on your next Disney adventure.

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights when we came for a quick trip to Disneyland.  There isn't a thing about this place we didn't like.  The staff was polite and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable, the wifi was free, the breakfast was nice and plentiful, we could buy our tickets at the front desk, and it was a very short walk to the parks.  Loved it.  Would definitely recommend.
Manager Response: Dear Piper,  Thank you for taking the time to post such a positive review of our property. I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your Disneyland trip and your hotel stay. We are looking forward to hosting you and your family on your next Disneyland visit.

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly staff, good breakfast
Summary: I definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying here again in the future. The staff was wonderful, the rooms were clean and adequately sized, and the free breakfast was good. Having CVS right below was also a wonderful perk.  The only negative is the bathroom door in the rooms. The bathroom is situated between the bedroom area and the kids area/living room area. To save space, the hotel uses a large sliding door for the bathroom rather than a traditional one that would open in or out. The sliding door can seem very loud when you are trying not to wake the other people in the room as you get ready.
Manager Response: Dear Brooke,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. Your feedback is very important to the success of our hotel and appreciate the positive comments. I will have the maintenance team look into the bathroom doors to ensure that they are working correctly. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you and your family during your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great place within walking distance to Disneyland!
Summary: We spent 5 nights here this past week. The hotel is very nice, had very comfortable beds (we splurged on the bunk bed option for kids), and a very nice selection of hot and cold foods for breakfast. Staff was all very friendly!   One note: You do pay to park and the entrance and exit are steep enough it was a small challenge to exit uphill while also swiping card and waiting for gate to rise. The vehicle would roll backwards if you weren't braking (finally figured out the proper balance of gas petal to keep it from moving forward long enough to swipe card to exit, ha!).
Manager Response: Dear Travis,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience during your most recent stay at our hotel. We are happy to hear that the extra room in the kids suites added to the overall positive experience. We will make sure to take a look a the parking gate to see if there is something that can be done to minimize the hassle of going out of the garage. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: We really appreciated this hotel as it was dog-friendly and very close to Disneyland. It's walkable, but we decided to grab a local bus pass and it really made a difference after a long day of walking 10 miles around the parks. It is conveniently located above a CVS store, so if you've forgotten to pack something, you can easily just run downstairs to get it. The entrance to the hotel is located on the backside of the building in an alley. The parking is minimal, so we had to circle a few times before finding a spot so that we could go inside to check-in. As the entrance is on the backside, you can cut through the CSV to get to the crosswalk to head to Disneyland, but be aware that the CSV locks that back door around 10pm, so if you are later than that coming back, you need to
Manager Response: Dear Carlene,  Thank you for posting such a great review review of our property. The feedback that we receive from our guests is crucial to our success and can't thank you enough for sharing the details of your stay. Although we are a family friendly hotel, we want to make sure that all of our guests have restful night and always ask that you contact our front desk if there are kids running around past bedtime. We hope to have the opportunity to host you and your family on your next Disneyland trip.

Summary: Nice hotel with excellent service. I would definitely stay there again and recommend to others. Breakfast was excellent and staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and clean, although it didn't have a bathtub (which other rooms may have). Our little boy is 5 and we made the shower work, but it might not be ideal for families with littler ones. The pool on the roof was really fun and they have a awesome gym if you're into that sort of thing. I assumed that there would be a hot tub/spa, but there wasn't. Not a huge deal breaker for us, but just something to be aware of. Overall we had a really great stay and experience!!!
Manager Response: Dear lyndsknight,  Thank you for sharing your experience with our hotel and TripAdvisor Community. We are thankful for the many positive comments and hope to see you back with us very soon. Our hotel does have a few rooms with tubs and recommend that you contact us prior to your arrival to get you blocked into one of those rooms. Please let us know if there is anything that we can assist with in the meantime.

Summary: All went very well over expectations. Very nice Gym, pool, breakfast area was always filled up as needed. Clean rooms, when we needed anything we received it with a smile.  Location, close to the Convention Center with walking distance, the recommendations for the restaurants was outstanding. Bravo!!
Manager Response: Dear shlomik,  Thank you for posting such a kind review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your most recent stay with us and hope to see you back during your next convention in our Anaheim area.

Summary: We just stayed here and loved it. The rooms were big enough for our family of 7. The bunk beds were fun for the kids and everyone was comfortable. My wife, who usually complains about hotel beds, said she slept better here than anywhere else. It was a short enough walk down to Disneyland. The breakfast in the morning was great for our kids (maybe add one more kid cereal choice though) and adults as well. The roof top was a fun place to hang out at and swim. CVS bailed us out a few times as well so that was convenient (and instead of buying a $4.50 ice cream treat at Disneyland, buy a $1.50 one at CVS to enjoy as you walk down to Disneyland).
Manager Response: Dear Ryan,  Thank you for posting this great review of our property. I am thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and specially happy that your wife was able to get some quality sleep on our beds. We hope to see you and your family back with us very soon.

Summary: We stayed here in early May for three nights with the sole purpose of going to Disneyland.  The proximity to the entrance of Disneyland/California Adventure Park is excellent.  We walked to and from the park every day. Not once did our five-year-old boy complain about the walk being too long.   There are a lot of very good food choices nearby for dinner.  You won't need to go out for breakfast because the hotel has an ample breakfast served daily in the lobby.  I would recommend you go downstairs about 7 AM or before to get breakfast because seating can get a little hard to find if you go later... all the families wanting to grab breakfast before heading over to Disney.  People complain about the $20 parking fee for using the garage, but if you stay further away and drive to
Manager Response: Dear Ripcordzz,  Thank you for posting this amazing review. We are thrilled to hear that you and your family enjoyed your Disneyland vacation and hope to have the opportunity to serve you in the near future. Please feel free to reach out to us if you need help booking your next reservation.

Summary: Springhill Suites offered everything we needed for a wonderful three days at Disneyland with two young children.  The location is great within a 15 minute walk to the parks; the covered parking is wonderful; the breakfast included with the room price is excellent. The staff was so friendly and accommodating.  We would surely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Froggy,  Thank you for taking time out of your day to post such a great review of our property. I hope that your two little ones enjoyed themselves at the park and that a return trip is in the near future for you. We would love to host you during the next trip and ask that you contact us with anything that we can help with in the meanwhile.

Summary: I was thinking for what they cost it would be a better experience than it was. Your paying for the 10 minute walk to Disneyland not for the hotel. I booked not knowing that a convention of high school kids were amassed at this hotel. Due to them they closed the bar during my 3 night stay. I was told I could go next door to residence inn but they closed the bar after 2 days. The parking fee is 18.00 per day. The breakfast was awful. I had to go across the street to I hop. When I hop is the better option you know how bad it is. This hotel is 2 years old  and is no better than a Hampton inn.
Manager Response: Dear istanbulrocks,  Thank you for sharing your experience with our hotel and TripAdvisor Community. I apologize that we failed to deliver a less than perfect stay for you and your family on this most recent trip. The convention that you mentioned was the biggest of its kind and only comes around every 4 years. This is definitely not typical at our hotel and hope to have the opportunity to serve you once again.

Summary: First of all, hands down one of the best Marriott Hotels that I have stayed at. My family and I were there for disneyland for five nights and we have received the most welcoming service.   Check-in and check out process was the easiest! If I can recall the front desk agent that helped us out went by the name of Nicole, sweetest young lady!! Not only did she give us a quick and easy check in she also went the extra step to recommend places/restaurants to go to. Would always greet us and have a beautiful smile on her face when she sees us passing by and always offers my kids the lollipops that they provide! Check-out Shan helped us out, very very friendly!  Overall, associates are lovely!  Breakfast was good it could be better. Options are simple, though the waffle machine would
Manager Response: Dear Ashley,  Thank you for posting such a wonderful review of our property. Nicole is one of our newer associates and she will be thrilled to know that she was mentioned on a TripAdvisor post. I will make sure that both Nicole and Shan are recognized for their outstanding service. I will also pass along your breakfast comments to our F&B manager to ensure the waffle irons get looked at.   Thank you!

Summary: I have never been disappointed in a Springhill until this one.  I hate to post a negative review of Springhills because I love them and they're always my first choice.  However after a long, loud, sleepless 3 night stay, I wouldn't stay there again.  Before I get to why, I will say the breakfast was great.  Typical Springhill breakfast.  The room was clean and nicely decorated and we chose it because it was one of the family suites with bunk beds and a couch. Enough for our group of 6.  it also had seperation between the bunks/living area and queen beds, so we could put our 10 month old next to the queen bed and turn the lights out and still be up talking by the living area/tv/couch.  Beautifully styled and modern eating area downstairs with lots of tables and seating for the
Manager Response: Dear Archergirl,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience on our TripAdvisor page. Thank you for the positive comments about our decor and breakfast. I will make sure that the teams are recognized for the great work. I also want to apologize for the noise levels during your stay. As you noted, we had a large group of students with us. This is an event that only happens every 4 years and can assure you that the experience is completely different during all other times of the year. We hope to have the opportunity to host you and your family in the future.

Summary Heading: We Were Discriminated Against and Provided with Poor Customer Service
Summary: This is the second time my fiancé and I stayed at this hotel and I am a marriott elite member in the year of 2015 fall time my fiancé and I spent over $20,000 dollars alone staying at Marriott hotel properties and actually redeemed our points staying at a Springhill Suite and enjoyed it. The irony in this situation is that I am now forced to write a bad review about a Springhill Suite. For starters the first time we stayed at here our bill was paid in full. This time we check in and my fiancé and I decided to extend our stay for two consecutive nights in a row and my fiancé took care of our extended stay the evening that we extended and was told by the employee that it was not an issue and that we could pay at the time that my fiancé paid which was the evening time. My fiancé
Manager Response: Dear Ms. Kezia I want to clarify that unfortunately you were asked to vacate your suite after several failed requests  to come down and provide a valid method of payment for the night. Our front desk made several time extensions as a courtesy since you were staying under a friends and family discount. After all of the time extensions were exhausted, we were forced to ask you to vacate your suite.   I apologize that we are unable to make any further time extensions.   We wish you safe travels on your future trips and thank for reaching out to us with you concerns.

Summary: This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in and I would have given it an excellent rating if not for one thing.  Towards the end of our 9 night stay, the hotel was filled up with high school band groups.  Now the kids themselves were not really an issue, they behaved themselves for the most part, (little rowdy in the hallways at night) the problem was since there was so many of them you could no longer get breakfast in the morning or catch an elevator.  Even walking in and out the front door to the hotel became a task.  See the problem with having a hotel filled with large groups they all are doing the same thing at the same time so its nearly impossible to move around in the hotel or enjoy its amenities.  When a hotel is filled to capacity with families, singles and couples
Manager Response: Dear Wonderfullywarm,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with our hotel and our TripAdvisor Community. I want to apologize that we felt short on delivering a less than perfect stay for you and your family. It is definitely unusual for our hotel to take that many large groups at the same time. The Anaheim Market ended up hosting multiple events at the same time which caused an influx of teams to our general area. I hope that we have an opportunity to better your experience and ask that you give us call if there is anything that we can assist you with in the meantime.

Summary: This was my second time staying at this location, and I was badly discriminated against and told I had to leave my room at 8:00 pm and I had a paid in full balance was not noisy nor did I have any complaints. I extended my stay and was on my way to pay for another night as I did the previous night and was told I was getting evicted from my room for absolutely no reason. And I had no balance and took care of bill at the same time the previous night and there was not an issue. I had long day meeting with my agent and just got back to the hotel to pay for another night's stay  like I did the previous night and a man by the name of Moses told me I had twenty minutes to pack my belongings or he was calling the police after I had already previously paid and notorious for paying my
Manager Response: Dear guest We thank you for staying with us and apologize that we could not be of any more help. Unfortunately, after several failed attempts to contact you to get your bill settled, we were forced to ask you to vacate a room that was indeed not payed for.   We wish you safe travels on your future trips.

Summary: Close enough to Disneyland to walk daily, with a family suite well appointed for 2 adults and 2-3 kids. Layout of room is not perfect for evenings, but in reality not in there much. Friendly staff and clean rooms, the pool is a little small, no hot tub.  The convenience stores and pharmacy in immediate vacinity provide easy access to necessities.  Solid family alternative to the Grand Californian and comes with a decent morning breakfast included.
Manager Response: Dear J B,  Thank you for taking the time to publish your review. I am delighted to hear that you had a great experience during your stay. I hope that we have the opportunity to host you and your family on your next trip out to Disneyland.

Summary: Am currently at the hotel as I write this on my last night  What can I say other than a great place to stay Super fast easy check in Great breakfast you can make your own waffles have a hot cooked breakfast or have cereals yoghurt oatmeal the selection seems endless Great wifi The pool area is modern and clean with a fantastic pool There's also a seating area facing Disney which is large with sofas and chairs The rooms are well laid out with comfortable beds two TVs a fridge microwave and coffee making facilities  There are lots of plugs and USB sockets for all your devices We had no interruptions from noise or outside traffic and the staff are helpful and polite  In all this is a great hotel especially for families There are lots of shops and restaurants close by and the walk
Manager Response: Dear Godjark,  I cannot begin to explain how grateful I am for your amazing review. I am truly honored that our hotel and combination of amenities allowed you to have a great stay. We hope to see you and your family back with us during your next trip to Disneyland. Please give us a call if there is anything that we can help with in the meantime.

Summary: We stayed here as a family of 4, including two very young children. We had a great five night stay and enjoyed many aspects of this new and clean hotel -- spacious room, comfortable beds, friendly service, very good free breakfast, fast wifi, nice pool with fireworks view, SUPER convenient CVS downstairs (cannot emphasize enough how handy this was for a family), and a relatively close walk to Disney. It was a great choice, and we'll most likely stay here again for our next visit.
Manager Response: Dear nec80,  Thank you so much for posting such a wonderful review. I am humbled by your kind words about our facility and will work hard to provide you and your family with a similar stay during your next trip to Disneyland. Thank you again and hope to see you back soon.

Summary: The hotel did not have my room ready evening after checking in online 1 day earlier via my Marriott App-it is unclear what that app really can do.   The ally side was noises and disturbing during the day from vehicles unloading and from people talking outside.   The room had some hardware issues in the bathroom.   The separated room for the bed and couch was very helpful. I am sitting in another room in another town wishing We had a separate room to put down a 1 year old.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. M,  Thank you for taking the time to review our property. Our app allows our staff to handle the majority of check-in items before your arrival so that the time spent checking in is minimized. The app will also send you a notification once your room is available to check in. I apologize that you found your room to be a little noisier than normal. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the room layout and our fold out sofa. We know that the extra space comes in handy when traveling with little ones. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you in the future.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel as a family of four with our young kids with the primary purpose to visit Disneyland. For this reason, this hotel's location being within 10-15 minute walking distance to Disneyland (and restaurants and shops) and value for money were the greatest positive aspect.  There were other hotels that fall in a similar  category but our preference was to stay at a Marriott brand hotel.  CHECK-IN & CHECK-OUT: The check-in process was surprisingly fast and our room was already ready before the official check-in time which was good after a 10-hour flight from Asia.  The check-out process was even faster with the bill being pre-prepared for me to review before checking out.  ROOM: Thanks to my Gold Elite membership, our room was upgraded to a kids suite with bunk
Manager Response: Dear Hippodiver,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with our hotel and our TripAdvisor Community. I apologize that you had to ask for extra amenities during your time here. Our staff should have definitely added notes to your account so that housekeeping automatically left those extras behind during your normal service. I am glad that we were able to get you an upgrade and thank you for your loyalty to our Marriott brands. We hope to have the opportunity to see you on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: I was really impressed with the cleanliness and overall comfort of the hotel, except for the bed, which was hard and lumpy. But I'm also a bed snob, so it wouldn't stop me from recommending the hotel. It is in a great location for Disneyland, the convention center, and area restaurants. You can see the resort fireworks from the rooftop poop area- a bonus!  They also have a lobby bar which is nice, but it closes quite early. There is a CVS attached to the hotel that sells about anything you need. I have stayed in many of the area hotels and this is one of my favorites. Much better value, convenience, and service than some of the other big name hotels close by.
Manager Response: Dear Anteneen,  Thank you for posting such a kind review. It is an honor to hear that we have taken over one of your top spots for hotels in Anaheim. We hope to see you and your family back with us soon!

Summary Heading: Stay at Hyatt House across the street
Summary: The good stuff: - Great location, walking distance to Disneyland / California Adventure - Convenient Walgreens drugstore located in the building so you can pick up any essentials - Rooms are spacious  The bad stuff: - Parking situation is awful. There are limited spaces available under the building. If you can't grab one of those, you'll be directed to park in the Residence Inn parking structure across the way. Even here you will probably have to lurk for a spot. On checkout day you will be expected to move your car by 3pm -- a problem if you are planning to spend the entire day in Disneyland. - Noisy. Expect to hear your neighbors above, below, and on either side. - Beds were VERY uncomfortable. - Breakfast lines were very long, and the food (other than pre-packaged stuff like
Manager Response: Dear TurkeyPotPie,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you and your family during your most recent trip to Disneyland. I apologize that we could not meet your expectations and thank you for your feedback. It sounds like you may have arrived during one of the busiest weeks of the year with several sporting events and conventions in town during the same time. Typically, our parking structure is large enough to accommodate the supply of guests vehicles. Again, we thank you for the opportunity to serve you.

Summary: Stayed here for a cheer competition with my daughters cheer team and was impressed with everything including the spacious rooms, the comfortable beds, and the impressive breakfast.  Would love to return one day with my family.
Manager Response: Dear swithygirl,  We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay. I hope that the cheer competition went well and hope to have the opportunity to serve you and your family in the near future.   Thank you

Summary: This hotel is very nuch like any other Springhill Marriott that we have been to. The treat you well, it's clean, it's hassle free. Location might be a problem if you don't like walking because it takes aprox. 15 minutes to get to the main entrance of Disneyland.  For us, it was perfect as we love to walk; plus, weather was just perfect (beginning of March).  However, the feature of this hotel was breakfast, which comes included with your stay. It's a buffet style breakfast and you can eat and eat and eat! There are many options: croissant, bagels, loaf, waffles, eggs, potatoes, sausage, tea, coffee, milk, yogurt, many types of fruits. Yes, it might sound like it is very much like the other hotels, but it was never "too" crowded, there were never empty trays, never people telling
Manager Response: Dear Rodrigo,  Thank you for posting such a great review of our property. It is always refreshing to read reviews like yours and know that we are making a positive impact on our guests. We know that vacations can be stressful and always try to go above and beyond to make things a little bit easier. We hope to see you back with us soon.

Summary: Awesome Marriott property. Parking is a bit of an issue. We had to park next door at the residence inn. They know who their clients are for this property and then rooms are family friendly. Drug store downstairs was a nice convenience
Manager Response: Dear Centre51,  Thank you for the kind review. It was a pleasure serving you and your family and look forward to your return.

Summary: If you're in Anaheim for Disneyland, the location is fantastic.  I've stayed at this location twice now... once for a RunDisney Half Marathon event, and once just a park vacation.  Both experiences were fantastic.  Their standard suites only have showers (no tub) so may not be a great option for families with little children.  My only gripe was this lack of tub and the low water pressure made showers take a while.    The included breakfast is fantastic.  It was actually the breakfast that made me want to stay here a second time.  The waffle bar is delicious.  Staff is polite and attentive.  When I go to my room this most recent time, the cable wasn't working.  I contact the front desk via chat on my app, and we had someone at the door to fix the issue in less than 15 minutes.
Manager Response: Dear Lisa,  I want to thank you for your repeat business. We appreciate the opportunity to host you during these very special events and hope to have the opportunity to host you in the future. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast and our amazing beds, these are just a few of the many amenities that set us apart from our competitors. We look forward to serving you and your family in the near future.

Summary: Our family of three stayed here for three nights of our Disneyland trip and absolutely loved it. Our room was bright and well furnished. Our adult son slept on the hide a bed and proclaimed it comfy. Most notable is the fantastic soundproofing of the bathroom. The breakfast was well done and the staff kept the large eating area clean. The front desk staff was always friendly and we appreciated the lollipops they provided us. It is only a pleasant ten minute walk from Disney's front gate. This is along a well lighted street and many other park goers are present. We felt very safe even after a midnight park closing. Can't say enough good things about this hotel and will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Zinnia6,  Thank you for posting such a wonderful review of our property. I hope that your visit to Disneyland was nothing short of spectacular. I will make sure to share your review with our front desk staff and our breakfast team. They will be happy to hear the positive feedback. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: We absolutely loved our stay here!  We stayed in a kids suite with the bunk beds.  It was spacious, clean, and very nice!  This was probably our favorite hotel that we have stayed at.  The hotel was extremely clean, the breakfast was fabulous, the staff was very helpful and friendly, overall it was a great experience staying here!
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words. Our team members work really hard to provide a great experience for all of our guests. We understand the importance of family vacations and always strive for perfection. We hope to see you back with us in the near future.

Summary: Nice hotel. Room was clean and the location is very convenient for Disneyland and CA adventure park.  Check in went smoothly and the front desk staff was very nice.  The breakfast was decent and just with standard stuff. Waffles, scrambled eggs, cereals, juices, breads and all the regular breakfast things.  I would stay here again.  Kids had fun swimming in the rooftop pool. It was very cold that night and we only lasted about 10 minutes. But being only 5 and 7 years old they found the fun in it! Hotel has a work out room. Didn't use it, but it looked ample and not too crowded with just 2 people using it when I looked in.  I'd stay here again for sure.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting such a positive review of our hotel. I am delighted to to hear about your experience and hope to have you back with us soon (when its a little warmer out).

Summary: I stayed here for a weekend in February while attending a conference. The room was very nice, and it had an excellent breakfast setup. The bartenders were very nice. My room faced a main street and rooms on either side were full of teens.  I was not disturbed by any noise. A nice thing is that a bottom floor corner of the building is a CVS Pharmacy and I was able to pick up some items I needed. It was a 10 minute walk to the Convention Center.
Manager Response: Dear Cindy,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us and our TripAdvisor Community. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and will make sure to recognize our bar associates for the job well done. We hope to see you back us soon.

Summary: Clean rooms, comfortable bed and walking distance to Disneyland.  Staff was very friendly.  The free breakfast was okay - lower-end buffet style but we left full and ready for the parks.  Stayed at the Courtyard Maingate w/waterpark last visit, but this property definitely provides more value for your money.  Rooms were comparable.  The biggest difference for us was the waterpark, but if you're just spending your days at Disney, there's no sense in paying double for the Courtyard.  Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Bccam123,  Thank you for taking the time to post the great review. I want to make sure that your next visit to our hotel is a great one and wanted to share that the Springhill brand is just about to update our breakfast offerings to be more in line with what our guests are asking for. This is a change that will improve our selection and quality. We hope that you can try it out during your next stay and look forward to serving you in the near future.

Summary: We stayed here in Dec 2016...enjoyed every minute of it. The location is convenient - it's only a 10 min walk to the Disney Parks. Breakfast was delicious although a bit crowded because of the holiday period. The staff members were helpful and courteous. Jacqui at the front desk assisted us with our check out and was able to resolve our billing questions. Thank you!
Manager Response: Dear yes2luvtravel,  Thank you very much for posting such a great review of our property. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and will make sure that we recognize Jacqui for her outstanding service. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Wonderful hotel!   We were in Anaheim on business and added a family trip as well.  Alex, Joanna and all the staff were very friendly and helpful!  If you are attending a convention and want to add some Disney time, you couldn't ask for a better location.   Hotel was always clean.  Beds were very comfortable.  CVS and Walgreens are right there. Several restaurants are nearby.  Everything we wanted to do was easily within walking distance.  Breakfast offered many choices.  We had a great experience and would definitely stay there again
Manager Response: Dear Penny,  Thank you so much for posting such a wonderful review of our property. We are grateful to have great guests like yourself and hope to have you back with us very soon. I will make sure that I communicate your kind words to Alex, Joanna and the rest of the staff. Thank you again for your support!

Summary: We stayed 1 night at this hotel before moving next door to the sister-hotel: Residence Inn by Marriott.  We are a family of 4 which includes 2 kids (aged 12 and 10)  We booked a studio suite with 2 queen beds, that also has a sofa pull-out.  The rooms are spacious and feature the new design/look.  On the street level, on the corner, is a 24 CVS.  If they don't have what you're looking for, maybe the 24-hour Walgreens across the street does?!  Unfortunately, the pool was closed during our stay - so that's unfortunate.  The breakfast in the morning was very good with lots of choices.  The lolly-pops at the Front Desk were a huge hit with the kids ;)  Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Victoria,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review of our property. I offer my sincere apologies for closure of the pool deck. We doing some renovations that will ultimately make the experience even better for all of our guests. I invite you and your family back to our hotel to experience the amazing fireworks view that our pool deck offers. Please feel free to contact me directly to make your future reservations.

Summary: Stayed here with family for 4 nights for Disneyland trip. 15 min walk to Disneyland with restaurants and stores very close by (Pizza Hut express adjacent to parking lot, CVS Pharmacy connected to hotel, Walgreens across the street and Gardenwalk close by). Loved that the rooms are suites so you have a little extra room and having the 24 hour store under the hotel was super handy in order to pick up water and snacks to save $$$ in park. The complimentary breakfast was decent with enough variety we were satisfied during the 4 mornings (kids loved being able to make waffles!). Staff are super friendly and accommodating. Would stay here again. Tip: booked online at Marriott website using AAA for a very decent rate.
Manager Response: Dear Tracy,   Thank you for sharing your experience with us and our TripAdvisor Community. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your room, our complimentary breakfast and of course the convenience of having CVS just a few steps away. We hope to see you back with us soon.

Summary Heading: Visited for a conference at the convention center
Summary: Room was quite clean, good utilities, refrigerator. LOVED the breakfast each morning with plenty of eggs, bacon, yogurt and a waffle bar if you like that. Workout room was adequate with two elliptical and two treadmills and one bike. There were also free weight dumbbells with two benches. My favorite feature was it was above a 24 hour CVS so I could go load up and stock my fridge as I was there for the week.
Manager Response: Dear Rick,  Thank you for taking the time to post such a great review of our property. I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and hope to have the opportunity to serve you in the future.

Summary Heading: Great stay great hotel great location
Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights with the family. Never stayed here before but we are looking forward to staying here again. First thing you noticed when you walk in is the great smell in the lobby.Makes you feel very relaxed. The front desk people were very helpful and friendly. We downloaded the Marriott app before we left for our trip. So we checked in via the app which was super easy and convenient. The room was great bigger than expected plenty of room for up to 6 people. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean.The room had 2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper.  The breakfast offered was just fine it included the following: Scrambled eggs,sausage,potatoes,white bread,wheat bread, bagels, croissant,muffin,dry cereal,fruit loops,frosted flakes,granola,and Kaishi,4 different
Manager Response: Dear fresnonittanylion,  Thank you so much for posting such an amazing review of our property. The staff will be thrilled to read your review and understand what a positive impact they made on  you and your family. I will make sure to personally recognize the security guard that you mentioned and thank him for going above and beyond. Thank you again for taking time out of your day to share your experience with us and our TripAdvisor community.

Summary: I love this hotel. My boyfriend and I always stay here the night before we go to Disneyland. I have been here 2 times in the past year and we'll be here next weekend again! Clean and comfortable beds. I like that they have a mini fridge to bring snacks. They have a great breakfast with essentials. Yogurt, fruit, cereals etc. Coffee bean is conveniently located downstairs as well as Walgreens. About a 10 minute walk to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Dear Michelle,  I want to thank you first for the loyalty to our hotel and second for the great review. Please let us know if there is anything that we can do to make your stay more enjoyable. Looking forward to hosting you again this weekend.

Summary Heading: Great compromise location between convention center and Disney
Summary: I stayed for a conference at the convention center.  Walking distance from both places.  The staff was very helpful. The rooms are clean, nice and well maintained.  As expected the hotel is overrun by tour groups and families with small children which makes the condition of the rooms even more remarkable.  Pool and hot tub under construction which was not advertised before arrival and was a big disappointment.  They offered access to a neighboring pool but who wants to walk across the parking lot to another facility.
Manager Response: Dear Jeremy,  I apologize for the ongoing pool enhancements. We understand that it is an inconvenience and hope to have it completed as soon as possible. Your feedback is important to us and I thank you for taking the time to publish your review. I want to thank you for the positive comments about the staff and our guest rooms. It will be a pleasure to have you back for the conference in 2018.

Summary: This hotel is pretty awesome! Alex, Joanna, Aubrey, and Billy were great at the front desk. They really helped us out during check in and throughout the stay. We were here for a disney getaway and the location was amazing. We had a disney view room and it was nice and quiet! I'll definitely consider coming back in the future. Great job!
Manager Response: Dear Alexander,  Thank you for the amazing review. I will make sure that Alex, Joanna, Aubrey, and Billy are recognized for making such a positive impact during your stay. We hope to see you back soon and please don't hesitate to reach out to us if there is anything that we can help you with in the meantime.

Summary: We were attending 2017 NAMM Convention, less than a block away to the Anaheim convention center.. the area is covered with great restaurants, and activities such as Disneyland and Universal Studio.  Springhill suites offers reasonable prices, a decent buffet breakfast and friendly staff
Manager Response: Dear benmc11,  Thank you for the 5 star review. I hope that you had a great time during the convention, I got a lot of great feedback from our other attendees and sounds like they put on a great show for you. Please let us know if we can help you set up reservations for next year. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay with family or large groups
Summary: I thought this hotel was pretty good overall.  Rooms were spacious and had plenty of storage for clothing.  Buffet breakfast included was ok.  Too much of the same everyday can get to you but honestly for free what do you want.  The kids didn't complain.  We were there with my daughters soccer team so large groups.  I like how they had bunk beds in rooms so you could sleep 7 to a room to save on costs.  This was a big thumbs up for the team.  Maid service was good.  Pool was down getting refurbished but the hotel has a sister hotel right next to it called the Renaissance where we were allowed to use their pool.  Might consider staying there next time as this hotel was newer and the pool area was fantastic!  Coffee shop connected right on the corner , very convenient.  Pharmacy
Manager Response: Dear 1cathym,  Thank you for the wonderful review. I am glad to hear that you had a great stay with us and hope that you team did well during the tournament. I apologize about the pool being closed, we are doing some enhancements and expect it to be open in the next two weeks or so. We hope to see you and your team back with us soon.

Summary: The rooms are a good size for families and one of very options for families who have more than 2 children. I travelled with a large group of 92 people and everyone was pleased with the location, the size of the rooms and the front desk staff. It is also very handy having the CVS store right on the doorstep as well as a coffee shop. The breakfast is very minimal and unfortunately did not cater to the dairy and gluten free guests that we had in the group. The one really big letdown is the housekeeping which was terrible. The rooms were never cleaned properly and we all had issues with getting the correct number of towels, toilet paper ran out and not replaced for 2 days until we had to go and collect it ourselves. The bathroom was barely touched at all and I doubt they ever
Manager Response: Dear KazNsw,  Thank you so much for the wonderful feedback. I remember speaking with someone in your group about the housekeeping issues experienced during your stay and thank you again for bringing it to my attention. Although this appeared to be an isolated incident, we did provide additional training to housekeeping staff to ensure that it does not happen again. I am however delighted to hear that you enjoyed the rest of your stay with us and that hope to have the opportunity to serve you in the future.

Summary: Lets first start off with the only complaint I really had with Spring Hills and that was it was extremely cold in the hallways and down in the lobby. That being said everything else about them I loved. From the moment you arrive they smile and are so ready to answer all of your needs. They had suckers that my kids loved and having them right next to the CVS was a major benefit. Ps the CVS was open 24 hours a day. T  That wasn't what got me it was how ready and helpful they were to take care of my disabled mom. On January 3rd my mom had two seizures in the dining area and every time they saw me or my husband they asked us how she was doing including the the front desk staff. Then on January 5th while my husband and 4 kids were in Disneyland my mom had a seizure at the hotel. They
Manager Response: Dear Emma,  Thank you for taking the time to post such a great review. I hope that your mom is recovering well from the seizures and wish her the best moving forward. I am glad that our staff was able to respond so well to the emergency. I will make sure that Jackie, Dulce, and Michael get the praise and recognition that they deserve for going above and beyond for you and your family. It was a pleasure serving you and hope to see you back with us soon.

Summary: We booked our room through getaway today! We had a suite, with 2 queen bed, sofa bed and bunk beds. We had plenty of space in our room, for a family of 5.  We had breakfast each morning, They had, eggs, bacon, sausage, bagels, muffins, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, waffle bar, juice, coffee, hot chocolate, tea and water. It was busy, but plenty of seats inside, and some out side.   We like the proximity to the parks, and the ART. It was nice having a CVS close by as well. Housekeeping was great, the only thing, we came back to our room around 3 and our room was not clean,this happened twice on our trip. We called and they came to clean our room right away. Also, the shower, water pressure was low. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and would defiantly consider staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear Carolyn,  Thank you for the positive review. I hope that your Christmas vacation was filled with great memories and lots of pictures. Please accept my apologies for the minor housekeeping miscommunication. We are always happy to customize our schedule to fit your needs. When you return, please inform our front desk what time you would like your room serviced and we will do everything in our power to make sure it gets done. We hope to see you back with us soon and wish you a happy new year.

Summary: We stayed here because of its proximity to Disneyland.  Just blocks away for an easy walk to the parks and Downtown Disney.  Hotel was clean and we made great use of the full breakfast included with the stay.  Room was a very good size for a family with couch and sitting area.  Price was okay, but not great.  Overall a great stay.
Manager Response: Dear Nate,  Thank you for the great review. I am glad that you enjoyed your time with us and hope to see you and your family back soon.

Summary Heading: Great option and close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here the week before Thanksgiving.  We had the kids suite with bunk beds.  Very spacious rooms and the layout allowed for space with six people in the room.  Didn't feel crowded at all.  Two TV's and plenty of space for luggage.  Just a few things that were a little bit of a let down...the pool is tiny!  It is rooftop and allows a good view of DCA but the pool is really only big enough for a few kids.  No jacuzzi.  Nice gym!  Have laundry room near the pool...so if you wanted to do some laundry of vacay (not) while the kids are playing in the pool this is a good option.  They do also offer a complimentary breakfast that is decent.  It has a lot of choices...yogurt, hot food, cereal (hot/cold), fresh fruit, bagels/muffins, etc.  Enough choices to fill your tummy until
Manager Response: Dear Mariard,  Thank you for posting such a wonderful review of our property. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your time at our hotel and that you were able to take advantage of many of our amenities. We are always looking for ways to improve our guest experience and your feedback is invaluable to us. We hope to have to opportunity so serve you on your next trip out to Disneyland.

Summary: We stayed here during Christmas break for our 3 day visit to Disneyland.  The location couldn’t be better for a non Disney owned hotel.  It’s a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland gate.  The rooms are 25% larger than normal Springhill rooms which are already larger than normal hotel rooms.  Each room has two TVs, the bath room is also quite large.  We had a two queen room and it was nicely divided into a living quarter and a sleeping quarter.  Our room was clean and well maintained.  The WIFI signal was strong and the network speed was very good.  The hotel was at full capacity while we stayed there.  The breakfast staff did a good job handling the crowd in the morning.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Huskies,  Thank you for choosing our hotel as your home away from home during your Disneyland trip. I am happy to hear that we were able to make such a positive impression and hope that we have the opportunity to serve you on your next trip out to Anaheim. Wishing you safe travels from all of us here at the Springhill Suites.

Summary: Lucked into this place really as I had Marriott points to use - didn't expect too much but was very impressed. Lets face it, you're not in Anaheim for a cultural experience (we were there for Disneyland.....!!) & so this place really fits the bill.   No frills but the room was more than adequate - the kids loved the bunkbeds & we appreciated the size of the room.  Breakfast was a buffet using cardboard plates & plastic knives and forks but was absolutely fine with a nice choice - again the kids loved the waffle maker so all good.  Great location for Disneyland - literally an easy 10 minute walk.  Staff were also very friendly & helpful. Check in and Check out was done with a smile & efficiency. Couldnt ask for more really.  All in all, very pleased.
Manager Response: Dear Paul,  Thank you for posting such a great review of our property. We are honored that you chose our hotel to redeem your Marriott Rewards points. We know that it takes many nights away from home to build up the balance and we are thankful that we had the opportunity to host you and your family. We hope to see you back with us during your next Disneyland trip.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for six nights while visiting Disneyland. This hotel was amazingly very quiet! I have trouble sleeping in hotels in general, but our room in the SpringHill Suites was so so quiet and peaceful. I loved the large size of the room. We had the room with 2 queen beds, a sofa bed and bunk beds. The kids enjoyed having their own tv and desk area. The walk to the park was only about 10-12 minutes. I have six kids, ages 3-13 and they all did great walking to and from the resort. The breakfast was great. My whole family was able to find foods they enjoyed from biscuits and gravy to cereal, bacon, yogurts, waffles, oatmeal and fresh fruit. The breakfast attendants were also very friendly and helpful! We also loved the rooftop pool and view of the fireworks. The
Manager Response: Dear Amy,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with our hotel and our TripAdvisor community. We are thankful for the many kind comments and hope to see you and your family back at our hotel on your next Disneyland vacation.

Summary: We stayed here for our most recent trip to Disneyland.  We really liked it.  The room had a very nice amount of space.  The amenities were nice.  The complementary breakfast was really good, especially the waffle station!  It is very close to the park making walking very easy.  The roof top pool was nice.  We understand that it provides a great view of the fireworks at Disneyland, but unfortunately, the weather prevented the fireworks during our entire stay.  Having a CVS on the ground floor was also very convenient!  We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Lancec984,  Thank you for posting such a wonderful review. Our waffle station has been a big hit since we implemented it a few weeks ago and we are glad to hear that you enjoyed it. It is unfortunate that you were not able to catch the fireworks this time around. As you probably already know, our weather has been less than perfect over the last two weeks. Wishing you and your family a Happy New Year.

Summary: I had a few qualms about staying here after reading some of the negative reviews. In general, I thought the reviews on here were very accurate. In my opinion, this was not the usual standard Marriott hotel, and there were some housekeeping issues, but it earned 4 stars purely on the location, which was wonderfully accessible to Disneyland (10 minutes walk to the gate), and the price, which was almost half of other comparable hotels in the same location.  We stayed 5 nights in a 2-queen suite (all rooms in the hotel are classified as suites). The layout is as follows: enter into the "living room", with sofa bed to the left and desk to the right. Ahead of the living room is the bathroom at left and a snack/meal area at right with microwave, refrigerator, and countertop. At the
Manager Response: Dear Libie2,  Thank you for the very detailed review of our property. I am sure that our TripAdvisor community will find your review very helpful when considering their trip out to Anaheim. We are always working on improving our operation and invite you to reach out to me to discuss some of the housekeeping issues that arose during your visit. We love getting feedback from our guests as it helps us better the experience for our future guests. Thank you again for the review and we hope that you have a happy New Year.

Summary: Spacious, clean room with breakfast included! Breakfast includes eggs, waffles, and oatmeal. Coffee and juices, milk and cereal. Lots of seating and even a deck on top floor to enjoy breakfast outside! Just a short walk to Disney and Downtown Disney. Staff as extremely friendly and helpful. I would happily stay here again! Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Dear Catherine,  Thank you for the wonderful review, we are happy to hear that you had a great stay. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you and your family during your next trip out to Anaheim. Enjoy the rest of your holiday season!

Summary: This property is a gem among so many choices in the area.  The front desk staff is welcoming and friendly. A warm greeting, fast check in, and useful tips about busy times for breakfast.  The room was exceptionally clean and the breakfast buffet was impressive.
Manager Response: Dear Jim,  I can't thank you enough for posting such a wonderful review of our hotel. It is an honor for us to be called a "gem" amongst our competitors. We look forward to serving you in the future. Happy holidays from all of us here at the Springhill Suites.

Summary: I have stayed here  twice this month. Each time I found the staff to be especially helpful and friendly often offering to attend to details without being asked.  Although I was not there with my family, it is certainly ideally suited for families and vacation destinations. My room was extremely spacious with a fridge and microwave.  The roof patio deck location was perfect for watching evening fireworks at Disneyland. Parking was included in my stay and even when I returned to a full garage, I was directed to the parking area in the adjacent property which is affiliated.
Manager Response: Dear Tina,  We are delighted to hear that both of your recent stays were pleasant and can't thank you enough for your loyalty to our hotel. We hope to see you back soon whether it be for your next convention or for your next family vacation. Wishing you a happy New Year.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for the family
Summary: Stayed for 2 nights in the family suite. Was roomy enough for 2 adults and 4 kids (including 2 babies). Had a bath which was welcome for the babies after a big day at Disneyland. CVS downstairs very convenient for buying snacks, milk etc.  Rooms have a microwave!  Breakfast very poor. Some strange substance masquerading as bacon. But other guests seemed to like it.   Close enough to walk to Disneyland. And great rooftop area to watch the fireworks.
Manager Response: Dear Tracey,  Thank you for sharing your experience with our hotel and our TripAdvisor Community. With many choices in the area, we are thankful that we had the opportunity to host you and your family for your Disneyland vacation. We hope to see you back with us on your next trip.

Summary: traveled to So Cal for business.Nice, large rooms with views of the fireworks from the pool area.  Staff, Victoria in bar, Paul at front desk and Moses the manager were helpful which i especially note as a woman traveling alone.   Good mediteranian restaurant across the street.
Manager Response: Dear Janiemcauburn,  Thank you for the wonderful review. It was a pleasure hosting you during your last business trip and look forward to your return. Victoria and Paul will be delighted to hear that you mentioned them by name. Happy holidays from all of our team here in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Convenient location, Comfortable accommodations, Free full breakfast, Professional friendly staff. A++
Summary: A reasonably priced alternative to Disney hotels, that is a short 10-12 minutes walk from park entrances.  Excellent, kids friendly accommodations. Free American breakfast for the entire family. Exceptional staff, specifically SHAN / NAFTALI team & JACKIE / LAUREN team.  Highly recommend this establishment to all parents with young kids who are looking to visit Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Lovetotravel,  Thank you for the wonderful review. I will make sure that the named individuals get recognized for making such a positive impact during your stay. We love receiving feedback as it helps us better who we are as a team and as an establishment. We look forward to serving you in the future.

Summary: This property is located within walking distance if your whole party can walk about 3 blocks.  We had one elderly family member that this walk was a little hard to do.  We needed a wheelchair once in the park.  The children also needed to be in a stroller for the walk due to the walking you do once in the park.  Overall the walk was doable.  Great location to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear SMvolleyball,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We hope that your trip to Disneyland was enjoyable and hope to see you and your family back with us soon.

Summary: This hotel is perfect for families, especially those with young children. The rooms are clean, beds comfy and some rooms even have bunk beds. The furniture is nice and almost indestructible. The breakfast buffet is perfect for kids and included with the room. It is in walking distance to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Dear Francie W,  Thank you for sharing your positive experience with our hotel and the TripAdvisor Community. Your feedback is very important to our hotel and its success and we grateful that you took time out of your day to post it. We look forward to serving you and your family on your next trip out to Disneyland.

Summary: This is a great place to stay.  It is a short walking distance to Disneyland but if you don't want to hoof it get a transit pass for a nominal fee when checking in.  The rooms were comfortable, clean and modern.  The beds were soft and comfy.  There was room to have the kids and 4 adults if this is how you roll.  The parking was convenient and accessible.  There is a 24 hours CVS pharmacy so you can shop if you need too. Also a Walgreens and subway across the street as will as 7-eleven.   The hotel has several items for purchase at the main desk too. The breakfast was fantastic and the coffee was good.  There is a rooftop pool but no spa.  I will  stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Jean,  Thank  you for amazing review! We love to to hear our guest's feedback and are absolutely enthused by reading "This place rocks"!   We look forward to your next visit and will do everything in our power to ensure that you have a similar if not a better experience the second time around. Please give us a call directly if there is anything that we can assist you with in the meantime.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our stay in Anaheim to go to Disneyland. It is a new hotel and  it is above a store which is handy if you need snacks or what ever. We had a corner suite facing the road. We didn't really hear the noise from the road. We had a great view of the fireworks from Disneyland. The hotel has the pool on the roof and a nice sitting area which you can also sit up there to watch the fireworks. A complimentary breakfast buffet is included. Which has eggs ,bacon and various breads and yogurt. It was a great start to the day. In closing there is no shuttle to the airport we ordered a town car to take us to the John Wayne airport. It is about the same price as a taxi. We timed the walk from the hotel to the main gate of Disneyland and it is about 15 minutes at a
Manager Response: Dear Merrit girl,  Thank you so much for the wonderful review of our facility. We are happy to hear that you had such a positive experience and were able to fully enjoy our complimentary amenities. We look forward to hosting you and your family on your next trip back into our Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Jenn the Bartender is simply the BEST EVER!!!!!!!
Summary: I was here on business with Konami working their Yu-Gi-Oh! Tourament, I stayed from Friday 11/25 to Tuesday 11/29.  The front desk help was great, the breakfast was good and filling, and the rest of the staff was friendly. BUT, my favorite person in this entire hotel was the bartender Jenn she was absolutely amazing, amazing personality, drinks were delicious, she definitely took care of her customers better than all other bartenders I've met on my travels across the country, and even back at home.  I encourage every one that stays here to have a sit and grab a drink if she is working, Jenn WILL NOT disappoint!!!!
Manager Response: Dear TJ H, Thank you so much for your review of our property and our staff, in particular our bartender, Jenn.  She will be so thrilled to find that she made such a positive impact on your stay at our hotel.  We were excited to have your group stay at our property and I hope you enjoyed the drink specials that the front desk and bartenders came up with specifically for Konami and the Yu-Gi-Oh! competitors.  We look forward to the possibility of having you stay with us in the future should your travels ever bring you back to Anaheim.  Warm regards,  Lisa Dickinson, Food & Beverage Manager

Summary: I always book my rooms here. It is a short walk to Disneyland and the staff are very nice and professional. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. There are usually rooms available which is nice when you book on short notice. And the price is very affordable.:)
Manager Response: Dear kaitlyn,  We are honored that you continue to choose our hotel for your travels into the Anaheim area. Thank you for sharing your positive experience with our hotel and TripAdvisor community. We look forward to serving you and your family in the near future.

Summary: My stay here was great.  The staff was helpful and pleasant.  Marique always greeted us upon returning every time she saw us and graciously helped us with the computer.  The hotel location was good.  The walk to our conference, Disney and other locations was reasonable.  Clean rooms and a very descent breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear mcsmith,  Thank you for taking the time to post such a great review. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your most recent stay with us and hope to see you back soon. Wishing you happy holidays from all of us here at the Springhill Suites.

Summary: The hotel was clean, staff was nice and is in great walking distance to Disneyland. The breakfast area needs better organization to get people thru. The lighting in our room was very dim. There wasn't enough hooks in the bathroom to hang towels.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review with us.  I will be sure to share your comments with our team to ensure that we continue to provide excellent customer service to all of our guests.  Thank you again for being our guest and we hope to see you the next time your travels bring you to the area.

Summary: The hotel was clean and staff were friendly.  After a long day at a conference, I have an enjoyable evening in the lobby bar.  The bartender, Victoria was great!  Great drinks and good recommendations for dinner out and delivery of local Chinese.
Manager Response: Dear Gucci,  We are delighted to hear that you had a great experience at our hotel. I will make sure that Victoria gets recognized for her role in making your visit so much more enjoyable. We pride ourselves in delivering world class service and always appreciate the positive feedback. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near the Convention Center
Summary: This is a very new, updated and chic hotel that is only a short distance from the Convention Center, rooms are huge so if you're sharing room you have lots of space, great breakfast, nice workout room and helpful staff-- what more could you ask for?? How about also right above a CVS and close to a great little Mediterranean take out place! (Tanor- separate review). I asked for a quiet room and got Room 520, which was blissfully quiet- I would definitely ask for that room again if I came back....
Manager Response: Dear Sydney,  Thank you for the 5 star review. We are honored to hear that you had a wonderful stay with us. Our close proximity to the convention center and Disneyland make us a convenient option to both the business and leisure travelers. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay. Close to Disneyland and Convention Center
Summary: It has one of the best free breakfast with a variety of hot (eggs, bacon, waffles, toast) along with fruit, milk, cereal, juices, yogurt etc.   Friendly staff was at the door to greet you as you entered.
