Rooms are nice.  While my trip was business, my wife and two children came to spend time in the park.  Disneyland entrance is two block to the North, yet the park is basically across the street.  The convention center is on the same block.  The 24/7. Our room had two queen beds and a sofa sleeper.   There is a 24/7 pharmacy/store right next door complete with goodies, drinks, and everything else you forgot.  This is just a great hotel.  Top floor has a pool, nice outdoor sitting area with view of fireworks from Disneyland, and a exercise/fitness room.
Manager Response: Dear Kevin,  We want to thank you for posting such a great review of our property. Hopefully you were able to sneak away from the convention and enjoy Disneyland for a little while. We pride ourselves in meeting the needs of both our business and leisure travelers alike. I hope that we have an opportunity to serve you and your family once again.

Summary: We stayed here for 10 nights and had a really good time. The Hotel is fairly new, clean and has a good breakfast. The walk to Disneyland is easy going and a little tougher coming back after a long day! The only downside I have is that you can hear the people walking around above you. For 3 days we had kids that ran non stop but we survived. Try to get a room on the top floor so you have easy access to the rooftop deck and can watch the fireworks from your room.
Manager Response: Dear LaToya,  Thank you for sharing your experience about your most recent stay with us. We want to apologize for the noise issues that you dealt with during your stay. We know that a good night sleep is the key to a successful Disneyland trip and always encourage our guests to reach out to us immediately so that we can get the situation corrected as soon as possible. We hope to see you back soon and wish you a great holiday season.

Summary: Recently stayed here while attending a conference. Room was spacious and clean. Front desk staff was always courteous and quick with a hello. Victoria and Jenn at the lobby bar went out of their way to provide excellent service with a smile. Which after a day of meetings was refreshing!
Manager Response: Dear Dawn,  Thank you for the great review. Our staff is always honored to have wonderful guests like yourself take time out of their day to share their experience. It means a lot to us and we are very thankful and appreciative. We hope to see you back very soon.

Summary: Stayed here one night.  Great morning breakfast.  We got a room with a king bed in a separate area with bunk beds and a pull out sofa.  There were 3 televisions in the room.  So much room.  Would happily stay here for a Disney Vacation.  Very gracious staff.  Conveniently located to many restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Sprout,  Thank you for the great review. We hope to have the opportunity host you and your family on your next Disney trip. Wishing you a happy holiday season.

Summary: First the hotel is gorgeous and second, it is within a 5 minute walk to Disneyland! The rooms are huge with a living room that has a pull out couch to make an extra bed. They are very family friendly and even have room options with a bunk bed that can sleep up to 8 people comfortably in 1 room! The rooms were updated and very clean. They even have a fitness center and pool on the roof of the hotel. The staff went above and beyond to help with any questions we had. They also have a fantastic free continental breakfast. Our family and friends LOVED staying there. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying there again for our future Disneyland vacations.
Manager Response: Dear Amy,  Thank you for the AMAZING review. We are thrilled to hear that you had such a positive experience. Our guest's feedback is very important to our success and we appreciate every comment. Thank you again and we look forward to serving you and your family in the future.

Summary: This was a fantastic place to stay for our first trip to USA.  The staff when we arrived were friendly and welcoming, the room was perfect (5th floor, near lift but very quiet, only once did we hear someone walking past our room).  Loved the view of the fireworks from the pool deck.  The breakfast each morning was a great start to the day and was always well stocked.  The lady stocking and cleaning the breakfast area was lovely.  The kids loved the lollipop supply and we were always welcomed back by the staff at the end of the day, they were also very helpful when we had questions.  We stayed with our 3 children aged 12-16 and the room was plenty big enough.  The walk to Disneyland was pleasant and easy enough to come back for a break during the day.  Handy to have CVS below and
Manager Response: Dear Mckirk,  We are honored to receive such a fantastic review. I hope that your first trip to the US was memorable and that we have another opportunity to host you and your family once again. Wishing you a great holiday season.

Summary: Everything about this hotel we would rate excellent. Front desk staff, housekeeping staff and breakfast buffet staff were always very friendly and helpful. Room was very comfortable with two queen beds, real nice bathroom and roomy shower, separate sitting area that was a relaxing place to watch some TV after a full day at Disneyland. Room was always cleaned nice with plenty of towels. Breakfast buffet had nice selection of hot/cold items and they never ran out of anything. Extra thumbs up for warm syrup and nice cold non fat and 2% milk! Rooftop was a nice place to watch fireworks. We will definitely stay here again next year for our yearly Disneyland vacation!
Manager Response: Dear U3517,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. We are happy to hear that you had such a positive experience at our hotel and we hope that we are lucky enough to host you on your next Disneyland trip. Our rooftop pool, 2% milk, and warm syrup will be right here waiting for you. Wishing your a great holiday season.

Summary Heading: Good Family Hotel and Walking Distance to Disneyland
Summary: Came down from Northern California to stay here the weekend of June 19-21 for family wedding reception.  Had reserved a family room including two queen beds and separate bunk bed and living room couch that was also a bed to accommodate 5 of us.  Room was as pictured.  Bathroom was fantastic - ultra modern with nice fixtures.  Room worked well for all 5 of us - no one stepping on anyone else's toes.  The only issues we had were that food was never cleaned from the refrigerator when we checked in.  Had to have housekeeping come clean that up.  We also found a bag of pills on top of the bedroom wardrobe.  Called Housekeeping to let them know what we had discovered and they didn't seem to concerned.  The only reason we found it was because a portion of the bag was hanging over the
Manager Response: Dear QFP,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. Please accept my apologies about housekeeping issues encountered. This is not a typical occurrence and we will make sure that we are making it a priority. The safety of our guests (specially the little ones) is a top priority for us. Thank you for letting us know and we hope to have the opportunity to host your and your family on your next trip out to Disneyland.

Summary: I want to try and give an informational review because I appreciate information that I read that lends insight into the hotels and idiosyncracies of the rooms.  I came in early and wasn’t sure if they’d be able to check me in yet, but they did.  I asked for a quiet room, and they gave me room 301 which is all the way at the end of the corridor.  The corner suites have two full walls that are floor to ceiling windows.  It’s a really fantastic room!  I’m a light sleeper, so the first thing I’m always concerned about is noise levels - and this subject will probably take the bulk of this review.  Right off, the A/C was very loud.  There was a large vent where the air came out - I will include a photo.  When it reached the desired temperature, instead of turning off, the fan would
Manager Response: Dear onewanderer,  Thank you for sharing such a positive and detailed review of our hotel. We truly appreciate the feedback that we get from our guests. It allows us to better ourselves and be able to deliver a much better product and service. We look forward to your return and wish you a great holiday season with your loved ones.

Summary Heading: Great hotel if you're here for Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is walking distance from the Disneyland entrance. Excellent staff, very clean, and a cool rooftop pool, which you can see Disney's fireworks from at night.  Lots of restaurants nearby to walk to.  The CVS at the bottom of the hotel saved us on numerous occasions.  The breakfast there was good, especially the biscuits and gravy.
Manager Response: Dear Christina,  Thank you leaving such a great review. We are pleased to hear about your great stay at our hotel and thank you for taking time out of your day to share your experience. We hope to see you back with us very soon.

Summary: Great spot to stay for your trip to Disneyland.  New hotel, clean and quiet.  Buffet breakfast, bar for nightcap and right next to CVS.  Staff was very accommodating and arranged a town car  back to the airport, which was cheaper than a taxi.
Manager Response: Dear Susan,  We are so happy to know that you had a wonderful experience at our hotel. We hope that your Disneyland trip was memorable and hope to see you back with us on your next visit. Wishing you a great holiday season from all of us at the SpringHill Suites.

Summary: If you don't mind a little bit of walking this is a great place to stay for a Disneyland vacation, especially with a family. The hotel has larger rooms with a sitting area separate from the sleeping area and they have bunk bed suites available, the bathrooms are a good size and they serve complimentary breakfast which we found convenient as you can grab a banana and eat on the go while rushing to beat Disney crowds.  They also have decent parking for which they charge a reasonable price. It is our second choice for a non Disney property.  It is above a cvs so you can run downstairs and grab necesseties whithout having to drive or walk far away.  We have stayed here twice so far and it was a very pleasant experience.
Manager Response: Dear Kotkica,  Thank you for leaving such a positive review. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your second stay with and hope to see you back soon. Have a great holiday season with your family.

Summary: Nice new and clean hotel but very noisy.  Staff is polite.  Breakfast is average.  Bar closed before 1030 on a Saturday night.  CVS next door which was convenient.  If you can get a room on the top floor away from the ice machine it would be good otherwise not recommended
Manager Response: Dear Jody,  Thank you for posting your review. We are disappointed that we could not provide a more perfect stay for your and your family and hope to have the opportunity to make it right during your next trip. Thank you for making us aware of the noise coming from the ice machine; we will send maintenance up to ensure that they are in proper working condition. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Great family hotel/suite.  10-15 min walk to Disneyland.  Great complementary breakfast. Clean rooms. Friendly staff.  Shan at front desk was very helpful.  Pool was a bit small but good enough for a quick dip.  Great view of  fireworks from pool deck.  CVS right downstairs.  Many restaurants within walking distance.  Parking fee of $16 reasonable.  Didn't need our car as everything was within walking distance.  Will stay here again on our next trip!
Manager Response: Dear Heath,  My staff and I would like to send a giant thank you for posting such a wonderful review. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your time at our hotel and were able to enjoy our rooftop pool and fireworks view. We will be looking forward to your next stay with us.

Summary Heading: Disneyland, Horse-riding, Universal Studios and THE GETTY
Summary: As a surprise for my  ten year daughter, I booked a Disneyland (plus other exciting events) and told her two days before we departed New Zealand.  We had such a wonderful holiday - the best in fact!  Everything we did was marvellous and staying at the SpringHill Suites was part of the complete package.  Our room was clean and spacious and we were situated at the end of the corridor so there was very little noise.  The staff were lovely and the breakfast buffet was a great way to start the day.  My daughter especially loved grabbing a couple of lollypops on the way out the door to Disneyland.  It was great being only a five/ten minute walk from the main gate.  And I appreciated having the grocery store in the same building - it meant we could pick up treats anytime of the day or
Manager Response: Dear Tanea,  We can't thank you enough for posting such a great review. It is recognition like this that motivates our team to go above and beyond for our guests. Our staff would like to send your daughter a few more of our famous Chupa Chup lollipops; please give us a call so that we can get your mailing address and get them on their way. We hope to see you and your family back with us very soon.

Summary: We stayed here to go to Disney for 3 days.  This hotel was so quiet despite being full.  There was plenty of room and comfy beds.  Wonderful breakfast.  Close walk to Disney.  Friendly staff.  CVS located next to it which is nice for items forgotten.  Definitely will stay here next time that we come.
Manager Response: Dear Lori,  We are honored to have earned your business during your most recent trip. Our close proximity to Disneyland and easily accessible food options make us a great choice for travelers around world. Our friendly staff will be looking forward to your serving you and family on your return trip back to Anaheim.

Summary: This was the best place we stayed in Anaheim. It is not far from Disneyland. We were on the top floor close to the pool,gym and laundry services. The first time every thing i needed was in close proximity to our room. Downstairs is a cheap but good coffee shop and a convenience shop that was a great place to buy your snacks and water before heading to he parks. Across the road was a seven 11 and a A mart where you could get cheap Disney gifts. On the other corner were cheap take away shops pizza, subway, Chinese etc. For nicer restaurants they were only a short walk down the road to Buba Gump Shrimp and the cheese cake factory. Staff are lovely and welcomed you back when you walked in the door. They didn't expect tips and are happy to help.
Manager Response: Dear Leona,  Thank you for posting such a wonderful review. Your kind words mean a lot to our hard working staff and can't thank you enough. We are delighted to hear that you were able to enjoy our amenities and close proximity to Disneyland. Our central location makes us a popular choice among travelers and we couldn't be more grateful. We hope to see you and your family back soon.

Summary: This hotel was awesome! We came here for our 6 year anniversary. Now keep in mind, I was looking into staying at actual Disney hotels in the park. But after reading reviews on several sites, I decided against an actual Disney park hotel. This hotel gives you more amenities and value versus "others." The bed and pillows were comfortable. There is a separate area with a couch and tv. The free breakfast in the morning is actually pretty good too. Not just some muffins. Short walk to Disney, maybe 15 minutes, doesn't really seem that long either.  I would 100% recommend this hotel especially if you're going to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Linda M,  We would like to thank you for posting such a great review about our hotel. We pride ourselves in delivering a superior product and experience. We would love to see you back at our hotel when your travels bring you back to our Anaheim area.   Thank you again,

Summary: This hotel is perfect for a stay, you can walk to Disneyland and the Convention Center is just behind the building, free breakfast is just adequate, it is free after all so don’t think you will get a gourmet meal, they have hot items as well as cold cereal, pool is very small but great for kids, the gym is well equipped and open 24 hours, staff is super friendly, rooms are big and comfortable, great deal for the money…
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete a review of your most recent stay with us.  I will be sure to share your comments with our team to ensure that we are providing excellent customer service to all of our guests.  Thank you for being our guest and we hope to see you the next time your travels bring you to the area!

Summary: The suite was nice but the breakfast was very poor not good at all. We had booked before we traveled, when we checked in they told us they have to deduct an amount and this will be refundable after three days but we didn't get it back. Walking to Disney land takes 15 minutes.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review in regards to your most recent stay with us.  I sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you may have experienced in regards to our breakfast.  Please feel free to contact me about the deposit that has not been put back into your account.  714-333-9065

Summary: We had a great time!  Arrived a little before check in and they gladly checked us in early and we were off and playing!  It is within easy walking distance of Disneyland, but we bought bus passes at the front desk and were dropped off door to door!  Hearty breakfast is available every more...many choices.  Rooms are immaculate, well serviced and spacious.  They include refrigerator and microwave.  Many restaurants nearby to choose from and CVS and Walgreens are close by for snacks and sundries.  Every staff member was friendly, efficient and accommodating. At check out we were able to leave our baggage in a locked area, and they even called a shuttle to return us to the airport! They couldn't have provided us with any better service!  Excellent choice!
Manager Response: Dear CLM64,  Thank you for posting such an amazing review. Our staff works hard to ensure that you have a perfect stay; we understand the stress and physical toll that vacations can bring and try to do everything in our power to provide a magical stay. We hope to have to have opportunity to serve you and your family during your next trip out to Disneyland.

Summary: I was here for meetings at the convention center. This place was great. Brand new so everything was very clean. The staff was friendly. The rooms are really nice with updated features and lots of space. The hotel has free wifi and breakfast which was great. There were a lot of families there that seemed to be enjoying themselves. My only complaint was that the street noise was louder than I would have preferred. Overall a great place though. Would recommend it and/or stay again myself.
Manager Response: Dear Baseball4evr10,   We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your time with us during your most recent business trip. Please let us know when you book your next trip; it would be a pleasure to block you into a room that does not face the street. Thank you again for the wonderful review.

Summary: What a pleasant surprise this place is. Super friendly check in staff, very clean rooms, 15 minute walk to the park and breakfast included every day. The guest laundry, pool & fitness area were all amazing. After a big day at the parks truly enjoyed the roof top pool area with the famil.
Manager Response: Dear Donna,  Thank your for the wonderful review. It was an absolute pleasure being able to host you and your family on this most recent trip. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you once again when your travels bring you back to our Anaheim Area.

Summary: Great hotel great location good breakfast and coffee bean next door it is in walking distance from Disneyland maybe 6-10 minute walking depending on your speed only reason I gave it a 4 was because our sheets were a little dirty but besides that the room was clean and in great shape make sure your room is not facing harbor Blvd it can be kinda loud with the busses and traffic
Manager Response: Dear Disneylover,   Thank you for taking time out of your day to post your review. We know that there are many hotel options in the Anaheim Area and are truly grateful that you chose us. I want to apologize for the inconvenience with the bed sheets and can assure you that the matter will be corrected. We take great pride in our cleanliness and appreciate the feedback as it only helps us better our hotel. We hope to see you and your family back very soon.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel Very Close to Disney
Summary: Very nice, clean hotel and excellent location for access to the Disney main gate (approx. 12 minute walk). very large, comfortable, clean rooms with nice big HD TV's. Pool area on the roof is very relaxing, great view of the nightly Disney fire works.
Manager Response: Dear Dave H,  We would like to thank you for posting such a positive review of our hotel. Guest satisfaction is a top priority and we work diligently to ensure that everyone has a great experience. We hope to see you and your family back at our hotel very soon.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay if you want to go to DisneyLand
Summary: The hotel is a 15 minute walk from DisneyLand at best and there is a CVS downstairs in case you need anything.  It's also close to many local and chain restaurants.  It serves a decent breakfast and can quite crowded past 8AM.  The hotel provides a cheat sheet of what the hotel is like logistically.  Parking can get crowded and they may divert people to the parking behind the hotel, which the Marriott also owns. The roof deck is a great place to view the fireworks.  The pool and gym aren't bad and there is a laundry facility in the building if you need to do a load of laundry while you're there.  They offer daily cleaning and we were pleasantly surprised by how they made a cute scenery out of my children's toys.  My only complaint was that there seemed to be a bug issue as I
Manager Response: Dear smc46,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. Our pool area is definitely the star of the show during the fireworks show. The view is nothing short of spectacular and our Southern California  weather only makes things better. I was alarmed by your comment about the pest issue; please contact me with the room number so that have our pest control vendor inspect it immediately. Cleanliness is a top priority for us and situations like these are unacceptable and promptly corrected. We appreciate your feedback and hope to see you back at our hotel in the near future.

Summary Heading: I would love to love it...
Summary: ...but I just can't.   Don't get me wrong, it's a beautiful hotel, but there are just factors that don't add up.  My husband and I came here for our honeymoon, and while it's so clean (super new), I couldn't love it. When we first got here we were greeted by super friendly front desk employees and they went over all of the details, and then gave us a parking pass and explained that we needed the parking pass to park in the garage however if we wanted to do valet, we could do that also- no extra charge as the self parking and valet parking are the same price. We chose to do valet parking and went out for a walk after we were all settled in. When we came back we had a message waiting for us on our machine. I thought it was one of those "how is the room" messages- but when I
Manager Response: Dear SaweetDee,  Thank you for sharing your review with us. We apologize that we were not able to meet your expectations during your most recent stay at our hotel. I will personally look into the valet situation that you experienced as this is in no way a normal occurrence.   Very rarely do we get complaints about noise and would like to further look into the matter, I would like to ask if you could contact me at your convenience to get the room number and ask some additional questions that will help us improve our service moving forward.   Thank you again for review and we hope that you can give us a second opportunity to provide you with a more pleasant stay.

Summary: Recently stayed here at Springhill Suites and it was fantastic. Approx 15 minute walk away from Disneyland and California Adventure Park.   There is heaps of eateries all around the resort including an IHOP, Subway, pizza, chinese, Walgreens, CVS and more as well as a service station across the road.   The rooms are quite large, with fridge and microwave for those who want to eat in and save some cash for the theme parks. Beds are very comfortable, with great aircon and dark curtains. The rooms also have a couch to relax on after a long day on your feet.  The resort also boasts a 24hr gym, a small rooftop pool and cheap washers and dryers which are great for those that have been travelling alot. You can buy washing powder from the front desk for $1USD and the washer and dryer is
Manager Response: Dear Stonehelm,  Thank you for posting such a great review of our hotel. Our centralized location and list of amenities are aimed at taking the stress away during your trip out to such a magical place. Your positive feedback is a bonus to myself and the staff. We hope to see you back with us soon.

Summary: This was a new property and quite nice and convenient to Disney. There is no free shuttle but you can walk to front gate about 10 mins. Room is nice with separate living area away from bedroom though no wall separates it. The bath was nice size and nice shower stall. Bath sink was big to lay out all your stuff. Breakfast is included but as expected was a mad house in the morning due to hordes of people in the morning. Good price for the room. There are 2 Spring Hill Suites and the other one is much older.  There is also a Residence Inn across the drive way and that one is little nicer but more expensive.
Manager Response: Dear PBWorldTraveler,  Thank you for the incredible review; your feedback is very important to us and we are grateful that you chose our Springhill Suites as your home away from home. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you and your family in the near future.

Summary: Had a great stay at this hotel when we visited Disneyland. The suites were a good size and quite modern and had all the essentials you need. The pool area was lovely and you overlooked the park so could get a view of he fireworks. The gym was good too. It was very close to the park only a 10min walk. Would definitely recommend as I have stayed in a few hotels in Anaheim and this would have to be the best for the budget.
Manager Response: Dear lhead47,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. Your feedback is crucial to our continued success and invite you back to our hotel when your travels bring you back to our Anaheim area. We look forward to serving you again.

Summary: My family and I had a great experience at this hotel. The Staff are all so friendly and courteous. Mike at the front desk was very accommodating to the needs of our family. Always happy to be of service. Breakfast buffet was always replenish and food was fresh. My son left a Ziploc full of his electronics and Ms. Reyes from lost and found promptly returned my phone call and told me that they do have it and she was very kind to mail it to our home. You can tell how this hotel is very well managed.  We will definitely come back to this hotel and recommend it to our friends and family.
Manager Response: Dear RS S,  We are delighted to hear about your positive experience at Springhill Suites Anaheim Resort. It was an absolute pleasure hosting you and your family and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you in the future. I will make sure that Ms. Reyes and Mike are recognized for their job well done.

Summary: I totally enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is about 15-18 minutes walk from Disneyland. I didn't walk because of my babies, but I saw a lot of people leaving and returning to the hotel on foot.  Here are things I loved about this hotel: 1. It has a CVS right next to it 2. The breakfast was delicious. Without doubt, they need to keep that chef. My kids really enjoyed the food. 3. It is close to the roadside, but we did not hear any noise from our room. We booked a room facing the convention center. 4. Customer service was awesome.  What i did not like 1. The bathroom design did not work for me. Am just being picky here. 2. The elevators shut too fast - it is not kid friendly  Overall, it was a great experience. I recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Tosin,  We love your review! thank you for taking the time to share your experience with our hotel and TripAdvisor Community. Your positive comments on our kitchen staff will be communicated and we will make sure that we recognize the appropriate individual. We hope to see you back with us very soon.

Summary: Awesome stay here for our honeymoon! We felt special and loved being so close to The Disneyland park and Anaheim garden walk!!! Mike at the front desk was an awesome help with all of our questions and made us feel so special!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete a survey of your most recent stay with us!  I am glad to hear that you had a great stay for a very special moment! We are lucky to have employees such as Mike who go above and beyond in providing excellent service to our guests.  I will be sure to share your comments with our team. Thank you for being our guest and we hope to see you the next time your travels bring you to the area!

Summary: Great location! Very friendly staff, gave us a free upgrade to the bunk bed room. Room was very clean and spacious, way more than enough rooms are for 5 people. The free breakfast was also delicious. Although not free self and valet parking is available. WiFi worked great. Lots of food within walking distance, CVS is downstairs for things you may have forgotten. Being that this is a kid friendly hotel if you do not like kids or do not want to hear the sound of running above you at all hours this is not the hotel for you.
Manager Response: Dear Kaleinanik, Thank you for sharing your hotel experience with our TripAdvisor community. During the summer months we tend to have more families staying with us and enjoying our complimentary amenities and short walk to Disneyland.  We are also very proud of the fact that we are one of the closest hotels to the Anaheim Convention Center and can become a business oriented hotel overnight. We aim to treat all of our guests as VIPs, whether here on business or pleasure. Our staff will be looking forward to hosting you and your family during your next trip out into our Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: A great way to spend two days at Disneyland
Summary: How convenient  it was to stay at the Marriott SpringHill suites where the rooms and the Associates are just the very best.  A very nice walk to the park from the hotel .  We did and came away feeling so happy at the grand time we had both at the Parks and the hotel.  From our experience if you are bringing the children or on your own such as we were,  on a grade level I give it a A plus.
Manager Response: Dear Ja N,  We are thrilled to hear that you had a great experience during your visit to our Anaheim area. Thank you for sharing your feedback with us and our TripAdvisor community. We love your A plus rating of our facility and will continue to strive to deliver the same experience to all of our future guests. Looking forward to having you and your family back with us in the future.

Summary: Great hotel and breakfast. Excellent rooms.  Sit in the pool and view at hotel top the Disney fireworks. Great location and walking distance to Disney. Car rental not necessary.  Surrounded by hotels and many  restaurants. Other tours from the immediate area.
Manager Response: Dear Balvin,  Thank you for making us your hotel of choice when visiting our Anaheim area. It is always a great day when one of our valued guests takes time out of his/her day to post such a wonderful review of our property. It was an absolute pleasure serving you and look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Brand new hotel 10 minute walk to Disneyland
Summary: This is a fresh brand new hotel. We stayed in a 2 queen bed room and were very satisfied. Hot complimentary breakfast and free WiFi. Parking cost a $16. Pool, fitness, coin laundry. Staff were helpful, smiling and efficient.
Manager Response: Dear anatoliansun,  Thank you for the wonderful review. We are pleased to hear that you had a great stay at our hotel and can't begin to thank you enough for staying with us. We hope to see you back with us soon.

Summary Heading: Very pleasant stay, friendly staff, would definitely recommend
Summary: The three of us stayed in a "Family Suite", which is the largest room they have, and different from the bunk bed suite.  We chose this room because it is the only one with a door separating the bedroom from the rest of the suite.  The room was spacious, with lots of surfaces on which to put things (some hotel rooms seem to have no place for bags, electronics, etc.).  The shower was good, the towels were large and plusher than at comparable level hotels, and the room was clean.  There were 3 television sets in the suite, one in the bedroom, one in the area with bunk beds, and one in the living room area.  The room faced the courtyard, so there was no view, but it was quiet, except during the fireworks, which  I think all of Anaheim hears every night.  For me, this was preferable
Manager Response: Dear NewYorkTraveler, Thank you for taking time out of your day to share your wonderful feedback about your most recent stay with us. We love it when guests mention our staff members by name and I will make sure that Mike is recognized for his superb customer service. Your feedback about breakfast has also been shared with our F&B manager to see if there is something different that we can try to enhance our presentation and waffle products. Thank you again for the positive review and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you in the future.

Summary: Very nice, clean and great customer service skills.  My family and I enjoyed a great breakfast every morning. I want to thank you Cathy, Dulce, Mike, Ramon, and the security guard she was always helpful. Thank You For the great customer service you all provided to my family and I. The room was clean the facilities in the room were wonderful - fridge, microwave,  two TVs, and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was big. Hotel is a few minutes from Disney Parks. Very happy with hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Marquen,  We are thrilled to hear that named associates made a positive impression during your stay. I will make sure that they are recognized by their immediate supervisors for going above and beyond. We look forward to your next visit out to Anaheim and ask that you contact us if there is ever anything that we can assist you with.

Summary Heading: This was the better of the two Springhill Suites I stayed at recently
Summary: I love Springhill Suites. This was the better of the two as it is located within walking distance of Disneyland, really close to eateries as well as one drug store with another opening soon. I love the design of the rooms that has a sofa seating area with multiple TVs in case there are two types of viewing pleasures in one room to cater to. I stayed with my pediatric client, his sister and mother on a family vacation. There was a big bowl of suckers at the front desk, so coming in and going out we made sure to walk over to the bowl and choose our flavors of the day. Staff was welcoming and room was clean. Thank you Springhill Suites for making our stay enjoyable!
Manager Response: Dear CatherineMarie,  We want to thank you for posting such a positive review about our property. Your satisfaction is  our number one goal and are thrilled that we were able to deliver such a memorable experience. We will keep our bowl of suckers full and awaiting your return. Enjoy the upcoming Labor Day Weekend and we hope to have the opportunity so serve you and your family once again.

Summary: We stayed here on a recent trip to Disneyland- great location, good breakfast selection.  Our boys wish the pool would have been bigger- we would take a break from the parks late in the afternoon and apparently every other family had the same idea.  I counted 20+ kids in the pool at one point and the pool was NOT big enough to accommodate that many kids cannonballing at once.  :-)
Manager Response: Dear srfrgrl68, Thank you for sharing your feedback with us and our TripAdvisor Community. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast and convenient location to Disneyland. Our pool is a popular attraction and specially during the afternoon hours. Typically overcrowding is not an issue for us but want to apologize for the inconvenience. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you and your family on your next trip out to Anaheim. Thank you again for the positive comments.

Summary Heading: Great staff until money was stolen from my room!
Summary: I have been a gold elite Marriott member for several years and have stayed at this particular property to the tune of $1000's in multiple visits.  The front desk staff is great and have been very accommodating.  However, my stay in May was ruined when $200 in cash was stolen out of my room (in my wallet that was hidden inside the dresser).  I tried to be very polite and not make any accusations but it was clear the money had been taken.  I spoke with the manager who filled out an incident report and that was pretty much the end of everything.  Phone calls and emails were never returned and the hotel manager was never "in" the office to talk to.  Marriott corporate tried to help but they said its a franchise and there is nothing more they can do.   I am very, very disappointed
Manager Response: Dear Screwwork03 I am the new General Manager at this location and wanted to thank you for reaching out to us in regards to the unfortunate event that occurred during your last visit to our hotel. I see that both the hotel and our risk management company completed detailed investigations of the incident. The results came back with no criminal findings and ultimately closed.   We take incidents like this very seriously and always work promptly to resolve them. Our hotel has always had a great reputation in our community and with our guests and I encourage you to reach out to me if there is anything else that I can help with.   Sincerely,  Moises Ambriz

Summary Heading: Great modern hotel in easy walking distance of Disneyland and California Adventure
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights to allow us to visit the Disney Parks.It was a good choice. Quite new hotel convenient drug store next door and shop across the road. Lots of eating places nearby and easy walk to the entry to Disneyland ... about 600 metres The breakfast was good and staff were friendly the pool deck was good and you can see the Disney fireworks at night  All in all a good choice for us visiting from Australia
Manager Response: Dear Fezzalini,  We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your most recent stay at our Springhill Suites Anaheim Resort. It was an absolute pleasure serving you and your family and look forward to your next trip out to our Anaheim area. Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us and our TripAdvisor Community.

Summary: I would recommend this hotel to everyone!   Rooms were updated, clean and the beds are very comfortable.  We booked the "Kids Suite" which had 2 queen beds, a set of bunk beds and a sleeper sofa.  There were 7 of us in the room and we were all comfortable and not packed in like most hotel rooms.   The hotel provides complimentary breakfast daily, eggs, breakfast meat, potatoes, breakfast breads & pastries, pastries, cereal, yogurt, oatmeal, juice, milk, and coffee.   The hotel is an easy walk to Disneyland and local restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Precious,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a positive review. We are delighted to hear that you had a wonderful time at our hotel. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you and your family on your next trip into the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Business trip to Anaheim Convention Center, July 2016
Summary: Convenient to Orange County/Aneheim Convention Center. $65. plus tip taxi from John Wayne Airport. Hotel room was confortable; shared with another staff person from our company. 5 minute walk to Convention Center. Buffet breakfast included. Housekeeping for room needs to step up a notch. Staff very courtesy. Easy walk, 5-10 minutes to many restaurant choices. Did not go to Disney but was told it was 5 minutes or less. Certain nights, good view of Disney fireworks from roof top pool area of Hotel. Thought the nightly rate was somewhat high.  Tourist taxes in Anaheim very, very high.
Manager Response: Dear William,  Thank you for choosing our hotel during your most recent trip into our Anaheim area. We are one of the closest hotels to the Anaheim Convention Center and strive to deliver nothing short of a perfect stay. I will make sure to share your review with our housekeeping staff in an effort to better our operation. We hope to see you back soon. Thank you again for sharing your experience with us.

Summary: This hotel was new the month we visited, so it was beautiful. The pool was warm, even though it was December. It was Christmas time, so they played Christmas movies at the pool, which my children loved. There was also a nice fire pit at the pool, so my husband and I were able to stay warm while watching the movies at night. The breakfast was very good and the nightly reception was nice, with wine, juice, and some good food. One night it was our dinner because the food was so good. The suite was a great size for our family of 6. It was right next door a Disneyland parking lot, so we were able to use the free shuttles to Disneyland and we never needed a car. It is a little bit of a walk to the shuttles, but not too bad and saved us money on parking at the hotel ($10 a night) and
Manager Response: Dear Sharleen,  We want to thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your stay at our Springhill Suites Anaheim Resort. We are pleased to hear that you were able to enjoy our amenities to their fullest and cannot wait to see you and your family back at our hotel.

Summary Heading: Disappointed stay - dirty sheets and service issues
Summary: The sheets in my room had little black fuzzies and hair and looked unwashed. Since housekeeping staff had left for the day, I had the option to change the sheets myself. Instead, I requested a room change and when I went down to the front desk to get my new key, I was told security would be escorting me back to my original room, since I would now be locked out. Suffice it to say, it was not locked, the TWO security guards that escorted me waited for me to open the door and when I was packing up my stuff, I told them they could leave, I would be fine. However they said they were there to make sure I exited the room.   I don't know how many people try to cheat the hotel out of a free room by  requesting a room change, but the whole situation was wholly unnecessary and will make
Manager Response: Dear "Freah8", I believe this review may have just been delayed but in case you did not receive our management's  personal email, I will post it here as well: First, please accept our deepest apologies that the original room you checked into was not clean to Marriott’s-and our-standards. I have already reached out to the housekeeping manager about the cleanliness issue so that she may use it as a training opportunity for her staff.  We are also sincerely sorry if you felt that the hotel was mistrusting you in any way with the room transfer and our security’s assistance.  My night auditor reach out to me informing me that you felt uncomfortable because of what appears to have been a miscommunication with the guards who were there to assist you.  In the middle of the night when additional staff is not readily available, we do use our security as an extension of ourselves to assist with housekeeping requests, maintenance requests, and the occasional rare room move.  When transferring a guest to a new room location, we like to send an employee to ensure that the guest is able to gain access to their old room and to be readily available should they need any help with luggage or further communication with our front desk.  It can be very frustrating for a guest who needs to get back into the old room because they forgot an item and their keys have already been timed out within minutes due to the transfer.  Normally we only have one security guard at a time but we were also introducing a new security guard to the team that evening and they were shadowing the other officer for training purposes. We are sorry if their uniform made you feel like they were not there to ensure that you made it to your new room location comfortably.  We have never had a guest in the past feel this way about our security staff but we will bring it up to their supervisors to make sure there is no miscommunication like this in the future.  I hope this helped clear up some of the concerns you had with our security staff that night. Kind Regards, Lisa D., Operations

Summary: I was excited to stay here for Vidcon this year but it's been not so great for the money.  They have construction crews right outside my window, which is now taped up and you can't look outside.  The maid has only shown up 1 day so far and I have teenagers in and out of here all day and night. Today when I left my room she was right next to mine standing in the hall talking with another maid. I came back 3 hours later she has skipped my room and is still in hallway talking to another maid.  There is no self parking right now because of the construction so I had to valet it for 16 dollars a day. Because the lot always seemed full I was afraid to go anywhere with my car so I walked everywhere. That's fine but it's about 100 outside right now.  There was no bellman to help me with
Manager Response: Dear Mom2Rach,   Thank you so much for your comments regarding your stay at our property.  We are very sorry to hear about the issues you encountered.  Our hotel is currently being repainted on the outside of the property.  We do try our very hardest to make sure that the painting of property is done in times when it’s most convenient for guests and we are looking forward to the fresh look of our hotel once it is completed.  We have also relayed your feedback regarding housekeeping to the department manager and we really appreciate that you brought it to our attention.  During major conventions like Vidcon that sell out the Anaheim Resort, self parking can get full at times.  This is why we’ve made self parking and Valet parking the same cost; to try and alleviate our guests of any stress of finding a parking space, especially during the busy summer season and during major conventions.    We’re very glad that you were able to partake in our breakfast buffet during your stay.  We have worked very hard trying to offer a wide variety of options for our breakfast items.  We also pride ourselves on the view of the fireworks from Disneyland up by the pool area.  We are glad you got up there in time for the fireworks show.     Thank you again for your review and we hope to welcome you back should your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort.  Kind Regards, Lisa Dickinson, Operations

Summary: First, this hotel wasn't all horrible. The valet service was great. It costs the same as self-parking, and they get your car rather quickly. The front desk staff were also great at check in. However, it ended there. The biggest problem with this place is probably the housekeeping staff. On one occasion, they took the towels we left on the floor and just hung them up, rather than replacing them. On another occasion, we returned from Disneyland rather late only to find that the door to our room was open. Anybody could have just walked in and taken anything. I reported these issues to the front desk, and, during the next housekeeping visit, they stole my laundry money (roughly $7 in quarters). When I complained about all of those issues to the manager on duty, Lisa Dickinson, the
Manager Response: Thank you for voicing your concerns. Unfortunately the hotel management has no record of you opening an incident report regarding the missing laundry quarters during your stay.  We take matters like this very seriously.  Please feel free to reach out to us so that we may investigate this issue.  There were also a few problems that you had mentioned that the hotel was looking into however we also have a much different account of the conversations you had and the reason why we were unable to reach an understanding in the form of compensation. We are always available to hear and address our guests' concerns and we apologize that you had a less than satisfactory stay. Thank you again for sharing your experience with us. Regards, Lisa Dickinson, Operations

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay when visiting the O.C.
Summary: Centrally located in Orange County 3-4 miles from the beach, couple miles from Disneyland, close to convention center, close to all major attractions in the O.C. Rooms clean and spacious plenty of toiletries, pillows, and bed linens. Very clean property and lobby. Employees are nice and friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our property.  We are a few blocks down from the Disneyland Resort main entrance and just next door to the Anaheim Convention Center so a lot of our guests enjoy the close proximity to these destinations.  We are happy to find that you enjoyed our spacious suites and that you found our employees to be friendly.  We hope to see you again when you visit "the O.C." Kind Regards, Lisa Dickinson, Operations

Summary: The only thing I can really complain about is breakfast. I have never ever in my whole life of travels ever eaten off plastic plates, forks, knifes and spoons. We have travelled the world and this to me was so degrading. Is this what all Hotels in Anaheim has to offer I will defiantly be asking before booking if I was ever to return.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback regarding your experience with our complimentary breakfast buffet.  We do use disposable cutlery and plates due to the amount of children at our property because of the Disneyland Resort.  These types of lightweight plates and cutlery allow for easier access with smaller children.  Also as part of our green initiative being a Marriott property in the state of California, we will be using bio degradable products beginning July 1st.  We are excited to be decreasing our carbon footprint by using plates and that will make a positive impact on our water usage and waste. Again, we appreciate your concern and comments and we look forward to improving our environment.  We hope to be given the opportunity to welcome you back should your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort. Sincerely, Lisa Dickinson, Operations

Summary: Rates really vary - we paid a different rate every night. Kind of frustrating. Everything was really nice. Enjoyable. Only biggest issue  was that the breakfast doesn't begin early - this hotel caters to people attending the park. Breakfast should begin at 6 am or earlier!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  We do open our buffet as early as 6:30am on the weekdays and 7am on the weekend since the resort normally opens during the summer at 8am but we did pass your suggestion on to our management team.  The rates can sometimes fluctuate depending on occupancy (weekend and weekday rates can differ) and whether or not there is a city wide convention in town.  Thank you again for your review of our hotel.  We are happy you found our property beautiful and we look forward to seeing you again when your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort. King Regards, Lisa Dickinson, Operations

Summary: We fled a horrible hotel in a nearby city and came to the Marriott for sanctuary.  What a relief!  The location is great. It's clean and sanitary yet nicely decorated, and the staff went out of their way to make our stay wonderful.  I and my family would love to return someday.
Manager Response: We are happy to see that you enjoyed your stay at our property.  Our hotel is one of the newer Marriott properties in the area and we love our location as well.  We are so glad to find that the staff went out of their way to make sure your stay was wonderful.  We will definitely pass that onto them.  We look forward to seeing you and your family return to us again! Kind Regards, Lisa Dickinson, Operations

Summary: Flew down to see our daughter graduate with her masters from CSFI and catch a couple Disney days. This a nice place 1.1 miles from Disneyland and also has an ART stop. Has an extremely busy/crowded breakfast. Watch Disney's hours. Our room was not ready, so they put us in a room DQ with bunks. Firm mattresses  a Harbor room , clean and tidy, that was only half the time, even though I notified the front desk. Out of 4 days , we had housekeeping 2.   I do expect better. Staff we very cordial. Need more housekeeping. Reasonable price, great location. New Hyatt going up across the street and a R. I. Behind, prices may rude down a bit once they open.
Manager Response: Dear Jack19462014,   Thank you for taking the time to provide us with feedback regarding your recent stay. Please accept my sincere apology for the unsatisfactory experience you had at our hotel with our housekeeping staff. Please be assure that we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel teams to ensure these issues are immediately address and corrected moving forward.   Thank you again for sharing your experience with us as it allows us the opportunity to learn from our shortcomings and improve upon them. Should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, please do not hesitate to contact me directly so that we may better your experience with us.   Best Regards,  Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary: Last time I stayed at a hotel for Disney, I stayed at the Hilton Convention Center (I'm not into the idea of paying  $500 a night for a Disney property). It was just "ok" so this round, I was determined to try somewhere different, preferably a Marriott. I gave this place a try and I'm SO glad I did! For those of you familiar with Springhills, it's a Springhill... just newer, better located and more convenient than most!   We arrived at 11am and I checked in at the front desk, just to drop our bags. "I know it's too early to check in" I said. "Let me see what I can do" says the desk guy. 5 minutes later we're in our room. Boom! You know how easy it would have been for him to say "sorry, no rooms available yet"? VERY. So let me clear a few things up:  Parking IS limited in the

Summary Heading: One of my new favorite hotels by Disneyland...
Summary: We are pass holders and go to Disneyland every couple of months and this is probably my new favorite hotel.  It is newer, and the room we had included two queen size beds, two bunk beds, a couch, and a nice sized bathroom so the kids felt like they had their own area.  This was the perfect size and arrangement for us as I was traveling with my son, and my sister and her son.  A "normal" hotel room would have been a bit crowded.  The breakfast was also nice, and there was plenty of seating.  The hotel was clean and we could easily view the Disney fireworks from the pool area which is not typical.  Most importantly, this hotel is an easy walk to Disneyland.  There are very few hotels that are an easy walk, including the on-site properties ($$$$) a couple across the street which

This was a very pleasant experienced.  It is a nice 15 to 20 minute walk to Disney.  The hotel in general and room were very well maintained.  The room was a suite of course and it had a great layout with the bath in the middle so you would have some privacy from the kids on the other side.  It was a great value for the price too.  Fireworks nightly from the pool deck on the top floor looking at the owner of Terror.

This hotel is a no-thrills hotel. There was no bellman and the valet was unwilling to get out of his chair to help unload baggage I was struggling with with a 4 year old in tow. The bell carts have no hooks for bags. The staff was friendly. When it got to the room there were several things that the room was better suited for older children and not toddlers. Usually there is a chain link deadbolt on hotel doors out of reaching distance. The door had a funky little tab you pulled towards you for an intruder lock. Problem is you can't see your kid/s from the adult bedroom area in case they tried to jail break/run free. The doors were also very noisy. In the mornings you could hear the constant sounds of the room keys clicking and doors slamming. We had a suite that had bunk beds. I

This Hotel is awesome!  Clean, new, walking distance to Disneyland.  They are building a new Courtyard right next door which is still under construction.  My stay was not impacted with the construction next door.  There is also a CVS Pharmacy underneath, which is very convenient.  I stayed on 3rd floor and my parents were on the second floor.  We traveled with one child and a teenager.  The rooms are huge and have a great floor plan.  There is a separate living area with a big flat screen TV.  The shower was amazing and the amenities were top of the line.  The staff was over the top gracious and welcoming.  They also serve complimentary hot and cold breakfast buffet each morning.  Conveniently located is a coffee, bean, tea and leaf right next door, I cannot find one complaint

It takes 15 minutes of walking to the bag check at Disney.  Not bad! You are really just walking around the bottom right side of the park.  The one issue that bugs me is after a long day you have to walk around the back of the hotel to get in.  That back area is down a darkish driveway. So if they could open it up on the side closest to Disney that would be great.  We had a 2 queen and pull out bed room.  It was ok, it was clean, and looked fine.  The included breakfast wasn't as nice as I have seen in other places, but it was good enough.  All in all this is a good place to pick if you want to save a bit, and be close to the park.

We loved this place. Within walking distance to Disneyland. We stayed on the top floor corner unit and could see the fireworks at night. Our room was very quiet and had everything we needed. Breakfast was OK the usual free breakfast. It was crowded though. We like that we could walk back to our hotel and rest for a couple hours and then go back for the evening. Went to Downtown Disney on nights we weren't at Disney. Great place to stay.

Summary Heading: very nice place, good for small kids
Summary: i've been for business in Anaheim, the place is funny and it make you think to your youth. btw place is clean, with good services, good breakfast.  only pity is that there was no bottled water in the room neither for purchase... very nice

Summary Heading: Nice Family getaway, not so good for older kids!
Summary: Our unit had a sofa bed, bunk bed and King  in a separate bedroom. Enough bedding for our family of six, but only one bathroom; not so good for our three teens and my wife. Was hard to sneak into the shower. Also: no table/chairs or other seating area (aside from the sofa, that was prepared into a bed our whole stay).  Breakfast ends at 9:30, and the six of us were lucky to leave our room by 10:30.  I went down early one morning and had eggs, bacon, and sausage. Was average, and nothing to write home about. Pool on fifth floor was nice, however small. No hot tub :(    Nice viewing area and lounging furniture to watch the Disneyland fireworks.  Hotel is more appropriate for families with younger children.

We stayed here for four nights while going to Disneyland. It wasn't a bad walk from the hotel to the park but the transit service is right out front. Having a CVS was also helpful to grab water and drinks. The hotel staff were all great! I called prior to check in to see if my sister could stay in a room close to us and they were so accommodating! I was impressed with the rooms and the entire stay. I would stay here again.

I was visiting Disneyland with my sister and our two 12-yr old sons.  The hotel was very new and clean.  We were upgraded to a room with 2 queen beds and bunk beds for the boys.  Plenty of room and semi-private for the boys.  Despite being sold-out, the hotel was very quiet.  The complimentary breakfast was one of the nicest of any Marriott I've experienced.  Pretty similar to all their other resorts but quite clean and well-stocked.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  The icing on the cake was that this awesome hotel was truly a short walk to disneyland.  While many hotels claim they are walkable, this was really very close and easy to walk.  Although we did opt for a cab back even though it was just down the street ($5 cab ride).  My sister is an avid Disney member for

I have never written a review in my life, that's how bad it was. Don't get me wrong, the hotel was beautiful- but the walls and flooring are paper thin. We couldn't sleep the entire time. The people next to us wouldn't stop thumping and speaking until after 11 (yes the walls are so thin you can hear their conversations! I kid you not!) Then the people above us sounded SO LOUD, we were all awake before 6am. We couldn't sleep through the constant pounding and talking coming from upstairs. It was horrible!! DO NOT stay here if you want to get a good nights sleep! I am exhausted!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. We are happy to see that you enjoyed the appearance of our property. Please accept our apologies in regards to the poor experience you had due to the noise from the guests around you. As a hotel that caters to families heading to the Disneyland Resort, we do have insulation throughout the rooms so we do not get noise complaints often between guest rooms. Please never hesitate to speak with the front desk should your travels be negatively affected by noise such as this. We do take these issues very seriously and we do ask that our guests be considerate to those around them and below them. We hope to provide you with a better experience should your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort.  Sincerely, Lisa Dickinson Operations

Summary: Comfortable modern hotel two blocks from Disney Land. We were able to leave DL on the really hot days and return back later because of the location of this property. 7/11 across the road, pizza, Chinese, subway the other way. Breakfast is basic, but does the job. Can be a bit noisy in the morning from the floor above, but nothing too bad. Freindly helpful staff, really enjoyed our stay.

Thus hotel impressed us - quite new - quiet considering an influx of tweenage girls at dance comps were staying - chaotic breakfast but good fresh choices.  Large room/suite, great bathroom & TV channels, microwave, drugstore next door with food, pharmacy items etc, 5 minute walk to main gate of Disney.  Pool area had viewing area for Disney fireworks. Would recommend & we would definitely stay here again.

The staff was amazing! They booked us a car service to pick us up and take us to the airport and they made sure a car seat was provided. Anaheim garden walk is a short 5 minute walk and so was the Convention Center. We stayed in a King Corner Suite on the 4th floor. The room was very clean and spacious. There was some construction going on next door but we were gone by the time it started and returned when it was already quitting time. The breakfast was ok and it was free! Pool is small. No hot tub. Nice upper deck with plenty of seating and shade. We enjoyed the fireworks at night from the pool deck. CVS is right next door which saved us some money on water, energy drinks, etc.

This is our absolute favorite place to stay when visiting family and going to Disneyland. The service at this lovely place is beyond compare, everyone goes out of their way to assist you in any way possible. We love being able to open the curtains on their large windows and sitting on the bed to watch the nightly fireworks. There is a rooftop pool with a lovely patio that you can also watch the fireworks from. There is a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf and CVS right on the property. The front desk staff is excellent. They bend over backwards to make sure your stay is wonderful. You can either self park or use their friendly valet staff. This is our home away from home, we keep going back. We have spent 16 nights in less than a year....that's how much we ❤️ It.

Summary Heading: Nice Newer Hotel Close to Disney
Summary: This is one of the nicer Springhill suites I have stayed at. Nice breakfast, excellent workout areas, cool rooftop pool to watch fireworks and a short walk to Disneyland. Having CVS next door is a nice bonus as well.

We stayed here for three nights for our Disney spring break vacation. Upon arrival, our room wasn't ready but they happily kept our bags so we didn't have to keep them in our car in their Parking garage. We finished all of the check in procedure so when we came back from the parks, all we had to do is get the keys. That was very helpful.   Rooms are large. A separate area with a pull out bed which is always nice for a family of five. Two separate TVs and a lot of storage for clothes and room to keep suitcases. Bathroom was large (no bathtub though).   Breakfast was included and a lot of choices although as you could guess, very busy with people headed to Disney.   Paid parking added to your room fee but that seems to be the norm with being so close to the parks.   The walk to

Located only 10 minutes walk from Disneyland this hotel is well positioned for a family aiming to go there. The room was a very good size for the five of us with 3 large beds and 2 flat screen TV's with comfortable accommodation. A lock on the bathroom door would have been better for privacy! The breakfast is included in the room rate but the use of plastic cutlery and plates was a bit basic! Within walking distance of the hotel there is a good choice of restaurants and takeaways to go at night. Overall we had a very pleasant stay.

Enjoyed an 8 day stay in Anaheim on combined family/business trip.    Pros: Clean, fast elevators, friendly staff, daily room service that restocked items without having to make special requests, free breakfast, close proximity (short walk) to both Disney and Convention center, view of Disneyland fireworks at night from rooftop, large rooms with two tvs, free internet that seemed to work better than most I have used in the past, CVS in the bottom of the hotel, reasonably priced and great coffee in coffee shop attached to the hotel, great restaurants within walking distance - including ones in the convention center hotels like the Hilton which do not show up on maps  Cons: serves turkey bacon and sausage every other morning (I know.....petty complaint), can be noisy if parents

We were scheduled to take our family vacation during my daughter's spring break from school.  Unfortunately both kids came down with the flu days before we were going to arrive.  I had to call the hotel three times to switch our arrival date, because of this.  When we arrived, our room wasn't ready yet and I let them know when I checked in that the last person that changed the date for me (Their central reservation line) wasn't that helpful at all. Luckily, Raul Escobedo at the front desk was amazing and caring and not only found us a room right away but upgraded us to the family suite.  My kids were so excited, and it was a blessing because they were still weak from being sick and we ended up spending a lot of time just relaxing in our room.  Thank you Raul Escobedo, and the

Loved it!  It's going to be my "Go To" hotel for Disneyland. A bit of a walk down Harbor Blvd. from Disneyland. Large room. Large bathroom and large shower with alot of light. Quite, don't hear the neighboring rooms. Loved the breakfast. We had our two teenage daughters with us and all was well so you know it must have been great.

If you are looking for a nice place to stay near Disneyland that cost less than the Disney properties this is a good alternative. Nice clean rooms with modern decor and a lot of room. They free breakfast was very good. The walk is not to far and you enter on the side opposite from Downtown Disney which makes it a shorter walk. There is a CVS in the parking lot attached to the hotel which was very convenient. This is a good choice for a hotel close to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Awesome and  great for family to stay
Summary: Awesome  and great value of stay nice and clean room  kids love the pool at the roof top  awesome  spot  to see the Disneyland fireworks.  Great and awesome hearty breakfast my kids love it mostly had a good varieties  of cereal. And had a Nutella spread that they love it  over all great place just cross street to disneyland  easy access to all restaurant and had a cvs downstair  we  definitely   going back here  again in jan !!!

Summary Heading: Group Customer Service Is Amazing!!! Other Hotels In The Area- TAKE NOTE!!!!
Summary: I have stayed here several times, in fact I have reviewed this hotel previously for a stay with my family. I just completed a stay with a large group here and I felt compelled to write another review regarding this hotels group sales department. Phenomenal!!!! Heather Ryan and Lisa Nguyen are astonishing in the feats they can do to accommodate you and your group.  Always complete professionalism, always warm always caring and always "no problem".  I feel as if I am a friend, these women took such personal care and attention of me and our group, it is simply unprecedented. IF YOU HAVE A GROUP FOR DISNEYLAND OR AN EVENT AT THE CONVENTION CENTER- CALL THEM!!! Honestly, you won't believe the level of care and concern they take and no detail is overlooked, just fantastic!!!

Great location, within walking distance to Disneyland and the hotel itself is a newer hotel that was very clean with a good breakfast.  The parking was a little challenging at times, but it is just about everywhere in Anaheim.  It was nice that the hotel was located right next to a CVS Pharmacy with a little shop there for all the daily needs (like milk, soda, snacks, etc.).  We enjoyed the stay here and will look to stay again next time we are in So. Cal.

My husband and I stayed here for our wondercon and disney vacation time. When I checked in I was told that they upgraded my suite due to a shortage which was okay with me because it didn't cost us extra. After we checked in we parked our car in their lot which is located on the right of the lobby underneath the hotel you have to swipe your room card every time you go in to park. We were able to find parking which was good but just an FYI it can get pretty packed in the lot so if you don't find parking you will need to valet your car so we were pretty lucky. Once we got to our room we saw that we were upgraded to the Kids suite which had bunkbeds a sofa 2 TVS and 2 Queen beds with a very nice bathroom stand up shower nicely upgraded modern feel. This suite was very big and it's

We recently spent 5 nights for an event at the convention center, yes the location is terrific, but the staff was extraordinary.    We had a big group and the experience was flawless.    Brittany should receive a service award for all she did to ensure the group was happy.  She was professional and helpful working through the room assignments and dealing with all our overnight packages and guest requests.  Thank you to the management and the entire staff.  You helped make our convention easier and better.

Can't get much closer to the main entrance or Downtown Disney.  But also has a CVS right next door, so snacks, drinks, and a few needed items were easy to obtain.  Parking was a little hectic at times and didn't like the way the valet guys parked cars at the base of the entrance, making it difficult to enter/exit.  Great breakfast!!!  Watched fireworks from the pool on top.  Would return if in Anaheim again for Disneyland.

I spent 2 months with my family. It was cool but the only thing that i didnt like is that u r obliged to rent minimum 3 months. So we stayed 2 months and we paid for 3.u have to clean your own app and order food its not a hotel finally .all in all it was a nice .

I came here with my husband and 4 kids (mostly all teens).  The staff were all very friendly and helpful but I found the breakfast to be lacking.  We always try to get a suite because having so many kids, we need more room.  We had the kids suite with the bunk beds.  We were still pretty cramped and the rooms are not divided by walls so I don't think it can be truly categorized as a suite.  It was very clean and the staff helped us with anything we needed.  I should also say that the valet staff went out of their way to be helpful, which I appreciated.  They always welcomed us back to the hotel each night, which was very pleasant.  I've stayed at other hotels who had better food in the morning though.  Another pro of this hotel is that it's right above the CVS pharmacy, so if
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. We are happy you found our staff to be helpful and friendly and that the location of our property was convenient for your family trip.  The majority of our hotel's suites are studios which means they do not have a door for separation but rather a wall for semi privacy.  We are sorry to hear the suite was on the small side for you and your teenage children to share and we appreciate your comments in regards to this.  We understand these rooms are very popular with families that have young children and age and size can definitely affect an accommodation experience.  Our complimentary breakfast buffet is a Springhill Suites standard which we are very happy to be able to provide for our guests during their stay.  We always strive to improve our buffet and its food variety and quality and we thank you for the feedback that we can take back to our breakfast team. We hope to be given another opportunity to see you and your family when you return to the Anaheim Resort!

Summary: Very happy with our choice to stay here while going to Disneyland/ California Adventure. The location is about 10 minutes walk from the DL. We had a king suite and it was very spacious, beds were comfortable  and it has built in USB wall chargers. Room includes a fridge, coffee maker, and microwave. Lots of place for storage   and the rooms are very modern and clean. There is a nice pool and patio on the roof a great viewing spot for the Disneyland Fireworks. The insulation was ok if everything was quiet. We had the room facing Harbor blvd, right by the bus stop sign so early in the morning the noise was a bit annoying BUT then since we were there for vacation, I usually got up early anyway  There is a 24 hour CVS in the same building it  came in handy for my diet coke, water,

Stayed here for 4 nights to take our kids to Disneyland. The hotel was lovely, extremely clean, staff were great and the location was fantastic. A short stroll to get to Disneyland. Plenty of food choices within walking distance of the hotel. Free breakfast was awesome.....Great selection.  Would definitely stay again and would highly recommend this hotel to others who need to be in close proximity to Disneyland

All staff were friendly, made local suggestions for meals, breakfast buffet was top notch, several restaurants in the area deliver right to your hotel room, pool area was great, VERY family oriented place. Spectacular view of Disneyland fireworks. Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: "Awesome location for Disneyland visitors!" I liked it!
Summary: Close enough to walk to Disneyland. New and clean rooms. Pool and Gym on the top floor/roof. Breakfast was fresh and not bad for free. Coffee Bean in the same building. There are many restaurants close by.  I would stay here again..

My husband & I (along with another couple) just spent the Presidents'/Valentine's weekend at the Springhill Suites & enjoyed our stay. The property is one block (a long one) away from Disneyland so it's very convenient, especially if you want to leave in the middle of the day to rest. Our room had a king size bed & a separate sitting area with a sofa bed. We saw other rooms that also had a bunk bed next to the sofa bed so you could fit at least 5-6 people in one room. Breakfast was included with a hot station along with cereal, pastries, oatmeal & fruit. It was also convenient to have a CVS right on the property. Parking is extra. We intend to stay at this property again!

We have stayed here a few times this past year.  The location is great, easy walking. They have free breakfast which is always a big seller with 3 kids. The downside, the walls are extremely thin apparently....we can always hear people all around us...to the point of being annoying and harder to sleep.  2nd beef is that they don't have down comforters....its like 2 sheets around a thin blanket...weird?  Most hotels around Dland are pretty subpar, so this isn't horrible but not my favorite.
Manager Response: Dear AngelaPaloAlto,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with feedback regarding your recent experience at our hotel. We are pleased to hear that you and your family are able to take advantage of our hotel's convenient location next to Disneyland as well as the complimentary breakfast buffet we serve each morning.  However, please accept our sincere apology for any noise disturbances you have encountered during your past stays. We strive to provide each guest with a quiet and relaxing experience and regret that we have not met your expectations. Should you ever encounter a noise disturbance during your stay, please do not hesitate to contact us directly so that we may address your concern and have the situation corrected immediately.   Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to see you again soon.   Sincerely, Raul Escobedo Operations Manager

Summary: Modern suites in a great location. Attended a trade show at the Anaheim Convention Center and it was only a few minute walk away. Lots of restaurants nearby to choose from.  Good free breakfast in the morning.

Convenient location for walking to Disneyland.  Room accommodations are new/modern, but nothing special.  We were in a larger room (kids suite) which was basically one big rectangle with a bathroom in the middle.  This was far from a resort experience, but it was clean and convenient.  If I had been traveling with a smaller group, I probably would have stayed somewhere else, but it worked great for a party of seven.  Parking is by valet only, as there's no real parking available at the property.
Manager Response: Dear John M,  Thank you for staying with us and for providing us with details of your recent experience. We are glad to hear that you and your party enjoyed our convenient location near Disneyland as well as the spacious accommodations of the Kid's Suite. The Kid's Suite is one of the hotel's largest room types that can comfortably sleep up to 7 guests; and in this case seems like it worked out perfect for you!
