Should we have another opportunity to welcome you back to the hotel in the future, please do not hesitate to ask us about your Self-Parking options. Although we provide Valet service at no additional charge we still offer our guest Self-Parking should they prefer to park their own vehicles.   Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Raul E.  Operations Manager

Summary: Just stayed here for a convention. Great proximity to the Arena and to the convention center. We also had meetings in the Hilton and Marriott Hotels and still just a short walk. Also nice to have a CVS store under the hotel for anything you may have forgotten. We had a party at Disney on the last night and I walked home rather than waiting for the bus and it was an easy and pleasant walk. Nice wide sidewalks all well lit.   Lots of families and kids in this hotel but I never heard noise in my room or felt crowded or had to wait in line at the breakfast. Food was good and changed slightly each day.   Warning: The convention center is expanding right next door so try to get a room on the other end over the CVS. Also they have closed of the parking lot and back way to the

I really enjoyed my stay at the SpringHill Suites.  When we checked in, they upgraded us for free to a room with bunk beds and 2 queen beds.  The entire staff was very friendly and helpful.  We had a room on the 5th floor and although the view was of the back of CA Adventure, we still had a pretty view of the snow covered mountains (if it was clear).  The free breakfast was pretty good too.  Eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, waffles, cereal, oatmeal, breads, juice, yogurt, etc.  The hotel is about 2 blocks from Disneyland.  We got the ART bus pass but most of the time it was just easier to walk.  Beds were very comfortable and lots of pillows!  CVS is right next door and 7-11 across the street.  Lots of parking.

Summary Heading: A nice modern hotel very good location for the Anaheim Convention Center.
Summary: I stayed at SpringHill Suites by Marriott for 5 nights during the NAMM Show in January 2016.  The Hotel is modern and clean and well equipped and the buffet breakfast was pretty good.  There is also a small bar and lounge area.  In-room wifi / internet access was reliable throughout my stay and was fast enough. I was in a Queen Studio room that had 2 queen beds and en-suite shower / WC.  It was a nice size and was very comfortable.  I paid $1,642 for the 5 nights inclusive of Tax and Fee's (US$328 / night = GB£226 / night) which is a bit expensive but then it was during a busy trade show.  One thing that was not included in the room rate was Car Parking, this was an extra $20 a night - This is no on as I think when you are paying $328 a night you should be able to park your car

Just one night stop in California before heading home, we stay at Springhill Suites near the Disney Land. It was a great hotel, not big but very sufficient.  The thing is I like hotel with good room, and this hotel was filing up my expectation. it was at the end of my business trip in the USA.   Room was so spacious, all the details of the service there. Bathroom was sufficient, very clean. Power outlet everywhere, so it is convenient to charge all your electronic devices.  There is CVS nearby, so if you need something you can just take a walk outside.   Very great hotels, I was very satisfied. Will stay again in the future.

Summary Heading: clean, spacious, great place for family of 5
Summary: My new favorite place to stay when going to Disneyland.  Theme park is about a 10 minute walk.  This hotel is clean and well maintained.  Drug store located nearby for sundries/necessities.  I like this hotel because of the space, close location to Disneyland and service.  Our family would stay here again.  We stayed in a kids suite with bunk bed and 2 queens.  Queen bed separated a bit from the bunk beds.  We also enjoyed the rooftop pool and free warm breakfast.  Overall- this hotel is probably the best place in terms of value, access to park and cleanliness.

We checked into the Springhill Suites/Anaheim Convention Center on 12/19/15 for 7 nights.  Picked this hotel for it's proximity to Disneyland.  Overall we had a great experience here.  We did have to ask for extra towels each day as there were 4 adults and 1 child in our suite.  We chose a 2 queen suite with sofa/bed, but they do have suites with bunkbeds. For convience there were several places to eat within a 5 min. walk as well as a CVS  just around the corner. It was about a 15 min walk to Disneyland/California Adventure which is very doable.  Our 8 year old grandson never complained about the walk.  We had rain one day of our stay and mostly sunny weather the rest of our trip.  This hotel does have a breakfast every morning...eggs, bacon or sausage, cereal, fruit,

New, loved the room layout with bunk beds that were twin sized and could sleep an adult (even though it's called a "kids suite"). There is only 1 bathroom, which could be an issue if you put in the maximum 7 people. Biggest issue for us: there was a huge air vent that blew straight out over one of the Queen beds. If it wasn't for the air vent blowing over one of the beds we would have returned here but that was miserable for the person in that bed. They offer a free breakfast- budget for your own breakfast, this one is awful. The pool on the rooftop looked beautiful though we didn't swim, unfortunately there is no hot tub. And this sounds weird but bring your sunglasses for checking in, there is this huge screen directly behind the check in desk and I had to shield my eyes the

My husband and I stayed here, without children, for an adult trip to Disneyland.  For the price, we were completely satisfied.  Our spacious room (477), located on the SE corner of the building, away from Katella, was clean and quiet.  The room is furnished with a refrigerator roughly a yard high and a microwave.  With a CVS located on the ground floor of the hotel site, if we wanted to we could have obtained simple groceries to reheat in the room to save money.  The breakfast was neither anything to glow nor complain about; I mostly eat oatmeal anyway and my husband is happy with any kind of sausage.  The distance from the hotel was an easy walk, but not so close that you would consider running back to get a jacket, etc.  We think SpringHill Suites exceeds what its competition

Looks new and a great hotel. But right on the corner of a major intersection.  People everywhere, buses coming and going, police sirens. Reminded me of Las Vegas. Get a room facing away from the street and you will be fine. I stayed on the top floor under the mechanical equipment drumming all night. Great if you like white noise. Bring the ear plugs and you will be fine

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel, Great Service from Front Desk Mgr. Lisa
Summary: Love the rooms here, very big, modern and CLEAN.  Located in walking distance to Disney (actually out of East windows you are across the street from CarsLand.)  I had a problem with my room being located underneath the gym on the 5th floor and the front desk staff (Lisa) was amazing, she handled the situation really well and turned what could have been a mess into a good experience for me and my family.

Stayed for 2 nights with our 2 older teenage daughters. We had a mixed experience at this hotel.  On the plus side, the room was a reasonable size, clean,  had a good sized bathroom, had block out curtains, double glazed windows, comfy beds and had 2 tvs. There were, however, many more negatives.  It was as if a herd of elephants were staying on the floor above. Why use timber framing in a new hotel? (Is this a California thing?) Noisy aircon directs air directly at the bed next to the window. No hand shower and a drooping temp control handle which led to the water temp increasing constantly. Really poor quality mattress on the new sofa bed.  On the first morning the breakfast area was a pigsty! It was chaotic both mornings. (This is definitely not a business hotel.)  $15 US per
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the size and layout of the room and that you found your beds to be comfortable.  Please accept our apologies in regards to the poor experience you had due to the noise from the guests above you.  As a hotel that caters to families heading to the Disneyland Resort, we do have insulation throughout the rooms and we actually do not get noise complaints often between guest rooms.  Please never hesitate to speak with the front desk should your travels be negatively affected by noise such as this.  We do take these issues very seriously and we do ask that our guests be considerate to those around them and below them.  We are also sorry to find that there were also some maintenance issues in the room regarding the loose shower handle.  Again, we sincerely apologize and have informed the engineering staff so that it may be remedied as soon as possible. During our busy leisure season our complimentary breakfast buffet area can get heavily impacted especially towards the end of the buffet hours.  Most businessmen and guests that head down earlier in the morning tend to experience the buffet in a quieter setting which we attempt to inform our guests at check-in so those that may not welcome the morning bustle can avoid it by heading down a little bit earlier.  I will make sure to remind the front desk staff to inform our guests of this in case this was not mentioned at your check-in. Because of our close proximity to the resort and the impact of parking in the general area, hotels within the Anaheim Resort do charge for parking.  Our parking is $14 a night plus tax and in comparison to the surrounding properties within walking distance to Disneyland and the convention center, we are actually on the lower end of the parking fee spectrum.  If you were misinformed in any way by your travel agent or a call center, we apologize.  We attempt to do our best to be as up front as possible with the parking fee on our websites, with their call center and at the front desk. Again, thank you so much for your review of our property and your feedback.  We do appreciate your comments as they help us improve our service which allows us to create a better guest experience.  Lisa Dickinson Operations Supervisor

Summary: We were happy with our room and the location, which is across the street from California Adventure on the Car's Land side. Our room had a limited view of the Tower of Terror but the fireworks were canceled, so I am not sure if the 4th floor rooms have a decent view? We also liked the pool deck and fitness center. However, there are a couple of items that could be improved. The towels were very rough and the toilet paper was extremely thin. Also, I recommend skipping the free breakfast. The quality is probably the worst I have ever experienced. Just pay for a decent breakfast somewhere else.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our property.  We are happy you enjoyed your room and the location of our hotel and that you were able to use our facilities like the fitness room and the pool deck.  Some of the rooms can have obstructed views of the fireworks because of the palm trees and Disneyland rides, however our pool deck has a wonderful vantage of the firework show at night which is available to all of our guests.  We apologize if you found some of the room amenities to be less than satisfactory. We received our toiletries from Marriott approved vendors so we will definitely pass on your comments to our purchasing managers. Our complimentary breakfast buffet is a signature standard of the Springhill brand and we welcome all feedback especially if there are other buffet setups that may be preferred. We do take these suggestions and reviews into consideration and we would like to once again thank you for sharing your thoughts. We always look for the chance to improve and to welcome you back in the future should your travels bring you our way again.  Lisa Dickinson Operations Supervisor

Summary: The title says it all.  The property is situated literally in the backyard of the California Adventure.  From the fifth floor outdoor pool/patio, you can see the nightly fireworks and can see over the Radiator Springs facade into Paradise Pier.  Even if you are leisurely walker, you can be at the main entrance to Disneyland/California Adventure in about 10 minutes on foot.  For those not familiar with the layout of Disneyland, you need to walk around the California Adventure to the entrance as the gates to the two parks face each other in a central promenade.  If you don't want to walk, the ART stops on the opposite corner of the hotel going to disneyland, and routes 1 & 3 drop off right in front of the hotel coming back.  It is $3 each way, but ART also sells discounted daily

Summary Heading: Best family hotel in the area minus no bath tubs
Summary: I have stayed in nearly a dozen hotels at Disneyland including all three Disney properties and the springhill suites at the convention centre is the best family friendly hotel we have stayed at.   The rooms are a really good size with two tvs and plenty of space for a family of 4-6 people. I liked that there was a good size fridge for the fresh food I bought at the CVS pharmacy below the hotel.  The buffet breakfast could use some improvement, more healthier selections such as more fruit and organic yoghurt would be preferred.   The hotel is within easy walking distance, only about a mile from the parks.   We used the LAX to Disney shuttle and found it easier than renting a car as we were only visiting Disney. It is the first pick up on the way back to the airport so we had to

Our new favorite in Anaheim. We were treated like royalty. We opened our curtains, sat on the bed and enjoyed Disneylands fireworks. They also offer rooftop viewing as well where you can enjoy the fireworks from the pool, couches or tables. There is a laundry facility, free breakfast, coffee all day, CVS and Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf on site. Beat of all....Disneyland is right across the street. Very impressed, already going back next month!

We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland, breakfast and the availability of bunk beds for our two kids.  We were not disappointed!  The hotel is newer and therefore the rooms are in good condition.  We had a bunk suite which was perfect for our family.  The rooftop deck is good for a swim or for viewing the Disneyland fireworks.  The morning breakfast is very busy.  This is to be expected since this is a hotel geared towards families.  Come early and be patient and you shouldn't have many issues.  The food is adequate and the staff do an adequate job of keeping up.  Nothing to rave over here, just nice to have some food prepared for you before heading to Disneyland for the day at no additional cost - which can be significant for a family.

Our room was exactly what we wanted.  We stayed in a Suite on the North side of the building.  There was a set of bunks, a kids work desk with 2 comfy stools for them, and a tv on this side of the room.  The middle of the room had the bathroom and a desk with the fridge, microwave and glasses in it.  The other side of the room had 2 queen sized beds.  The beds were all very comfortable with different pillow types to choose from.  Our room was cleaned nicely every day and the housecleaners made a towel swan for us which the kids loved.  The only thing more the room could have used was a bathtub. After a looooong day of walking the kids would have prefered to relax in a tub than a quick stand up shower.  And this would have been good to help soak achy feet. The gym was a nice

Good place to stay for the convention center, Disneyland, and California Adventures.  In walking distance of theme parts or ART transportation close by for parks, shopping and exploring.  Good breakfast and comfortable/clean rooms.  Big coach for resting or for kids to sleep in room.  Area on 5th floor with pool and seating for watching the fireworks every night from Disney.  Would stay here again.

Good location to hit Disneyland (ok, not a perfect location but the walk isn't too bad, and if you're already walking 10 miles a day in the parks what's another .5 mile each way?).  Kids' suite was a perfect fit and had park views.  The pool was small and rooftop, great for viewing fireworks.  No hottub.  Be aware that the advertised sofabed is a twin, not a full.  Breakfast was typical fare.  24 hour CVS downstairs is a great amenity.

Summary Heading: SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center - Great Experience
Summary: ARRIVAL:  I checked in the day before using the mobile app - it was awesome and easy. Upon arrival we were greeted by warm and friendly front desk staff who provided us with plenty of information regarding our stay.  LOCATION:  This hotel does not provide shuttle service, which we already knew. We were renting a car; so it didn't matter. From the John Wayne airport our drive was 40 minutes, but we also arrived in the middle of rush hour. This hotel is located on the corner of Katella and South Harbor. The walk to Disney parks was roughly 5 minutes, if that (we are brisk walkers). To get to a restaurant (since there isn't one on-site), one merely has to walk across the street to the strip mall across the corner, or walk 5 minutes east on Katella. There are several dining options

I've stayed at many hotel all over the world, and had some outstanding service at marmot, but this is one that was truly ok. Let start with positive, nice hotel and new , valet staff was amazing.  But then you go to the room, there nice but nothing great, if you want to sleep bring earplugs. Because no matter were you stay you will hear the traffic. The website said there soundproof windows but that can't be true. We did call down , and speak with front desk about the issues with noise and the rhinos up above us. But nothing was done. I went down second time on our last night front desk person seemed like they had other issues to deal with didn't have time .   I would not recommend this hotel to friends or family or anyone at that.   There quite a few quality marriots in area .
Manager Response: Dear MattSuper,  Thank you for choosing the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center during your recent trip to Anaheim. We are glad to hear that our Valet team was friendly and helpful during your stay.   But please accept our sincere apology for the external noise issues you encountered as well as the concerns you raised regarding the noise disturbances caused by other guests. Please be assured that we take matters such as this very seriously and will use this as a learning opportunity to ensure that we resolve such concerns immediately in order to provide each guest with an enjoyable stay.   Thank you again for your time and feedback.  Sincerely, Raul E.  Operations Manager

Summary: I took my family to Disneyland for the first time and we stayed at the Marriott. When unloading the van I left an interior light on (for 3 days). when it was time to pack up I discovered my mistake. Brittany was working the front desk and she called Mike from engineering to come and help. Mike brought his personal car around and gave me a boost so we could get on the road. Mike and Brittany were very helpful and very friendly. My overall stay at the hotel was great as well, this personal extra service really made my stay fantastic. Thank you Mike & Brittany

I had the 2 bedroom suite with sofabed for the 3 of us. The room was very big, nice and clean. Also place is close to Disneyland, CVS and to several resturants.  I would recommend this place to others.

The hotel is on the corner of the Disney complex, which means it is is .7 miles to the park, which is a long way after a day at the park.  There is no shuttle option.  Rates do not include a $14 parking charge each day... You're almost better off staying farther away at a cheaper location and driving to Disney and parking.  Breakfast was scrambled eggs everyday with either sausage or ham... Strangely, the eggs were hard. I'm not sure what produces hard scrambled eggs ...perhaps overcoming/over warming.  Also a a available was a lot of starch: bread, bagels, muffins, waffles, and cereal.  Brown bananas and mealy apples sometimes made an appearance.  The hotel itself is new, meaning things were in good condition, although the elevators already had a funky smell.  They perhaps want
Manager Response: Dear laul0005,  Thank you for staying with us at the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. We truly appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts regarding your stay. We take all feedback seriously, and sincerely regret that we did not meet your expectations. Please accept our apology for the dissatisfaction you had with the hotel's proximity to Disneyland, breakfast buffet, your reservation requests, and the mattress in your guest room. Rest assured that the issues you encountered are being investigated by our team leaders so that we may work to make sure that we do better in the future.   However, one thing to note for a future stay is that although our hotel does not offer a shuttle, we do offer our guests the opportunity to purchase Day Passes for the Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART) shuttle which operates within The Anaheim Resort District. This transportation system makes several stops along the Anaheim Resort area, including Disneyland, meaning our guests can catch a ride back to the hotel after a long day at the theme park.   Thank you again for your time, business, and feedback as we look forward to every opportunity that we may have to improve.  Sincerely, Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary: We were here visiting Disneyland Park & stayed here. We had 2 rooms - one king for me & a family room( 2 queens - bunk beds & a pull out couch) for my sons family. This hotel is only a couple of blocks away - an easy walk to Disneyland. It's a newer hotel, with GREAT comfortable rooms. You get free big breakfast - a fridge & microwave in your room & a seperate living area, with 2 big screen TV's. I enjoyed staying at this hotel - it was clean - friendly & I got great sleep.

Hotel is modern and rooms are of a good size. Hotel is walking distance to Disneyland. Lounge area with large TV was great for kids. Beds were very comfortable. Breakfast included in price was OK and there was engough variety that should satisfy most guests. Staff were pleasent. Mike at reception stood out for his attention and help at checkin. There is a CVS Pharmacy and convenience store in the building that have a good range of supplies, ie snacks, drinks, pharmecuticles etc. A good place to eat that is nearby is the Cheescake Factory, it has all types of food on the menu,  not only cheesecake as the name suggests. The pizza place across the road on corner was also good value and good quality food. Excellent laundry with 3 large washing machine and 3 large dryers. Pool not

Located about a 12-15 minute walk to the entrance to Disneyland/California Adventure made this a convenient location.  The room was spacious and clean, the bed comfortable.  Breakfast was as expected for a hotel buffet breakfast.  The mornings when we were up and getting ready to visit the parks the breakfast area was moderately busy.  The day we were up a bit later we found the breakfast area to be very busy, however, food was always available.  Our room was quiet, even though we were on the street side - 3rd floor may have helped.  Overall, a good value compared to other hotels we've stayed at in the area.

We stayed here with the family last week, children, parents and grandparents. Close enough that we walked each way each day, 20 minutes to Disneyland. Large rooms, morning breakfast and a pool heated on the roof.   The pool is a little small but that is not why we were there. The breakfast was adequate but lacked much variety. It was ample enough to get you going in the morning. The valet service was great, maid service as perfect. If you are going to come to this city, this is a great location. Close to the convention center, Angels stadium and Disney.

Positives  Location was great. Walk to Disneyland in 15 min.   Breakfast included. Wifi included.   Great amenities. CVS next door. Coffee Bean next door. Delivery restaurants are close.   Room was large. Stayed in a family room and the kids loved the bunk beds.   Everything is still new and looks that way.   Negatives We stayed 4 nights and our room was never made up before 4pm. I even asked on the last night if it could be made up before 1pm and still not done. This was a huge problem. After a full morning at Disneyland you just want to come back to a cool, clean room. Since we always caught housekeeping before, or as they were cleaning, we never got a complete clean. Management should reconsider how they assign housekeeping. This issue may make me reconsider my options in the
Manager Response: Dear Matthew Q,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts and feedback regarding your recent stay at our hotel. We are extremely glad to hear that you were able to take advantage of the hotel's premium location next to Disneyland while still enjoying the amenities our hotel had to offer you during your stay. However, I do sincerely apologize that our Housekeeping services failed to meet or exceed your expectations. I certainly understand the frustration you must have felt when returning to the hotel after a long morning at Disneyland and discovering that your guest room had not yet been serviced. Rest assured, we will use this as a learning opportunity in order to continue to improve our Housekeeping services. Your time, business, and feedback are greatly appreciated.   Sincerely, Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary: Hotel was clean nice big rooms, plenty of space the two TV's were great to have. Service was wonderful, close enough to Disney short 10-15 minute walk, free breakfast was nice lots of selections. We would stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.  We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed the two TV's that are available in all of our suites and that the room had plenty of space for you and your family. As part of the Springhill Suites brand, we do serve the complimentary breakfast buffet and we are glad to find you enjoyed the variety of the selection it offers. Since the Disneyland Resort is only a 1/2 mile from the property, our guests do prefer the short walk to the parks. Again, thank you for your wonderful comments and we do hope to welcome you back in the future!  ~Lisa Dickinson~ Operations Supervisor

Summary: Loved the layout of the kids suite. Found all the staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good. The rooftop pool was small but very clean with plenty of comfortable loungers and seating. The roof has the best view of the Disney fireworks. Our room had a fireworks view too but we preferred to sit outside and enjoy them. Walking distance to Disneyland. Very clean and modern.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful comments.  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  Our rooftop pool is very popular thanks to the large viewing deck that gives our guests an unobstructed view of the fireworks at night.  Although we do get requests for rooms that face the park, it is definitely more enjoyable to view it outside under the open night sky from the viewing deck.  We are also happy you found the rooms and staff to be accommodating and hope to see you in the future when your travels bring you back our way again!  ~Lisa Dickinson~ Operations Supervisor

Summary: This Springhill Suites is located in great location for convention and Disney activities  The rooms are well done and well maintained. The staff are well trained, friendly and helpful for finding local attractions. It's a good family value.

They were all very nice. Everything was very clean. The suites are very big and we loved having 2 TVs. There breakfast was great   Always plenty of food to choose from.  Not very far walk to Disneyland.  It was a a nice stay.  The staff were very helpful.  I would stay again

Summary Heading: Mediocre; decent rooms but lack of customer service will make it a miserable stay
Summary: My recent visit to this hotel lacked in many areas. I wanted to provide a reasonable review of your facility now that I've seen how staff and corporate have responded.    I chose this location for our January 2015 visit based off the location to the pArks and the fact that it was a Marriott. I hold Marriott to a higher standard than most hotels solely based on the name. It upholds a standard. It's a hotel, not a motel.   Our first trip there was full of errors and mistakes. However the operations manager asked us to try again.  So we stayed for our recent week trip. This trip was full of issues. Including my mom being accused of lying, when I read her email she stated the truth and your staff looked into more information than necessary.   Here goes what I hope is a reasonable

We stayed here when our daughters and daughter-in-law participated in the Disney Half-Marathon on Labor Day Weekend.  I reserved the rooms using Marriott points.  My daughters arrived earlier that we did and had no problem checking in for us (I called ahead to the hotel). We had to rooms, located adjacent to each other.  The rooms themselves were very good.  Whereas other SpringHill Suites properties usually have only a divider panel separating the living area from the beds, this one uses the bathroom to separate the areas.  To us, this was a preferred layout.  The rooms are well-furnished, with two double beds, a closet, dresser, two TVs, a desk and a convertible sofa.  The beds were very comfortable.  The bathroom has a full bath, with plenty of towels and toiletries.  There
Manager Response: Dear Landlubber_9354,   Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We're glad to hear that you enjoy the layout of the rooms and our complementary breakfast buffet.   Please accept my apology for the parking issues you encounter during your stay. Due to our limited number of parking spaces, we do offer a 24-hour valet service at no additional charge until the parking complex completes next year. On days when our parking garages run low on available spaces, Valet will double park cars to ensure each guest vehicle parked safely in our garages. Please do not hesitate to let our valet staff know that they can move the vehicle right away. Please rest assure your feedback have been shared with the valet teams in an effort to improve our services.   Hopefully we will have another opportunity in the future to welcome you back to the hotel and better your experience with us.   Sincerely,  Lisa Dickinson Operations Supervisor

Summary: I stayed here for runDisney weekend. 10 min walk to parks. CVS in the building which nice to get snacks, water, essentials. Grey Line shuttle from LAX stops right outside the door.   Rooms were clean. There was not a bathtub - only a shower and upholstery on couch was torn. Rooms on the Harbor Ave side of the building are noisy from the street.   Breakfast was varied and plentiful. They put out small breakfast for runners at 4 AM which was great!  The price was great value. My room had King and pull out couch. Others had Queens an pullouts. Great for families.

This location is centrally located to the Disneyland Resort, the Anaheim Convention Center, the Anaheim Garden Walk and a short distance from Angel Stadium.  The rooms were spacious with a separate living space and sleeping area, each with its own TV.  The bathroom was large and spacious but there was not place in the shower to put your soap other than on the floor.  The bathroom door is a sliding door which makes it semi-private as it has gaps.  The flaw in the room were the sheets for the fold out sofa.  They were stored in a zipper bag in the closet but when we went to put them on the bed we noticed they were dirty and had to call for clean sheets.  The parking is challenging.  In the evening the valet stacks the cars in the aisle and blocks cars in the parking spaces.  Since

Summary Heading: Was expecting more but it adequqtely did the job!
Summary: The rooms were spacious, but the towels offered to guests were hit-or-miss.  There were some that were nice & fluffy, but most of the towels in our room were consistently dingy, w/ a couple of them having stains.  The hotel needs to upgrade their laundering equipment PRONTO.  Workmanship in the rooms was also lacking.  Room 531 had the sliding bathroom door sticking & a small hole in the wall next to the electrical outlet near the bunk bed.  I was eyeing this property as it was being built (frequent visitor to DL), but I am disappointed that such a new facility is already looking run-down (bathroom was dingy-looking as well).  The facility OVERALL was nice.  The lobby area was clean & maintained & even though we didn't use it during our stay, the top-floor pool deck had a nice
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our property and for reaching out to us in regards to areas we may improve upon.  We appreciate all of the feedback in relation to your issues with housekeeping and the breakfast buffet.  We have shared your comments with the departments so that we may learn and improve upon our service.  The hotel does have safety deposit boxes at the front desk for our guests to rent out complimentary and are available 24/7. We apologize if you were not made aware during your stay.  We no longer have the hot waffle irons due to safety issues with too many small children but we are always willing to review the possibility of bringing them back. We are so glad to hear that the staff made a positive impact on your experience at our property and although you are Hyatt program members, we would love to welcome you back to our property should your travels bring you back to Anaheim again!  Lisa Dickinson Operations Supervisor

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but a little far from disneyland.
Summary: This was a very nice hotel with a few negatives.  First let me say that we are used to staying right across the street from disneyland on Harbor Blvd so the walk was much closer.  Not that it's a very long walk, but after a long day at the park it can be tough to walk back, especially if you are pushing little ones in a stroller.  Also if you forget something in the room, going back can be a chore.  We asked about the shuttle, but the front desk recommended walking as the shuttle runs about every 20 minutes and it only takes less than 10 minutes to walk.  Also, walking to the park you can run into some weirdos as there is a CVS and small convenience store and 7-11 across the street where some of them seem to hang out.    As for the hotel, it was a much nicer hotel than any of

the family suite was so comfortable.  the location is also very convenient to all things.  We have stayed here twice and, although they do not have a hot tub, would stay here again for convenience and comfort! the decor is modern and cool also!!

Summary Heading: Great room and service, aging building
Summary: I stayed here for a few days to visit the Park and visit with friends. My room was on the top floor and I had a spectacular view of the Disney fireworks each night. That alone makes the room very cool. The room was clean and tidy. The only issue I experienced was an odd humming sound coming from the ceiling. It was probably an air conditioner or something. It wasn't too loud and was not always present.  It looked like they have some roof problems that they are working on. It happens, there were no roof issues in the room.  The staff were very friendly and were always happy to share information about the area.  I wasn't very impressed with the breakfast. The breads didn't seem fresh and the *enter meat item" were flavorless. But overall about as disappointing as most free

Summary Heading: A visit to the house of mouse
Summary: We stayed here as a family for 4 nights. We picked this hotel as it was new and walking distance to Disneyland. There is a ART shuttle stop at the hotel. The CVS is in the first floor of the hotel. The CVS was good sized and had everything you would need. You have to go around the building to get into the hotel. Parking looked very limited but we didn't have a car. There are a couple strip malls in walking distance with little cafes/restaurants. It was between 10-15 minutes to walk to the front entrance of Disneyland. It could be a long walk back with kids at night. The rooms were new and modern. My kids are 9 and 13 and liked them. There's not a lot of privacy in the suite and the bathroom door would wake everyone up if moved at night! The breakfast was normal variety. There

I can't rave about this place enough.  We had a total of 3 rooms for 3 nights.  My kids loved the family suite...we have 4 kids, and they were all ecstatic to each have their own bed!  The little ones loved the bunk beds, and the teenagers were thrilled to have a big, comfy queen bed to themselves.  My parents got a corner room right over the CVS that was HUGE.  My husband and I had a king suite as well that wasn't as big as theirs, but it still was spacious and very clean and comfortable.  The hotel is walking distance to the parks, (15 minutes or so).  This was great in the morning, but by the end of the night we were exhausted and took an Uber back.  Don't mess with self part...valet is the same price.  It's $16 or so a night, but you are going to pay that at any hotel so

Summary Heading: Great location for a clean, friendly, family hotel!
Summary: I took my wife and two kids (one tween and one teenager) here for two nights in mid-August and had a fantastic stay! The lobby is contemporary and the rooms were very clean and quiet (surprisingly!). We had room 512 which was near the entrance to the pool and fitness room. It was nice to have easy access to the rooftop deck where my wife and I spent a couple of nights sipping wine and champagne to wind down after two crazy days at the parks. The hotel is conveniently located near a lot of restaurants and has easy access to the freeway. Disneyland and California Adventure are a 5-10 minute walk away. The CVS pharmacy in the same building is a bonus for snacks, water, sunscreen and other miscellaneous travel purchases! Lastly, do the valet parking. It's $14 per day which isn't too

They are within walking distance of DisneyLand, so have a lot of families as guests.  The staff was friendly and helpful and incredibly efficient during the chaos of "free breakfast when families are involved".  You can watch the DisneyLand fireworks from the roof, and 2 of 3 nights they were canceled due to high winds.  They sent someone up to let us all know, which I really appreciated.

We like this hotel because it is clean, big and good value for family going to Disneyland. We book 5 nights for kid suite but have to stay first night at smaller room because of overbook. However they give 50 pct off for the first night and move us back to kid suite next day. Breakfast is free but crowded as expected. Laundry room at fifth floor is very useful. There is a small pool and small gym at the roof top where you can watch Disney firework every night. I wish the hotel provides a luggage man or bell boy who can help family traveller moving luggage.

Summary Heading: Nice and close to Disneyland but BE WARNED!
Summary: The hotel location is walking distance to Disneyland entrance (about 20mins with strollers and red lights).   The FREE breakfast is good, changes daily so some days better than others depending on the type of protein served (sausage patty, ham, bacon) and the stale powderiness of the waffles. Can't complain about free food when it's a quick bite before going to the parks!  Parking maybe a hassle (underground) but the fact that it's $14/day for either self-parking/valet, we chose to valet (may have to wait sometimes due to valet cars double parked and needing to be moved but if you're not in a hurry why not use the service - other hotels charge 2-3x that).  Now for the reason why I only gave a rating of 3. First off the Kid suite was good for our kids but the bedding on 1 of the
Manager Response: Dear Carsan L, Thank you for taking the time to provide us with feedback regarding your recent stay. I sincerely apologized for the negative experiences you had with your room and housekeeping. I certainly understand the frustration you must have felt regarding the miscommunication with housekeeping and the cleanliness.  I apologized that the rooms failed to meet your expectation and the noise issue you have experience . We have address your concerns to the team in order to use this opportunity to improve our rooms and services.   Thank you again for your feedback and hopefully we will have another opportunity in the future to welcome you back to our property.

Summary: We recently stayed here during July for the three nights.  Rooms are very clean. but the setup in the Kids Bunk room needs to be addressed.  The hotel should have a slide partition in between the kids room and Bathroom/ Bedroom areas.  Parking was a major issue as you needed to find valet to move double parked cars.  The breakfast area was allways a zoo, which I can understand with the summer family crowd, but i never saw staff actively cleaning the mess from the used tables. I went down to the buiffet at 9:01a and it was empty and not re-filled to 9:15 as the hotel suggests.  If they could fix these issues it is a great place as it is only 10m walk to front gate and has 24 hour CVS below with foiod/wine etc..

WOW. Nothing but good things to say about this place. Awesome breakfast, awesome front desk staff and a great location within walking distance of Disneyland. Sure you'll pay a little more than the older hotels but this place is less than 2 years old and still looks new. The pool on the roof is a little bit on the small side but hey, it's on the roof. This place has it all........

The room was very clean and accommodating on the other hand the pool and PARKING were much to be desired.   The help at the front desk was amazing and very helpful. The rooms were clean and I had read about an allergic reaction to possible detergent to the sheets, well now I know why I can't stop sneezing for the last 10 hours!!!  Forget about the parking, it was horrible. Forget about finding an easy way to park your car!!! The parking capability was at a bear minimum for capacity of vehicles at the property. The swimming was more like a kiddie pool not a swimming pool.  Oh the breakfast, there was around 300 kids at the buffet and they close at 9am. Why would you close the buffet that early when kids and parents come in from Disneyland at midnight? Again overall the property
Manager Response: Dear Scott W,  Thank you for taking the time to review out hotel.  I am pleased that you were happy with our staff service and with the cleanliness of the hotel.  I am sorry that you were displeased with your stay overall.  First, I would like to take a moment to address your concerns about our linens by giving you a little background on our linens and the detergents used to clean them, as reports of this type are rare.  Please be assured that we use the Marriott brand specified linens and that our laundry solutions are commonly used in hotels and come from Marriott's main supplier whose technicians regularly service, test and calibrate the equipment.  I would encourage you to report adverse reactions to anything in our facilities right away so that we can properly investigate and determine the root cause.  As to parking, we do have a limited number of spaces until the main parking garage for this complex is completed next year.  In the meantime, we are offering 24-hour valet service at no additional charge to make this process smoother and more efficient.  Finally, for the breakfast buffet, we do review both our offerings and hours of operation regularly.  We have made adjustments in the past and will undoubtedly do so again in the future based upon the needs of our guests.  On most weekdays for instance, we have found that the majority of guests come down to breakfast between 8:00-9:00, following the patterns of the theme parks, regardless of our posted hours.  We do, however, keep the buffet well -stocked for at least 15 minutes after closing to ensure that everyone has an opportunity to enjoy breakfast.  Thank you again for sharing your experience with us.     Regards,  Lucas Fiamengo General Manager

Summary: Booked two king rooms with a sofa sleeper. About a 10 min walk to Disneyland. 24 hour cvs next door. The rooms are clean but you can see the wear and tear of its first year. They offer a breakfast buffet with eggs, breakfast meat, oatmeal, breakfast pastries, cereal, yogurt and fruit.   The AC vent blows right in the direction of the bed and we woke up a little congested. The beds are relatively comfortable.  My son had a bit of an allergic reaction to the sheets. It's probably the detergent.   I'll definitely keep this hotel on my short list of places to stay near Disneyland.

Great stay. Nice location, about 10 minute walk to Disneyland. Staff was helpful and friendly. Asked for quite room. We were on the 5th floor, room faced away from the street. Very peaceful and quiet.

I recently stayed here for six nights with some friends and our children.  The room set up is perfect and spacious for five.  The price for the hotel was fair considering in Disney you are not in your room much.  The hotel is a safe and easy 5-10 walk to Disney.  As previously reported, the breakfast can be a bit hectic and the noise from the street can be distracting.  But all the hotels in the area are on the main streets.  There are nice restaurants (Roy's and Morton's) in the area and the CVS on the first floor is convenient.  Our girls enjoyed the pool and there is a nice sitting area to watch the fireworks on the top floor.

Summary Heading: Fresh new hotel with great location!
Summary: Even though a new hotel it showed lots of signs of wear and tear and wasn't cleaned properly but it was still very nicely decorated. The pool is very small but the deck has a great view. Expect to valet park and if your room is on the road side you will hear traffic at all hours of the night. The air conditioner is right over the bed so it gets a bit chilly during the night. The room keys never worked well. Drinks are very overpriced at the lounge.
Manager Response: Dear AKGRLS,  Thank you very much for taking the time to share your feedback.  I am pleased that you enjoyed the décor and the great view of the theme park/ fireworks from our rooftop deck.  Please accept my apology for the issues you experienced during your stay.  Being a newer hotel, we are still fine-tuning our product and staffing to better meet the needs of our guests.  We will investigate the air condition situation and the key system to look for patterns that can be addressed.  Even though these issues are not common and it is my hope that they were isolated incidents, we will work with the team to ensure that they do not negatively affect others. Your feedback will also be shared with the housekeeping team.  As this is out first summer season, we will be evaluating our performance so that we can better match our staffing to usage patterns of our amenities during this very busy time so that we can ensure a more consistently clean product.

Summary Heading: Great place for families; walk to Disney
Summary: We normally do not travel with children, but decided to take nieces and nephews on a trip to Disneyland.  This hotel was perfect; our room had 2 queens, a couch that pulled out into a twin, and bunk beds (sleeps 7).  The only problem w/ that many people, is everything related to the bathroom, is behind one closed door.  So, you could not have one person brushing their teeth while another showered, etc.  We did utilize the restrooms downstairs, which were also spotless clean.  The guest room attendants are magical, I can't believe how nice they made the room look, after having our messy group.  Cathy at the front desk was especially helpful and accommodating.

Room: Sparkling, new, well decorated and laid out Bathroom: Sparkling, new, big for a hotel near Disneyland Location: Can't beat being directly across form DL and walking distance to the entrances Breakfast: Gee, what a madhouse!! We didn't feel comfortable staying because of the chaos, but really there were no attendants around to clear tables or clean the buffet lines.  So we took our stuff to go.  Not sure what all is available since we took a few things and left. Parking: There is a charge to park, but valet is included and it felt safe to self park if need be.  Didn't use the pool or bar, but you're across the street from DL!!! Go there! We loved the hotel, and would definitely stay here again.

Was so convenient to disneyland ..... A 10-15 minute walk to the park.  Just above a CVS for things you forgot to pack, or to get snacks and drinks to put in the mini fridge in your room.  Has sitting area with a second tv and free breakfast..... Close to convention center also.

Newly remodeled, modern style interior.  Nice atmosphere, clean hotel reasonably priced.  Breakfast ok, typical breakfast buffet-ugh. No bellman service if that is important to you. Coffee Bean located in the same building so a good cup of coffee is close by. Many good restraunt to choose from within walking distance. Good choice would stay again.

Summary Heading: Overall a great stay...just needs to be maintained better
Summary: We booked this hotel as part of our Disney package. We chose the hotel for several reasons: -location -free breakfast -bunk bed family suite -newness  Here is what our thoughts were:  PROS: -Loved the bunkbed room...just enough space for all 5 of us. A bathroom separated the 2 "rooms". A curtain or door between them would have been nice for nap times/sleeping. -Staff was always friendly -Got a discount on our parking thru the company we booked thru, and that included Valet -CVS pharmacy downstairs was a huge plus. We shopped there several times throughout our 4 night stay -The rooftop pool was fun. Great view. -Easy walking distance to Disney. Took 10 minutes to get there. We had a 13 year old, and 2 ten year olds with us and they were fine. Was a little harder at night after we
Manager Response: Dear oregonfamilyof6,  Thank you for sharing your thoughts in regards to your recent stay at our hotel. We truly value the feedback provided by our guests as it allows us the opportunity to better our services. Rest assured, we will use the feedback you have provided regarding the cleanliness of the buffet area, pool deck, hallway carpets, and ice machine trash cans as a learning and training opportunity for our entire team in an effort to continuously improve.  Despite the cleanliness issues you encountered in our public areas, I am extremely glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed the Kid's Suite with the bunk beds as well as the premium location we offer being next to CVS and Disneyland. Saving time in commuting to Disneyland means more time spent with the family in the park!  Hopefully we will have another opportunity to serve you in the future and better your experience with us.   Sincerely, Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Clean!!!  New!!!  Excellent!!!!!!  A Perfect Stay for Disney or Non-Disney Travelers
Summary: I can't say enough positive about this hotel and it's staff.  I stayed here as a solo traveler last week for 3 nights and have absolutely no complaints. The hotel is new, modern and most important, it is CLEAN!!!!  The common areas are spotless and my room was as well. I travel frequently and this hotel rates high on my list of favorites.  The rates were very reasonable, not even considering the location and age of the hotel.  It will be our first choice when returning to the Anaheim area.  Valet:  Parking is $14.00 per day. Self-parking is not available.  Guest cars are parked in a monitored/secure underground garage below the hotel. Valet attendants were courteous and professional.    Wifi:  Complimentary.  Excellent signal!!  Coffee/Breakfast:  Coffee is available at no

We decided to stay at thy convention center Spring Hill Suites, because of its proximity to other attractions in the area. The hotel staff was great. The prking is a little tight due to construction going on around the convention center. Our suite was great. It was very modern. The cleanlyness of the room was great. The housekeeping did their jobs well. Hotel staff was warm and friendly. They answered any questions that I had about the area. Overall, it was a great stay. I would return.

Summary Heading: New, Clean, and excellent staff.  10 Min walk to all parks. Absolutely no complaints
Summary: This is a kid/family friendly hotel and it is busy. It is within a 10 minute walk from Disneyland, California Adventure and Disney Downtown.  It is extremely convenient with CVS downstairs and many restaurants near by.  Access to major roads, highways, and interstates is very easy. The hotel is less than a year old and the rooms are very clean and smell new. The Pool area is busy, but well kept up. At night, families gather to watch the Disney Fireworks.   The staff was always very friendly and helpful.  The road noise is minimized and the hall noise is lower due to the length of the rooms.  The breakfast is busy, but we always found a table and there was always plenty of food.  The families there provided us all with relief in case it was our kid who decided to act up one

Stayed the night before a day at Disneyland.  Warmly greeted at front desk & all of the staff was very friendly.  Our room was #115.  Reasonably spacious for the five of us (3 adults & 2 kids).  Two queens & a fold out couch.  Facility is only two years old & is well maintained.  Large bathroom & large TV.  Breakfast was very good with many choices & very clean area.  We wo u ld come again.

Wasn't our first choice (Springhill Suites Maingate was) but very happy we ended up booking at this hotel.  Amazing location, steps to restaurants and literally across Disney California Adventure park.  The theme parks shuttle stop is in front of the hotel.  The rooftop pool area is best for viewing the nightly fireworks at Disney.  Best of all, the CVS pharmacy below is open 24 hours.  Perfect for purchasing souvenirs and emergency items.  We flew from Canada to visit Disneyland and we would stay at this hotel again in the future.  Will recommend this hotel to everyone we know in Canada and Texas.

We stayed for 8 nights in a family suite and the hotel is not at all spacious and only has one small bathroom. We had 7 in our group and there are 2 rooms with 2 TVs that are in an open space and it is very hard to hear the TV because the room areas are small.  Also having one bathroom for a family was horrible.  And all night you could hear the traffic so sleep will be hard to get unless you drown it out with something else.  The breakfast was tolerable but very limited.  The pool is very small.  The parking was a nightmare.   The "valet" parking consists of staff parking cars everywhere so those who are parked in a parking space are blocked in until the staff move the numerous vehicles blocking other vehicles.  I was told by staff they only have 100 parking spaces and have
Manager Response: Dear GEEWIZ1776,  Thank you for taking a moment to provide us with feedback regarding your recent stay. I sincerely apologize for the negative experiences you had with parking as well as your guest room and regret that we could not meet your expectations. The Kid's Suite you refer to is the second largest room type at our hotel with 440 Sq. Ft. of living space designed to accommodate up to 7 people by offering 2 Queen sized beds, a set of twin bunk beds, and a sofa bed. However, we do offer one larger room type called a Family Suite which may be better suited for your needs. Each Family Suite has 590 Sq. Ft. of living space and is also designed to sleep up to 7 people with a King bed, sofa bed, and set of bunk beds.    With each of our guest rooms being a suite that can accommodate up to 7 guests, sometimes our parking garage can fill up rather quickly. In an effort to accommodate each guest's parking needs, we do offer Valet Parking at no additional cost so that each guest can rest assure knowing their vehicle is well taken care of during their stay. On days that parking is impacted and we begin to run low on available spaces, Valet will double park cars to ensure that each guest vehicle is parked safely in our garage. But should you need assistance in moving a vehicle, please do not hesitate to let our Valet staff know so that they can immediately take action and help get you on your way.   Thank you again for taking the time to let us know of our shortcomings so that we can continue to improve upon our services. Hopefully you will allow us another opportunity to welcome you back in the future so that we may provide you with a much better experience.  Sincerely, Raul E.  Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Good location, stolen items, Rush hour breakfast
Summary: Our family visited Disney and we stayed for 7 nights. For the most part it was a great place to stay. Convenient location. Clean rooms, and nice staff. However, we had a very special, to our son anyway, Mickey we brought from home with bunny ears for Easter. The first couple nights we came in for the day and found it laying against his pillow. We thought that was sweet of the staff for putting it there. Then by the third night it was not there anymore. We did not really think about it because we thought maybe it just was laying around in our hotel room with all the other stuff we had. We had bought other things that were left in the room. On the next to last day we started cleaning and packing to leave and noticed it was gone. We looked everywhere and even notified the offices
Manager Response: Dear Tamsdee,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the hotel's guest rooms, location, and staff during your stay. However, we do apologize that what sounds like an overall pleasant experience was negatively affected by the loss of your Mickey Mouse stuffed animal. Please be assured that guest safety and security is our number one priority and each Lost and Found inquiry we receive is investigated thoroughly to ensure that we aid in the recovery of any lost items. Although our initial search for the item was unsuccessful, please do not hesitate to contact me directly with any additional details you can provide so we may double back on our efforts and ensure each detail is accounted for in our internal investigation for the item.      Sincerely, Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary: Well, this was an EPIC family vaca experience! At 68, Grampy's first visit to MICKEY'S PARK. A wonderful day with 7 family members at DISNEYLAND. And a full 9 hour day it was!  Day 2 we had tickets to STAR WARS CELEBRATION 2015! Another long day of fun, characters, costumes and STAR WARS gear! SpringHill Suites Anaheim is perfectly located for Disney or the big convention in town. The rooms are very large and nicely appointed. Rates are good. Rooftop area has nice pool, exercise room AND PERFECT VIEW OF DISNEYLAND NIGHTIME FIREWORKS!! Morning breakfast very nice. The STAFF is very cordial and most helpful. SAY 'HI' TO MICKEY FOR ME...
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your lovely review of our hotel.  We are so delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! The rooftop pool's view of the fireworks is a wonderful place to see the show at night and a lot of guests choose our property because of our close proximity to the Disneyland Resort and Anaheim Convention Center.  This year was the first year for Star Wars Celebration (we hope for many more in the future) and we are so happy to hear that you had a great time at the event.  Please visit us again with your wonderful family in the future!  Lisa Dickinson Operations Supervisor

Summary: Spring Hill Suites is very close to Disney property. The first level contains a CVS that is open late and a Coffee Bean and Tea.  The hotel appears to be very new and modern.  We had free valet parking which is underground.  Looked like you could also park yourself after you check in.  I checked in with the mobile app and room was ready when we arrived.  The hotel offers a mini store if you need something but with CVS attached, no need.  The hotel has a small bar area.  They serves complimentary breakfast in the mornings.  Nice breakfast with scrambled eggs, a breakfast meat muffins, toast and yogurts.   There are 5 floors to the hotel with the gym and pool on level 5. The pool and gym are have a view for the nightly fireworks. The room was a good size with a mini living room

Summary Heading: Great option for visit to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is a short distance from Disneyland and California Adventure.  If you don't mind walking a little bit to the park you will find this a great place to stay.  The room was great, the lobby is beautiful and the free breakfast was a great way to start the day.  It is attached to a CVS which, at first impression, seemed odd, but in hindsight made getting snacks and drinks pretty easy.

My husband and I stayed here on May 25 and 26.  We requested an upper floor room and got a 5th floor room, facing Harbor.  When I saw that there's a new hotel going up across the street (Hyatt Place with Walgreens downstairs, currently projected to open in September of this year), I thought of calling downstairs to change rooms.  But I noticed that the noise level wasn't bad.  We checked in on Memorial Day around 4PM and Harbor was PACKED!  But for the amount of traffic, the noise wasn't bad at all, and we never did notice the construction noise Tues. and Wed. mornings.  When we pulled up to the parking lot to check in, we didn't realize that you can't get in the garage without a room card.  So we buzzed the front desk, and the front desk guy ran outside and buzzed us in.

Summary Heading: Nice Rooftop Pool; No Hot Tub?
Summary: We stayed here for a five day visit to Disneyland (see that review for further thoughts on Disney). As a platinum elite member I thought I'd get an upgrade but it must not have been available. We did get to check in a bit early and got a room on the fifth floor with a window looking at the Tower of Terror in California Adventure. Got to see the Disney fireworks several nights from our room. The room was comfortable and the housekeeping service was very good. My only complaint about the room was that the shower door handle was very loose and the sliding bathroom door did not lock. Both of these weren't a big deal so I just notified them at checkout.  The lobby was OK but the floors were dirty especially as you approached the elevator area. The breakfast buffet was OK but the hot
Manager Response: Dear nsacky,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the view from your 5th floor guest room during your stay. One of the advantages of our premiere location is the premium views it offers some of our guest rooms.   We also appreciate you informing us upon check-out of the problems you encountered with the shower door handle and sliding bathroom door lock so that our Engineering team was able to correct these issues upon your departure. However, please accept our apology for the cleanliness of the lobby floors as well as the issues you encountered with parking. Please rest assured that your comments have been shared with the housekeeping and valet teams in an effort to improve our service.   Although we are pleased to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us, we do regret that we were unable to exceed your expectations and provide you with a memorable experience. Should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, please do not hesitate to contact me directly so we may ensure you have a more enjoyable stay on your next trip.  Best Regards, Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Really Liked This Hotel for Several Reasons
Summary: My teenage daughter and I stayed here in April for a Disney vacation.  We were pleased with the hotel and the level of service!  First, Mike at the front desk was great!  He was pleasant and welcoming to us. We asked for a quiet room and he delivered.  We were on the fifth floor facing Disney.  The room was huge, clean and well decorated.  And most of all - quiet!!  We slept great!  The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Disney entrance.  (The hotel is right across the street from Disney but you must walk to the entrance.) The breakfast was a bit chaotic but I think that is to be expected.  Breakfast at the attached Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf was much quieter and better alternative.   The attached CVS is extremely convenient!  Would recommend this place for a Disney

I picked this hotel because of the location and you can't get any better than this. You are close to shops and food. Can walk right down the road to Cheesecake Factory, Roy's, and others. Rooms are a great size and my room had a sectional in the front room. Breakfast was good but was very busy due to everyone stay for Disney.

I choose this hotel for a girls trip, specifically because of location, room space and it is only a year old.  Great staff and location.  You can actually walk to Disneyland, but it will take you 10 to 15 min.  The rooms are nice as the ones we wanted had 2 queen beds and 1 queen pullout sofa in the other room.  Now the only thing I wish it would of had was more separation between rooms.  It is open between with one half wall as the separation.  So if one has a family with kids or a spouse  wants to go to bed early and the others want to stay up late, it might be a little difficult. Other than that it was a really nice hotel.  The breakfast was very nice and there is a CVS and a Coffee bean adjacent to hotel.  I do appreciate the whole staff as they really took good care of us!!!

We came here because all our regulars are booked Disney hotel, paradise, grand California. So we tried something new and different we get a call about noise then a security knocks on the door about noise, it doesn't help that there's a TV about 8 ft from the door and bunk beds against the main hallway wall we've never had a complaint and all we do is travel at least two times a month that's really annoying and the nerve of some people to tell me were being loud after years of traveling that's not cool
Manager Response: Dear DG R,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the SpringHill Suites at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center with us. We strive to provide each guest with a good night's rest during their stay and I apologize that you were disrupted in the evening in regards to the noise level. Please be assured that our intentions were aimed at delivering an enjoyable hotel experience for all guests and I apologize if that message was not conveyed properly.  Hopefully we will have another opportunity in the future to welcome you back to the hotel and better your experience with us.   Sincerely, Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary: Stayed 1 night with my husband and kids for a 2-day visit to Disneyland and California Adventure.  Location is convenient and definitely an easy walk to the theme parks.   Breakfast is included and there is a convenience store in the building for snacks.  Rooms are spacious and clean.

Stayed two nights and we were very happy with service, location and amenities. Clean and bright, decent breakfast, easy walk to Disneyland and convenient store on bottom level for snacks and misc items. Employees were all helpful and welcoming. Nice small pool on roof with lots of inviting seating. Will return!

Summary Heading: Would Stay here again - Would recommend to anyone
Summary: I recently stayed at this SpringHill Suites while visiting Anaheim CA.  I was in Anaheim to visit Disney Land and attend Star Wars Celebration Anaheim, and both Disney Property and the Convention Center are easy accessed from this hotel.  I put a lot of thought into where we would be staying (I was traveling in a party of 3) and did a lot of research.  In the end I selected the SpringHill Suites b/c of the extra space, with 3 people spending 10 days in a hotel space was a very important factor.  And while space was my deciding factor this hotel has SO much more going for it.  The rooms are spacious, clean, well lit, and nicely furnished.  I was traveling with 2 other women and between us we had 5 suitcases and 3 carry-ons full of ‘stuff’ and we had plenty of room in the

Summary Heading: Magic location for your Magic visit.
Summary: We ended up booking here because we are a family with 4 kids and we needed a place that serves breakfast but also carried a name like Marriott.  The double queen bed with a pull out couch bed was plenty big enough. The hotel had a great location and a great breakfast and an easy walk to the park. I highly recommend the valet parking as it's a simple tip, and you'll rarely move your car anyways.  The staff were friendly and accommodating and everything was clean. I highly recommend getting done as early as possible for breakfast otherwise it does become a bit of a zoo. That was the only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars. If you're going for early entry and you get there at 630 or 7 when breakfast opens you'll be fine but if you go at 830 when everybody there it's a zoo. My

I picked this hotel because it was the newest in the area, and it's a Marriott.  They're always nice, right?  Um, no.  This hotel was a mess from the second we arrived.  The valet was a disaster.  They had cars everywhere and were confused about what was going on.  They told us you must valet, which turned out to be a lie.  You don't have to.  The lobby was a disaster.  Filthy floors, disorganized staff, no soap in the lobby bathroom (for 2 days!).  Trash overflowing from all of the trash cans. The breakfast was a complete mess.  There were about 20 cups of used batter cups by the waffle machines.  I ended up throwing them all away because it drove me crazy. The room was pretty clean, but I only think that was because it was new. It will be a disaster in another year with the
Manager Response: Dear StotheC,  Thank you very much for your thoughtful feedback.    I am disappointed to hear about the issues that you encountered.  With regards to parking upon your arrival, we offer valet parking during our busiest peak times, such as over Spring Break or high convention dates, in order to speed up service as there can be a great many guests arriving and departing at the same time.  I am sorry that this seems to have had the opposite affect in your situation.  During off peak times, we offer self parking, which is what I believe is at the heart of the seemingly conflicting messages.  I will share your feedback with my team so that we can learn from it and make improvements going forward.  As you have noted, the lobby can be very busy at times.  Given our close proximity to Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center, guests who are heading to the park or to a convention tend to all come down to the lobby for breakfast during the same small window of time, which can make keeping everything in perfect order a bit of a challenge.  As we have only been open a short amount of time, we are still fine-tuning our processes and procedures as well as looking at adjusting our equipment and the layout of the lobby to better serve our customers during all hours of the day.    Despite these challenges, I am glad to hear that you were happy with the cleanliness of your room.    Our housekeeping team takes pride in the important job they do everyday.  I will be sure to pass on your positive message in this area to them.    Thank you again for sharing your experience with us.  Please be assured that I am personally committed to addressing issues such as this when they arise and that my team will continue to make improvements to our product and service in response to what we learn from both our own observations and from feedback we receive from valued guests such as you.  Regards, Lucas

Summary Heading: Large rooms, friendly staff, vibrant, modern and clean
Summary: We booked a group to stay here for a convention.  It was a short walk to the convention center each day.  The hotel was very new and modern.  There was a bit of construction in the lobby area.  But it was nice and clean and there were places for our group to socialize which we loved.  Our room was a great size and very comfortable.  I loved that they had Paul Mitchell Shampoo and Conditioner!  The breakfast in the morning was busy if we came right before they were finishing,  but no big deal to wait a few minutes in line.  Like any restaurant at a busier time.  The food was better than most others I've had at these kinds of hotels.  The beds were comfortable and the rooms had good soundproofing.  Our group booked quite a few rooms and no one really had great views.  But this IS

We stayed in this hotel two nights ago.  It's a nice new hotel so no complaints there and the location is wonderful for visiting Disney or for a convention. The biggest complaint that we had was the noise from the traffic.  Even a white noise app couldn't drown it all out.  Not sure about the view from a higher floor, but you can only see businesses from the 3rd floor.  Parking is an issue so we were forced to valet - no additional charge but then you have to tip.  Breakfast on the weekend doesn't start until 7:00am which I'm sure is typical, but when you're trying to get to the Disney parks before they open, it's too late.  It's hard to complain when you are staying on points, but next time we are paying we will stay at the Hilton next door or a couple of miles away at the

Summary Heading: New clean hotel in great location and FREE breakfast
Summary: The hotel is brand new so is still clean and nice feeling. Things are in good working order.  Fabulous location with a huge CVS drug store and a Coffee Bean coffee shop down stairs. You get free breakfast every morning.  Pool on the roof overlooks fireworks at Disney.    No extra charge valet parking out front so left the car with the kid.  Check in was quick with no line.  Room was nice facing away from Disney... but that also means facing away from busy street so good and bad.  Room was large.  Bathroom clean and nice. Fridge and microwave in our studio suite.  Breakfast each morning was downstairs and was sort of chaotic. However, line moved quickly. They ran out of foods frequently but filled them up quickly when told of the outage. We went to the Grand California one day

Came down to Disneyland with my daughter to spend some girl time together. After a long drive I had reached my destination only to hear from the front desk at another hotel  that my reservations were canceled.  Right away I went online to TripAdvisor and found the SpringHill. I'm extremely happy with the Lovely accommodations, Our Room was very clean and well presented,  The Bathroom very clean and inviting. Parking is limited but the Valet was very helpful. The gentlemen at the front desk were also a delight. I recommend this hotel to everyone.  You can't go wrong. I'm definitely coming back and staying here with my family.  Jess Q.

We had the pleasure of staying here during a cheer competion as well as spring break (Brave, to say the least) however the staff was very friendly, the hotel was in a great location. It was quite a walk for a 5 and 6 year old but overall still close to Disneyland. There was a CVS Pharmacy attached to the hotel which made it convenient to pick up water and snacks. There was an Excellent little restaraunt right across the street that served GREAT Mexican food at a reasonable price (I believe the name was Aiertos or something close) also they had a great pizza place next to the Mexican place, which the kids LOVED (a little pricey $23.00 for a large 2-topping pizza) but if the kids are happy...GREAT. We tried Bubba Gumps down the street (about a 7 minute walk) The lines were

Summary Heading: New hotel, Great place, Reasonably priced, short walk to DIsneyland
Summary: Got tried of paying the high price by staying at Disneyland Resort. I've stay at all three hotels several times. I have to maximize my annual pass. I started staying at off site hotels and found this hotel.  Staff was friendly, rooms clean, nice free breakfast, and short walk to disneyland.

This hotel is fairly new and the amenities are decent. The odd part about the hotel is the parking is s little bothersome and the hotel is on top of a CVS. If you don't need your car that often it really isn't an issue and don't let that detract you from going here. Other than that it's close to Disneyland and a majority of the gods restaurants.

Travelled with my family of 4 to Anaheim for spring break. Of course we were visiting Disneyland and California Adventure. This hotel is walking distance to both parks, plus downtown Disney. Very easy access. (more on transportation in a moment).   The hotel is brand new, very clean, very trendy, and very, very comfortable. The one thing I would change about it is the front door is actually accessed in an alley way, and complete opposite corner of the hotel from the street corner. Provides a quiet lobby, and keeps wanderers out, I guess. Not a problem per se, but once you've walked over 11 miles inside the Disney parks, every step counts!   Our room was a two double queen with a pull out sofa. The room was HUGE! So much space, clean lines, and so comfortable for the family. We

Very happy with our choice to stay here while going to Disneyland/ California Adventure.  The location is about 10-15 minutes walk from the DL, which was awesome for taking the little one back mid-day for his nap.  The CVS in the same building was a life saver!  Probably one of the best things about the hotel. We had a king suite and it was very spacious and being a new property certainly has its perks as it was pretty clean.  Free Wifi and breakfast were also pluses.  I was up early most mornings so the queue to breakfast wasn't bad at all.  The food was so so but it is free so not much to complain about.  Parking was a bit tight on the weekend, but they offer valet service for the same price as self parking so if you struggle you can always take advantage of that.  Overall

Great hotel. Within walking distance to just about everything.  Great continental breakfast in the morning at the hotel lobby. Up the street from Disney and the Anaheim Convention Center. 2 blocks from Morton's Steak House.

Staff at this hotel is very accommodating and always willing to help.  The hotel is within walking distance of the disney gates, but bring a stroller for kids under 5, because it about 10-15 min walk.    Lots of reviews states odd number rooms get view of disney and fireworks, but you get a lot of street noise ( motorcycles and mufflers). If your a light sleeper I'd as for even number room on the back side, much quieter!   There is a small pool and gym on the roof (5th floor) Rooms are spacious and great for kids.

Large space. Clean. Beddings are clean and smell really nice. Large bathroom with modern decor. Pool and sport club were cleaned throughout. Love CVS being next door and open 24 hrs. Can't wait to have a free breakfast  tomorrow morning. Please keep up, we'll be back for sure.
