We were looking for a nice hotel within walking distance of the park.  We usually stay at the Hilton but we have watched the property being built for the past year so we wanted to give it a try,  My sister was joining us so we needed a little extra room on this trip  This would be a great hotel for families or groups where you needed more room and a little privacy.  The rate included breakfast, and parking was only 14.00.  We were thinking of staying further away but once you started adding up what Disney charges for parking and breakfasts at a restaurant , it made sense to  stay here. It was great to walk to the park each day and we also enjoyed having the CVS downstairs. I would stay here again!

Summary Heading: Booked by accident- but was a good mistake!
Summary: My husband was trying to book a room with the other Spring Hill Suites in Anaheim because we enjoyed our stay with them the year prior. This hotel was quite a bit older, and not as "clean" as the other one but there were some good perks. There was a room big enough to accommodate the 5 people in our family, some rooms have bunk beds... and Disneyland was only a half-mile away which put it in walking distance for us. Sure, 1/2 mile adds up over the 3 days we were there, and our feet were worn out by the end of our stay, but there is something to be said for knowing you don't have to rely on making it to your shuttle before their service ends. We could take our take our time. This hotel is located next to a busy street, but other than occasional sirens, the windows were thick
Manager Response: Dear Esteph55,  Thank you for booking your stay in Anaheim at the Springhill Suites Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. Although the booking may have been by accident, we are definitely glad that we had the opportunity to welcome you to our hotel. Like you mentioned, our premier location on the corner of Harbor and Katella makes us an ideal hotel for any family trip to Disneyland. We offer an array of amenities such as an outdoor pool, rooftop deck, and complimentary breakfast buffet which allows each guest to personalize their own stay and ensure they enjoy their time while on vacation.  Thank you again for your review as it allows us the opportunity to continue to improve our services. Your time, business, and feedback are greatly appreciated.   Best Regards, Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent stay at this perfectly located hotel...
Summary: When we planned our vacation to Los Angeles, one of the main activities we planned for our trip was visiting Disneyland. Although we were renting a car we wanted to stay in a hotel that would allow us to walk to Disneyland, hence avoid having to worry about driving and parking. Besides being very close to Disneyland, this hotel offered many other benefits which made us choose to stay here. Some of the benefits are: the fact that this is a newly constructed property and it shows, the rooms are spacious with great distribution, they offer daily breakfast with enough options and very well presented and restocked continuously, walking distance to Disneyland, CVS pharmacy located within the property, free internet, near several restaurants and located in a safe area. I would

Summary Heading: Perfect for our family Disney trip.
Summary: Really enjoyed staying here. It's about a 12 minute walk to Disneyland. Our room had 2 Q beds, sofa sleeper and bunk beds. Perfect for 3 adults and 4 teens and a toddler. It was clean and the beds comfortable even the sofa sleeper which is rare.  Breakfast included typical items along with eggs & sausages. It's free which saves $. If you're picky eat somewhere else. Didn't use the rooftop pool but the rooftop area was nice.  Yes, they charge $14 for parking. You should expect to pay for parking at most hotels in this area. Got to see fireworks from windows. Hint- noticed that at least on fourth floor, all odd numbered rooms faced Disney park..hope I'm not wrong. Ours faced it. So to recap, clean room, comfortable beds, free breakfast, close to Disney parks. My kids loved this

Summary Heading: One of the best options for families!
Summary: This is our fourth time to Disneyland and we cancelled our reservation for the Residence Inn in Garden Grove to try the new Springhill Suites. As a family of five (with three boys), we always look for hotels that have suites and free breakfast and this hotel did not disappoint - plus we got an excellent rate for the week were were there ($111/night). That said, unless you have a high tolerance for the Disney crowd, I would not recommend this hotel to a business traveler.   Yes, breakfast is very crowded. Coming from the East Coast, we were early risers and didn't have too much trouble as we were there early. But we did see the lines (and the mess) later in the morning. I didn't see any staff members cleaning the areas either and one morning there was no coffee (even at 6:45 am)

Summary Heading: Nice rooms get up early if you want breakfast
Summary: The hotel is less than 10 minute walk to Disneyland. The rooms are well laid out and clean. The staff friendly. But management has decided that 9 am is as late as breakfast should be served. This is on a day when the park didn't open until 10am. The line at 8:55 am was 30 + people long. Before everyone made it thru the line they quit replacing hot food. If I was at lesser motel chain I would chalk it up to a bad decision on my part but this was a Marriott brand. I expect more that I got at this Springhill Suite.
Manager Response: Dear moto39,  I apologize for the unsatisfactory experience you had at our complimentary breakfast buffet during your stay. We make every attempt to ensure that each guest is served to their satisfaction during the buffet's operating hours and I sincerely regret that we did not meet your expectations. I assure you that we will utilize your feedback to better the experience of each guest that stays with us.   Best Regards, Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary: I stayed here on a business trip for a convention at the Disneyland Convention Center.  The hotel is clearly geared toward families visiting the Disney Parks.  Fortunately, I was there during the week while school was in session, so it was not crowded.  Given the poor soundproofing, I would not like to be there during the busy times.  I had plenty of room, since I was by myself in a room that could handle a family of six.  Unfortunately, the only desk was sized for third-graders.  Cute though.    My only real complaint is with the housekeeping staff.  They never did replenish the in-room coffee, and I had to call the desk to send some up every day.  They also failed to replace the used coffee cups and dirty glasses.  They did, however, replace all the towels every day, even
Manager Response: Dear Le_Calmar,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your most recent trip to Anaheim. I apologize that the Housekeeping service provided during your stay failed to meet your expectations. I assure you that we will use this as a learning opportunity with our Housekeeping team and will make every effort to continue to improve our services.   Your time, business, and feedback are greatly appreciated.  Best Regards. Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary: The hotel and staff were very nice. The parking garage is a little tight and fills up quickly during the weekend.The pool area is nice during fireworks, we did miss having a jacuzzi. The exercise room was adequate, the laundry room was a nice extra. The rooms were large enough for the six of us. The only down fall would be no bathtub, and the noise level. The air conditioner and water pump/heater seemed to click on and off all night long and was very noisy, but tolerable. The free breakfast was not too bad, definetly could have had a little more variety, but it was free! The staff was also very accommodating, they really do make the stay more comfortable. Would definitely stay again! Hopefully they foresee a hot tub in the future. Also the CVS pharmacy below the hotel is

This hotel has been open since late October 2014, but i'm not sure its ready to be open even now. Upon arrival to the hotel things seemed fairly quite, but as soon as families started to end thier days at Disney it was a bit noisy. The walls are fairly thin you can hear your neighbors on all four sides. We had a room facing the hotel adjcent to the Springhill. Our room was fairly clean. The bathroom is already falling apart however. There was a towel stuffed under the sink. We assumed this ment the sink already had issues with leaking. The sink itself looked to be seperating from the counter.   The hallways leave you with black bottomed feet if you walk barefoot to the pool or to get ice. Ick! The pool on the roof is nice to watch fireworks from. There however is only a pool. It
Manager Response: Dear grlnxtdor,  Please accept our apology for the unsatisfactory experience you had during your stay at our hotel. I certainly understand the frustrations you must have felt regarding the noise coming from neighboring guest rooms, the substandard cleanliness of the hotel hallways, and the bustling breakfast buffet. We strive to provide our guests with an exceptional experience during their stay and I apologize that we have fallen short. We have addressed your concerns regarding the attentiveness of the breakfast staff directly with the team in order to use your feedback as a learning opportunity. I assure you that this level of service is unacceptable and we will continue to make this a priority for all guests moving forward.   Thank you again for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. Hopefully we will have another opportunity in the future to better your experience with our hotel.  Best Regards, Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Family of 6 loved this Disneyland Option
Summary: We were so excited to have this new option for our Disneyland stays and couldn't wait to try it out. Overall we were very pleased. We have children ages 3, 6, 10, & 13 and the 10 minute walk was not ever an issue during the 3 days we went to the parks. We didn't experience the mayhem at breakfast that others have described - everyone was orderly and there was always plenty of food for everyone. Items were well-prepared, presented and well-stocked. Our only "complaint" would be that on Saturday, when Disneyland has its early morning hour at 7am, the breakfast doesn't start until 7am. We were able to grab some cereal and a drink on the way out the door, but starting at 6:30am on Saturdays would be helpful to those families. Other than that, no complaints about the breakfast

This is a new hotel and we were hesitant to stay here because we have always stayed at the Marriot Convention Way. This hotel has less hustle bustle from the convention.  It is very clean. Has a extensive breakfast buffet. The staff is very friendly and efficient. It has a CVS that is on the main floor. This was very convenient and had snacks, sandwiches, drinks, alcohol, etc. This is a very family friendly hotel. The roof top pool was a very nice touch.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Keep your Luggage
Summary: Stayed here for a convention/trip to Disneyland.  This hotel has a great location.  Right on the corner of Katella and Harbor.  It took me 7 minutes to walk to the turnstiles at Disneyland.  The only reason I did not give 5 stars is because I had a room on the exact corner of the hotel that faced the two main roads, and it got a little noisy while I was trying to sleep.  Everything else is perfect.  Nice rooms.  Nice floor plan of the room.  Great rates.  Decent breakfast, very similar to other Springhill hotels.

Summary Heading: Great Location, plenty of families with small children
Summary: Stayed from 1/30-2/2.  Associates/staff were all outstanding.  I'll say right up from the start that I personally think you can't get a better location than this if your planning to visit the Disneyland Resort or attend an event at the convention center.  My room was very clean upon arrival and throughout my stay, and everything was in working order. Floors appear "light" as I can hear the footsteps from the room above.  I just wished the guest staying above me had more respect and consideration.  Since this is close to a theme park, be expecting lots of families with small children who can tend to make a lot of noise around the clock since the park may close as late as midnight.  There was plenty of parking in the basement, but the entry on the ground level into the parking lot

Unfortunately this hotel isn't quite ready yet. Between the undermanned free buffet and the lackluster cleaning crew for the room, our stay is just so-so at best. The free breakfast buffet offers pre-made scrambled eggs and "sausage". The kids enjoyed the waffle maker when the batter was available. The scene at the buffet area was complete chaos after 8am and instant birth control for those without kids. Paper plates everywhere, trash cans full, and limited staff to assist those who can't seem to clean up after eating. It was crazy.  We stayed due to the proximity, however I don't think we'll opt for this location do to the many, many flaws.  Hopefully they get better in time.
Manager Response: Dear David J,  Thank you for providing us with feedback regarding your stay. I apologize for the unsatisfactory experience you had at our complimentary breakfast buffet and sincerely regret that we did not meet your expectations. We make every effort to ensure that during breakfast each guest is serviced to their satisfaction and that the dining area is cleaned and well maintained. Please be assured that we have shared your comments with the breakfast staff in order to continue to improve our performance.   Thank you again for your comments and we look forward to providing you with a better experience should your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Best Regards, Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Great place, got the job done
Summary: I recently stayed here during a business trip, and found it to be very clean with spacious rooms, free high-speed internet, and a decent location.  With a AAA rate, the pace is very reasonable.  I'd definitely stay here again.

My family and I stayed at the Springhill Suites at Anaheim at the beginning of January 2015. We stayed for one night in the Kids Suite with Bunk Beds.  Our family was very surprised with the size of the room and how clean it was.  But, that's where it ends.  We had the worst sleep ever.  Our room was located on the 2nd floor facing California Adventure.  Because the window occupies the entire wall, all you could hear the entire night was the traffic.  Our bed was in front of the large AC/Furnace duct, so when it kicked in, it sounded like a jackhammer.  Furthermore, the vent was located on top of the duct and it blew cool air on us all night.  My daughters slept in the bunkbeds.  When we woke up in the morning, my youngest daughter had moved to the couch during the night and
Manager Response: Dear sgka1234,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with feedback regarding your recent stay. Please accept my sincere apology for the unsatisfactory experience you had at our hotel. I understand how frustrating and inconvenient it must have been not being able to enjoy a good night's rest on the evening of your stay. Please be assured that we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel teams to ensure these issues are immediately addressed and corrected moving forward.   Thank you again for sharing your experience with us as it allows us the opportunity to learn from our shortcomings and improve upon them. Should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, please do not hesitate to contact me directly so that we may better your experience with us.   Best Regards, Raul E. Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Hotel has no hot tub, but the rooms were huge and clean!
Summary: We booked a very last minute trip and this hotel was the closest one to Disneyland that could accommodate our family.  The room was huge, with 2 queen beds, a pull out sofa bed and bunk beds.  This room would easily sleep 7-8 very comfortably. The only downfall to that scenario would be that the rooms only have one bathroom, but the lobby bathrooms are large and clean.  Walking around Disneyland for 12 hours, you tend to want to soak your "barking dogs", but alas, there is no jacuzzi tub.  The rooftop pool and deck are wonderful for viewing the fireworks, but once again, there is no jacuzzi tub.  This was the only major negative for this otherwise well appointed and wonderfully staffed hotel.  Parking can be a challenge, but that is to be expected due to the location.  There is

This is a really nice place.  The rooms are beautiful and they are close to DisneyLand.  However they really need to replace their staff.  The rooms were filthy when we got there, and every day we complained about the cleanliness.  We got an apology but not a clean room.  They had a young front staff girl that was horrible and rude. We had a specific issue with the hotel they refused to address or fix.  After leaving, I called back and spoke to management.  Their response is Im sorry, offering nothing in the way of amends.  This is not a direct Marriott and it shows.  I have sent my complaint to Marriott directly and hope they remove the francisee status.  It is really unfortunate that the rooms are large modern and beautiful and they probably will not suffer from this review

I don't have any groundbreaking new information that hasn't been mentioned,but maybe a recap. We were impressed with the large family suite with bunk beds, two queens, and a fold out couch!  It's new, so the rooms and hotel are nice and clean.  It is close to the Disneyland entrance,but after a long day walking around Disneyland,sometimes it felt a little long.  A couple times we grabbed a cab outside Disneyland,and it only cost around $5. There is a small strip mall diagonal from the hotel with a variety of food options that we used several times. Much cheaper than eating in the park.  The pizza place was a family favorite. Parking is a little tough, and $14 a day, but once we parked the first day we never moved, and that was nice. Breakfast was good, not great, totally

We visit Disneyland several times a year and have stayed in hotels all up and down Harbor.  We had seen the SpringHill Suites being built and so when it opened we were looking forward to trying it out.  It did not disappoint.  We had the "Kids Suite".  2 queens, a bunk bed, and a sofa sleeper.  Plenty of room. 2 TVs and a nice bathroom in between the 2 sections.  I didn't actually have any "kids" with me.  3 adults and a 13 year old.  The only negative I would say that would be an annoyance to families with small children is the lack of a bathtub.  The big shower was great for us though!  Also, the bunk beds are on the side of the room by the door.  As a paranoid parent that would make me nervous. The beds were comfy.  The towels were plentiful.  Good water pressure and the

This hotel was a great find. We are a family of 5 who stayed in a room with 2 queens & the pullout sofa. More than enough room for us all for 4 days. Fantastic location for visiting Disneyland. Maybe a 15 min walk to the gate. Free breakfast was great with plenty of variety. Sure, it's not a buffet, but plenty to start the day & more then adequate choices.  This hotel also has a 24 hour gym & coin op washing machines. The CVS pharmacy underneath sells everything you could need for a few days. Plenty of eating options within walking distance also. Staff could not have been more helpful. They were all fantastic, friendly, welcoming and accommodating with every request. Overall, a fantastic stay.

Summary Heading: Great location for walking to Disneyland
Summary: Family (2 adults w/ 5 kids ages 3-17) stay at the new Springhill Suites Anaheim convention center.  Came highly recommended by travel agent, but ended up booking directly as I was able to get a better rate on my own.  Plus, we like Marriott properties--for the most part, you tend to know what to expect from Marriott locations.  Had read other reviews reporting street and construction noise, so I asked the front desk where they would recommend for a more quiet location.  They recommended the third floor (stayed #325) as all of the rooms in our category face the road.    Stayed three nights in a Kids Bunk suite--2 Q, sofa bed, and twin bunk.  Street noise was audible, but the room fan on low was loud enough to cover the noise and give a quiet night's sleep.  Hotel offered two

Summary Heading: Our new home when at Disneyland.
Summary: We loved our stay at Springhill Suites. The proximity to the park is wonderful, the CVS located next door was perfect, and the facilities were outstanding.  The breakfast was well stocked, and the breakfast staff were very friendly. The rooms were spotless, and very comfortable for our large family. I will be bringing my family back here whenever we return to Anaheim.

Our family of five had a great experience staying at this hotel.  We stayed in the suite with bunk beds.  The room was quite spacious and my husband and I liked having our own area to relax.  The beds were super comfortable.  Each one of my picky eaters was able to find something they liked to eat at the breakfast buffet.  They all loved the teddy bear waffle maker.  I really liked the scrambled eggs and my husband  appreciated all of the fresh whole fruits.  Having CVS below the hotel was a life saver when my littlest developed a horrible cough in the middle of the night.  The walk to Disneyland was not bad at all.  It was close enough to see the fireworks from our bedroom window.

My family and I were looking forward staying for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland.  I had booked a room with a king bed and bunk beds since it was my husband and I  and our 10 & 15 year old kids. I booked this room since October and a week before our stay on December 25 I called to confirm the room and most importantly the bunk beds. Our kids were excited and looking forward staying on this type of room. I was told that everything was fine. When we arrived on December 29, I was received by a front receptionist (Nikki) which informed me that my room ONLY included a king bed. I asked her to talk to the manager because there was a mistake. I then was transfer to manager Kevia Jones which said that EXPEDIA MADE mistakes ALL THE TIME IN REGARDS TO THE TYPE OF ROOM that she could
Manager Response: Dear aer600,  Please accept my apology for your unsatisfactory experience at the hotel.  I can understand how frustrating it must have been for you to arrive at our hotel expecting one thing only to receive another.  We do our best to ensure that third party booking companies, including Expedia, are giving potential guests all of the information they need to make informed choices.  In your specific case, we were informed that you reserved a King size bed without bunk beds.  Once you brought the situation to our attention, we would have moved you to a room with bunk bed if one was available.  Unfortunately, with both this hotel and most others in the area being sold out due to the winter break, we simply did not have that room type available.  I am very sorry that the team at the hotel did not convey this message with an appropriate level of sensitivity.  You have my promise that we have discussed the situation and used it as a learning opportunity for the team.  Please also be assured that we have reached out to Expedia to let them know about the situation and to confirm that they are displaying the correct information, though without seeing what you saw on your screen when booking back in October or being on the phone with you when you called them to before arriving to confirm the room type, it is difficult for us to pinpoint the specific cause of the failure.       Thank you again for sharing your experience with us as it gives us the opportunity to learn from and grow.  Regards, Lucas Fiamengo General Manager

Summary: My family of 6 stay at this hotel to be able to go Disneyland.  Well on the morning of 4th Jan. The breakfast really was not up to Marriot standards.  We had to wait for eggs, bacon and the waffle machine area was really dirty  and machine just bad bad waffles.  we also had to keep asking the staff to get more.    My kids love stay at the Marriot. We stay at other location had no problems.    I am hoping that this location improves how they treat the guest in the morning.  I will say the my kids were hungry after the stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback regarding your stay at our hotel.  I am sorry to hear that you had issues with our complimentary breakfast buffet during this busy holiday season.  We will take a look at how to improve our waffle station since that is such a popular feature of the buffet, especially for children who sadly love to make a mess of the waffle batter.  We appreciate your comments and look forward to the chance of improving our service so as to provide you with a better experience when your travels bring you back our way. Hope you have a Happy New Year.  Lisa Dickinson Operations Supervisor

Summary Heading: Nice new option for Disneyland visitors, except...
Summary: Let me start by saying that it's REALLY nice to have a real hotel, with indoor hallways and all, that's affordable and suitable for families within walking distance of Disneyland.  I've stayed at other Springhill Suites before and this one was about what I expected.  The rooms were large, bright, comfortable and clean.  There was no bathtub, however, so bathing small children might be difficult.  There also wasn't a safe.  Everything else was provided, though--with plenty of storage space.  The bathroom was spacious, but all-enclosed, so no separate area for those just needing the sink/mirror.  The hotel sits on a busy intersection (Harbor and Katella), so rooms could get noisy from traffic, although that didn't bother us at all.  (The air conditioning unit was loud, so it

Stayed here Dec. 26-29 We arrived early morning(9am) and asked front desk if we could park while we waited for our room.  Parking was granted promptly so we went off to have lunch and familiarize ourselves with the surroundings.  We checked back at 1pm(normal check in @3pm) and a room was available. 4th floor facing the Hilton. The CVS/Coffee bean and tea leaf are very convenient as they are just downstairs.    Kids loved the room of 2 double beds and pullout couch.  The 2 flat screens were perfect..1 for cartoons and 1 for sports.  Bathroom and shower are in the middle of the room which was nice.  Room was spacey and clean.  In-room wifi was great! 5th floor pool area was also great for viewing fireworks from Disneyland.    Staff was courteous and helpful.  They had park

We stayed at this property for seven days over Christmas.  Great location in relation to parks.  Ten minute walk at most, never felt I needed a shuttle.  Pool on rooftop nice and even not all that cold as it is heated.  Con for now, there is still construction going on up on the pool area and no jacuzzi, but once done there is major potential for enjoying fireworks from up there.  Front desk staff was a pleasure upon check-in.  We were very early and they happily stored our luggage while we spent the afternoon at parks. Double queen room for 3 of us was very roomy.  Two beds in sleep area with tv and sofa (not comfortable though), chair and tv in sitting area.  Room also had plenty of drawers for all.  We were on 5th floor and they were still doing all the finishing touches to

December trip to disney with 4 teenagers.  Booked two rooms and was able to get them close together.  Our room faced Katella and we had a great view of the fireworks!   Traffic was a bit noisy, but we just left the fan running and it was fine.   Rooms are very nicely sized and we loved having the separate sitting room.  Having breakfast included was ideal.  It was definitely busy, but we arrived shortly after opening each morning and it was fine.  Good selection of foods and things were replenished regularly. Distance to the park is perfect for walking.  We have stayed next door at the Portofino several times and this was a definite upgrade! CVS is great for purchasing snacks and they had a good assortment of disney souvenirs as well. One warning, there is a new hotel being

Summary Heading: Amazing stay and so close to the main gate.
Summary: I loved this hotel.  The breakfast was great,  the staff was so friendly, and the rooms were very nice.  I enjoyed the beds, the TV's & the free wifi.  My kids loved the in room bunk beds. Plenty of room to sleep 5 or even 7 guests.   Two television sets were nice and the bathrooms were large too.  One of my favorite stays at a hotel!

Why does one go to Disney? For your kids ofcourse. We booked a kids suite for our stay at Springhill Suites. The kids suite comes with bunkbeds along with 2 full size beds. This was perfect for our family. The kids were extremely happy with their bunkbeds, first time in their life they've been exposed to a bunk bed.This enhanced their Disney vacation. Not only did it have bunkbeds for the kids, it had a desk for kids to use along with a TV on that side as well. We had 2 TV's in the room, which was excellent. We were able to enjoy and so were they.   The rooms are nice and clean. This is a new hotel after all. Parking was 14$ a night. I did read reviews where people had a hard time finding parking, however we did not have that problem. The hotel has a CVS on the lobby level which

This hotel was well located, not far from Disneyland or Downtown Disney both comfortable walking distance. It has a CVS underneath & next door. Restaurants and fast food places across the road/corner. We had a room for 2 adults & 3 teenagers, with 2 doubles and a sofa bed which was spacious for the price. Clean and very comfortable. The staff were great checking us in early which was helpful after a long hall flight and free internet access & access to printing facilities was also a plus. Also very helpful with Maps and advice. The Disney fireworks could be seen and heard from the rooftop terrace/pool area. Breakfast was as expected but a bit crazy late in the morning when lost of families& kids present. A tip is to have an early breakfast! Good gym.  The hotel was a bit noisy

Our family stayed here while visiting Disneyland for a couple of days. The staff was friendly and welcoming while checking in and the room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable and they provide firm and soft pillows. My only issue with this hotel was the bathroom. It's large but not especially functional as it lacks in hooks to hang towels near the shower and doesn't offer much in counter space. I also saw ants in the bathroom and on the second day of our stay we couldn't get the shower to produce water hotter than luke warm. Might want to check with the hotel and/or read other reviews to see if the hot water was a fluke before booking.

Summary Heading: Great new option for the resort area
Summary: We stayed 4 nights shortly after the hotel opening. The property is definitely within walking distance to the Disney parks, and a comfortable walk at that. The rooms were very big, and provided enough space for a family of 5. I cant say enough positive about the staff and overall experience. While they had a few bugs to work out with the breakfast and keeping up on the weekend, it was a race weekend, and rather crowded. Everything else was fantastic! WE will be back on our next DL trip!

Rooms were very clean, modern decor, lobby was clean and lively, staff was very friendly and engaging. The hotel is a few minutes walking distance from Disneyland and the Convention Center. Great location. There is a 24hour CVS pharmacy downstairs that proved very convenient. Didn't make it to the top floor Jacuzzi/gym/balcony but I would assume those facilities were very nice based off the rest of the hotel. There is a $14 daily fee to park your  car in the underground garage but that beats the expensive and crazy parking at Disney!! With the hotel being walking distance from the park, rooms and bathrooms very clean, beds super comfy and clean, and staff very friendly, I'd give this hotel an A. It wasn't too expensive either compared to the other rates around the area. This

Hotel location was great for Disneyland. Found no issues with parking. Room was clean and as pictured. Breakfast was perfect to start your day. Plenty of options and an apple for a day :).  Shower pressure was an issue but not a major drawback.  Overall we enjoyed our stay and will definitely recommend it when visiting Disneyland.

We just stayed here December 10-14 for a trip to Disneyland to celebrate a special birthday!  So happy we chose this place.  The people at the front desk and bar were amazingly nice and helpful.  Lobby area was great.  The breakfast in the morning was perfect for our family.  We brought our small Boston Terrier dog and she was treated quite well!  The room...... Quite a nice surprise!  It was so spacious.  The beds were very comfy. While booking, I read the room slept 6, so we invited two more family members from so cal to "bunk" with us.  There was plenty of room for all.  The CVS was so convenient as was The Coffee Bean.  The walk to Disneyland was easy but we did try the ART bus one day.  It was fine, too.  Absolutely no complaints and can't wait to come back!

Summary Heading: The definitive choice for your Disneyland family.
Summary: Great value, convenient location, spacious rooms, and excellent customer service; Springhill Suites is the definitive choice for your Disneyland family.   Upon first arriving at the hotel, I was a bit confused as I didn’t know where to park. The entrance to the underground parking garage currently is not clearly marked. Upon inquiring at the front desk I was pointed in the right direction and assured that signage would soon rectify the problem.   Checking in was quick and easy and the gentlemen at the front desk was attentive and helpful in answering any questions I had. The lobby is well decorated, I especially like the virtual fish tank behind the front desk. There’s plenty of great spots to sit and socialize throughout the lobby area including a home away from home theater.

Summary Heading: Great new hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: The Springhill Suites is a new hotel that is at the intersection of Harbor Blvd and Katella. We had a king size room and it was very roomy with a pullout bed and 2 TVs , a microwave, and small refrigerator. They offer a free breakfast buffet with enough choices to accomodate most types of diets.However the lines were constant and the wait staff non-existent so toast and coffee became breakfast most days. We had an issue with hot water in our shower. Every morning we were there the water was cold if we showered at night the water was fine. The front desk person comped our parking for the inconveince which was nice of her. There is a CVS adjoining the lobby and also a great new Coffee bean. Parking was $14 a day which is average in this area and there was plenty of parking. We

This is a brand new hotel right on the corner of Harbor Blvd. and Katella Ave., walking distance to Disneyland and California Adventure. It is very clean and the rooms are spacious. There is a nice lobby and there is a CVS Pharmacy located on the main level of this hotel which is very convenient for snacks or anything you may need while on your trip. A really nice feature that this hotel has is a rooftop pool, lounge area and fitness center. You can see California Adventure's Paradise Pier from the rooftop. It is  a really nice setup.  There is an underground parking garage at this hotel with a 7' clearance. It is a tight turn to get down into the garage and it is not very well marked. Very happy with this hotel and my family and I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, just don't bring your kids if they are bratty!
Summary: Stay here on business so my review is from a business perspective. I'm Marriott Platinum and have stayed at many places. This ranks near the top.  Strengths  1. Well-designed rooms. Functional, modern and cozy. No issues. 2. Windows. They do not open but truly keep noise out. I don't mind facing the street as the sound insulation is top grade. 3. Pool deck. Well designed next to the gym, with an adequate pool area. Also like the outdoor furniture and couches. 4. Convenience. There is a 24 hour drug store downstairs, enough said. 5. Staff. Although recently opened, very proficient and professional.  Weaknesses  1. Kids. Lots of kids. That's not the issue. The issue is parents who let their very young kids roam freely during breakfast brunch. I've seen plates being reused by kids

I really wanted to like this hotel as it was new and close to Disneyland, but came away not so impressed!. This is a new property six weeks or so old so I will cut them some slack. The breakfast area was horrendously bad. No sense of urgency with the staff as far as keep the area clean or restocking. I was so disappointed in this. The hot food that was brought out was wrapped all in plastic so when you scooped the eggs you would be scraping the plastic that lined the container, so odd. The area was a disaster. Food all over the place and it just seemed like they could not keep up. They seriously need to re evaluate how to better serve their guests. The room was Ok at best. If you are a business traveler the art decco desk chair they have at the desk is a joke. Seriously how you

This hotel is brand new. The decor in the rooms and lobby are upgraded and modern. The staff was very helpful when we arrived early and our room was not ready they allowed us to park our car in the parking lot instead of at Disneyland. They do charge for parking $14 per day but it is worth it. You can walk to Disneyland so no need to move your car. It took us about 10-15 min to walk to the park with my 83 yr old grandmother.   There is a CVS just below the hotel where were able to pick up snacks to take to the park.   The hotel offers a breakfast buffet. There was cereal, oatmeal, eggs, sausage, waffles, fruit and different kinds of pastries. This was very nice to have. There is plenty of seating for everyone, it never felt crowded.  We will definately be staying here again.

Excellent location, friendly staff, clean, modern and convenient. Breakfast was very good and included. Comfortable beds, pillows, and furnishings. The very sad part was the noise level.  SUPER loud in our room facing Harbor.  You could hear every motorcycle, bus, car or garbage truck that went by. We stayed on the 2nd floor and had to complain about our neighbors above stomping around at all hours of the night and morning.  I would stay at this property again, however I  would be particular of which room we stayed in. Its really too bad that they did not insulate a little better.

Summary Heading: Modern, Close to Disneyland, Great for bigger families!
Summary: We stayed at Springhill Suites Nov 18-22 for our Disneyland trip and I can't say enough how great our stay was.  The rooms are new and modern, we had plenty of space in the Kids suite which is awesome and it's an easy 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  The breakfast was awesome...waffles, eggs, sausage, fruit, yogurt, juice, cereal, lots of different sweet breads, bagels, english muffins, oatmeal etc... We are a family of 6 and it was very convenient and roomy and the kids loved the bunk beds.  The staff was very friendly as well.  CVS is on the main floor and that was convenient for a few snacks etc... for the park as well.  Some of the previous reviewers are a bit over critical in my opinion.  We couldn't have been more pleased.  A few of the downfalls are that it is a bit noisy

Our family stayed at this hotel nov 20-23 on a recent trip to visit Disneyland. This hotel worked really well for us. Our room had two queen beds plus two bunk beds and a couch, two TVs, a mini fridge and a microwave. The beds were super comfortable. The two sleeping areas were separated by the bath area and so were semi-private. The price included a decent self service breakfast--the coffee was really good. It takes a good 20 minutes to walk to the Disney gates and there is no shuttle. Still, the hotel is definitely close enough to come back to for a mid-day break. One side of the hotel sides to a busy street and rooms on that side are much louder. There is a roof top deck/pool with a view towards the parks and the fireworks. The location and extra amenities of this hotel

Summary Heading: Average hotel - Nice and new though
Summary: So I travel to hotels frequently. This hotel is a new location which I'm sure some of the faults are just because they're new. Let's start with the good.   The hotel is brand spanking new. The lobby is gorgeous, the rooms are decent, the furnishings and bathrooms are modernized. Certainly something to be proud of. The TVs are amazing, the channel line is sucks though, not enough local channels. The beds are comfortable, the staff seems friendly (except for the breakfast staff, they seem stressed from the influx of children which I totally understand, it's annoying on a weekend) and parking isn't bad (it's underground). Now, the cons.   I'm an Internet Nazi. I have so many experiences with hotel Internet and I have to say the Internet at this property is way below average. We

I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel on November 1st. It was absolutely beautiful! The rooms were comfortable and spacious, with a cute little sitting area and a pull out sofa, dreamy comfortable beds, and the breakfast was absolutely delish! But my favorite part of the whole hotel was the pool deck! It was absolutely beautiful, with large windows over looking the park and plenty of seating to watch the fireworks! It was the most relaxing way to watch the Disneyland fireworks, and to have the kids swimming in the pool instead of standing in a crowd while we wait to see the fireworks is an amazing bonus! There is also a CVS store, right at the entrance to the hotel that made everything so convenient! I can't tell you what a relief it was to be able to purchase a new charge

I stayed here for Blizzcon and rented 2 rooms, 201 and 203, side by side, and both were equally solid, although 201, since it was in the corner and had 2 glass walls, provided wonderful views.  The construction next door and the tourists made noise somewhat annoying, but no fault on the property, it's simply the unique location of this hotel, double edged sword, but overall great for attending an event at the convention center.  It's right across the street from Disneyland, and as such breakfast is something of a disaster area, but again no fault on the property, its simply the overwelming numbers of tourists and uncontrolled children plowing through the buffet like pigs through a trough. Back to the property though, the staff was pretty wonderful, and Diana at the front desk

Location: We walked with a double stroller and hit every red light and still made it to the main gate of Disneyland in 10 minutes. Access and underground parking are located on the back of the building (the front and side access points are for the CVS pharmacy on the ground floor). The lobby: The lobby is modern and styled well. A very good hot breakfast buffet is served every morning with waffles, oatmeal, sausage, eggs, muffins, etc... It was quite good all 4 days that we stayed. Check in was quick and easy and we headed to our room on the third floor.   Room: Our room was away from the main road, so no view, but very quiet. I am 99% sure that we were the first people to stay in our room because there was still a tiny bit of construction dust around the shower, but it was

We recently stayed at this SpringHill Suites during a multi-day trip to Disneyland.  Now keep in mind that the hotel had only been open for 4 days before our stay so they are still settling in.   I am going to rate this location a B to B+ at this point but I believe in a few weeks they are probably going to be closer to A.    This hotel is on the corner of Harbor & Katella.  With the exception of the hotel/motels directly across from Disney (and most of these places are getting long in the tooth) you are not going to get any closer to Disneyland.   10 minute walk at most to main gates.  PROS:     Close to Disneyland and Convention Center.  New hotel so it’s clean, clean, clean.   We stayed in suite with One King Bed, and there was a  large sofa in separate sitting area that
